Get the word out and make some noise about the Tree of Life campaign, tell your friends and family.
Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!
Lastly, send any thoughts or words of wisdom, positive support or share your experiences with me as I would love to share them with those who are close to me!
Now let the journey begin, with a path paved on the road, the next step is to fill the path with the love we are given and spread it to those that we love!
 
                                   
                                                   Quotes
                "Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself."                                               • George Bernard Shaw  
                  "Today you are You, that is truer than true. There is no one 

                                        alive who is Youer than You."                                                 

                                                                • Dr. Seuss

story:
My name is Hahna. I lived in Miller Scholarship Hall from 2008-2012 while I did my undergrad at University of Kansas. Miller Hall is a unique living situation for women who are academically gifted and have financial need. Forty-nine women live in the hall, do all their own cooking and cleaning, and work co-operatively.

This scholarship would provide unlimited yoga classes for the academic year at OmTree Shala, located half a mile from the hall, as well as a yoga mat and non-plastic water bottle for the recipient. OmTree Shala is a beautiful studio with instructors who are knowledgeable, kind, and encouraging. The studio offers hot hatha, power vinyasa, yin, and yoga nidra classes at all levels.

I firmly believe that yoga is an invaluable gift to anyone. The effect that yoga, particularly the classes I’ve taken at OmTree Shala, has had on my life has been profound. I started my practice after graduation in 2012, soon after OmTree opened, and I immediately recognized the impact it would have had on my life as a student. Unfortunately, yoga essentials and classes are expensive and even though OmTree is a particularly affordable option, many college students still don’t have the money to spend on it. The goal of this scholarship is to provide the opportunity and necessary tools for a personal yoga practice. This scholarship has the ability to improve quality of life and provide skills and strength (both physical and emotional) for the recipient.


What We Need & What You Get


The cost of the nine months of unlimited classes at OmTree is $720, a natural yoga mat can range from $25-$80, and glass water bottles range from $10-$15. Any money raised that exceeds what is necessary for the first year of the scholarship will be applied to the fund for the next year. If our goal is not met here, I will be personally contributing as much as I can to make up the difference and I will continue on fundraising. No matter what, the funds received will be put aside for this scholarship.



All the incentives are products from my small business, Myshkin Vegan Products. I make natural, vegan personal care products. I am developing a lilac soap in honor of Miller's location on Lilac Lane. All the profits from the lilac bar will go to the scholarship fund and I hope to make this product a main source of fundraising for the scholarship in the years to come.


The Why


I chose Miller for personal reasons. I lived there for four years and struggled with a lot of academic stress, depression, and body image issues and I witnessed a lot of my housemates dealing with similar issues. Yoga has helped me with these issues more than anything else I have tried and I've heard many other similar testimonies. I want to give back out of gratitude to Miller providing me with a space to live and a community and I want to make sure at least one woman has a better experience than me.

Eventually my goal is to expand this scholarship to include more recipients, more halls, and different locations.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to donate at this time--spread the word! Share this campaign on your tumblr, your facebook, etc.

Keep at your own yoga practice. Helping yourself be well helps everyone be well.

Make intentions for equality and peace.

Share your knowledge and skills! Next time you're spending time with your friends, do some down dogs, share an OM, do a headstand, or teach your friends a flow! Classes and studios are great but practice shared among friends in kitchens, living rooms, parks, and hallways is extremely powerful.

Links:
OmTree Shala
Miller Scholarship Hall

story:
Ask yourself these questions…

If there was a natural drug that could treat a wide variety of physical, psychological and general health problems suffered by millions, wouldn’t you want it to be freely and safely available for patients to choose and doctors to recommend?

If this natural drug could safely relieve the suffering of children with cancer undergoing toxic chemo and radiation treatments, or reduce the severity of seizures associated with epilepsy, you would want your child to have access to it, right?

If the same natural drug could improve symptoms in veterans suffering from PTSD and psychological illnesses, giving them a chance at regaining a real life after combat, you would want your brother, father or son to be treated with it, of course.

Wouldn’t you also want experienced Research Scientists to be testing and developing that natural drug in state of the art laboratory facilities, under the guidance and with the support of the law?


CBD Health Innovations is the solution.

 

 

If it was your husband, daughter or son who returned from defending our country in a terrifying war on the other side of the planet, would you rather they spiraled downward into depression, isolation and psychotic behaviours caused by PTSD, until they became non-functional or took their own life out of increasing despair?

Or would you fight for your loved one’s right to use medical marijuana if you knew it could save their life and offer them a chance to recover from the perilously damaging effects of their selfless service to our country? 

And if there was a non-cannabis drug which would deliver all the benefits already proven by the world’s scientists, but without the high of THC, the ingredient which makes it illegal by Federal law, you would run to the local pharmacy and purchase it in bulk, right?

Research scientists of the highest caliber have proven the benefits of cannabis for a wide range of physical and psychological conditions for more than 30 years.

It is time for this pharmacological wonder of nature to be further researched and discovered so that everyone can benefit from cannabinoids.

If it was your husband, brother, sister, daughter or son, wouldn’t you want to join a community of like minded people getting the job done??

 

 

At CBD Health Innovations our vision is to develop the natural benefits of cannabis minus THC, for patients who do not want to get high for moral, ethical, religious or other reasons.

We are researching Real Health Solutions for Real People, and we need your investment to make a difference.

We are researching a safe, legal medication that you don’t have to smoke, and that won’t impede your ability to drive or work machinery, or get you fired from your job if prescribed by your doctor.

Will you join our group of community scientists and participate in CBDHI’s research by donating to the future health of your family and millions of others?

Will you show your belief that the passion of a small business and the experience of a team of distinguished research scientists can beat the odds?

Now ask yourself this question…

Can you afford not to?

CBD Health Innovations is waiting for your click. There is no minimum donation—we’re all in this together.

 

What do we need and what's in it for indiegogo community scientists?

CBD Health Innovations needs US$78,000 to fund machines which are needed to start a testing lab for recreational and medical marijuana to service our home state of Washington. The machines are:

1. High Performance Liquid Chromatograph (HPLC)
2. Gas Chromatograph
3. Shipping, installation and calibration of above (pre-owned) machines.

These will be used to conduct the state-legislated testing which is expected to be finalized in WA by the end of this summer. We want to hit the ground running in September, so time is crucial, and we are seeking your donation as an investment in the future of medicine.

CBDHI’s first lab will conduct testing for independent legal dispensaries in accordance with Washington State laws and Federal policy statements, and we plan to invest the proceeds into funding our vision to achieve a world-changing health breakthrough with potential to impact the lives of millions.

 

 

For every dollar you invest, CBD Health Innovations will donate the same in product to a charity of your choice, just as soon as our pills, tinctures and edible products are ready to ship. We'll even suggest a charity for you.

We are committed to investing at least 10% of all CBDHI profits from testing marijuana in WA to funding free distribution programs worldwide for our non-cannabis based nutraceuticals.

 

The community scientists CBD Health Innovations is looking for, will believe passionately in the nutraceutical potential of medical marijuana, and support the need for a legal, certified, safe, non-psychoactive form to be supplied to those who need it.

Indiegogo contributors will perhaps know or live with a parent, partner, child, sibling or friend who is suffering from an illness they believe could be treated by the benefits of cannabinoids without the high.

Our Indiegogo community will want an ethical, experienced and numbers-savvy small business to beat the odds in the fight to find a real replacement for the toxic soup of drugs supplied to the market in this era of cancer, HIV/AIDS, multiple sclerosis, glaucoma, addiction, posttraumatic stress disorder, and the throng of other diseases proven to benefit from medical marijuana.

They will also understand the need for State-legislated testing of medical & recreational marijuana, and support CBDHI’s strategy to harness the revenue potential of testing in the state of Washington, which will quickly provide the final funding needed to turn the research into a legal, nutraceutical health solution which is not derived from cannabis.

 

 

What if it was your wife, brother or daughter who was suffering the hideous side effects of chemotherapy to treat breast cancer, prostate cancer or childhood leukaemia, constantly nauseous and unable to hold down more than water?

Would you fight for your loved one’s right to use a legal nutraceutical if you knew it could help ease their pain when life becomes intolerable, help them eat a little when they are weak from the chemicals, calm them down when fear of the future brings anxiety and sleeplessness?

Wouldn't you want to buy shares in the company that based its vision on developing a legal nutraceutical to treat your baby daughter, your teenage brother, your life partner or your aging grandmother?

The team at CBD Health Innovations believe that cannabinoids can and must be developed into a non-psychoactive, natural and herbal treatment available to every patient, and it is our passionate mission to find that legal nutraceutical within 12-18 months.

 

Other Ways We are Helping


CBD Health Innovations is already working in a consultative role with the Washington State Liquor Board to assist with their research into a suitable framework to support the recreational marijuana legislation passed in December 2012. Our scientists have advised the Board on research data, published papers and best practices for the past three months. We are in the blocks and ready to sprint!

CBD Heath Innovations intends to develop 7 labs in WA before the end of 2014, and we have invested every available dollar to get the project off the ground, so we need passionate and practical community scientists to believe in the possibilities and participate in our research.

Even if you can't contribute, please help us get the word out to like-minded Real People looking for Real Health Solutions! You can help by using the Indiegogo SHARE tools.

 

Make a donation to CBD Health Innovations' community science research project.

We're all in this together!
story_txt:
Ask yourself these questions…

If there was a natural drug that could treat a wide variety of physical, psychological and general health problems suffered by millions, wouldn’t you want it to be freely and safely available for patients to choose and doctors to recommend?
If this natural drug could safely relieve the suffering of children with cancer undergoing toxic chemo and radiation treatments, or reduce the severity of seizures associated with epilepsy, you would want your child to have access to it, right?
If the same natural drug could improve symptoms in veterans suffering from PTSD and psychological illnesses, giving them a chance at regaining a real life after combat, you would want your brother, father or son to be treated with it, of course.
Wouldn’t you also want experienced Research Scientists to be testing and developing that natural drug in state of the art laboratory facilities, under the guidance and with the support of the law?

CBD Health Innovations is the solution.
 

 
If it was your husband, daughter or son who returned from defending our country in a terrifying war on the other side of the planet, would you rather they spiraled downward into depression, isolation and psychotic behaviours caused by PTSD, until they became non-functional or took their own life out of increasing despair?
Or would you fight for your loved one’s right to use medical marijuana if you knew it could save their life and offer them a chance to recover from the perilously damaging effects of their selfless service to our country? 
And if there was a non-cannabis drug which would deliver all the benefits already proven by the world’s scientists, but without the high of THC, the ingredient which makes it illegal by Federal law, you would run to the local pharmacy and purchase it in bulk, right?
Research scientists of the highest caliber have proven the benefits of cannabis for a wide range of physical and psychological conditions for more than 30 years.
It is time for this pharmacological wonder of nature to be further researched and discovered so that everyone can benefit from cannabinoids.
If it was your husband, brother, sister, daughter or son, wouldn’t you want to join a community of like minded people getting the job done??
 

 

At CBD Health Innovations our vision is to develop the natural benefits of cannabis minus THC, for patients who do not want to get high for moral, ethical, religious or other reasons.

We are researching Real Health Solutions for Real People, and we need your investment to make a difference.
We are researching a safe, legal medication that you don’t have to smoke, and that won’t impede your ability to drive or work machinery, or get you fired from your job if prescribed by your doctor.
Will you join our group of community scientists and participate in CBDHI’s research by donating to the future health of your family and millions of others?
Will you show your belief that the passion of a small business and the experience of a team of distinguished research scientists can beat the odds?
Now ask yourself this question…
Can you afford not to? 
CBD Health Innovations is waiting for your click. There is no minimum donation—we’re all in this together.

story:
Short Summary

We are a young SME, spin-off of an Italian, public research agency. In 2009 we started an activity in the biotech domain, by attempting to provide a fast track for research innovations to the market. Our market is that of biotech services (particularly in the omic area; genomics, metabolomics, transcrittomics etc.). We are mainly focusing the services for medical diagnostics and we do actively collaborate with research institutes and general Hospitals for carrying out specific R&D activities in the direction of realizing new techniques for diagnostics, identification of possible drug targets, particularly in rare diseases and in oncology. The company is made by young  scientists, highly motivated, with robust scientific and technical backgrounds.

The proposed funding campaign deals with the realization of an important project for us: the set up of a new diagnostic system to discover a patient's proneness to develop prostate cancer and to provide a further measure to quantify its advancement. 

Prostate Adenocarcinoma is one of the most widespread male tumors. To date, several tests are available (PSA test) allowing to establish, through a simple blood analysis, the presence of some generic pathological process occurring at the level of the prostate. The PSA test is, however, not tumor-specific (PSA could grow also for non-malignant conditions) and it is positive only after the (eventual) process outbreak. The new type of test we are thinking of is related to biochemical modification of a few genes (of the type called "onco-suppressor"): when a cell starts to abnormally proliferating, these genes are able to kill the cell. When they do not work properly, such a "suicide" mechanisms does not work and humans, whose prostate cells have such onco-suppressors in their modified form, are exposed to cancer outbreak.

Our methods analyses 4 of these onco-suppressors, indicated by scientific works as being related to prostate cancer. The extent of their modification (in terms of number of cells whose DNA contains these genes in the "modified" form) can be related to the cancer progression or, even more importantly, to the proneness of the patient to be victim of a future cancer outbreak.

To establish a correct (and robust) link between level of modification of these genes and the development of prostate cancer, we must analyze a large number of patients (extracting DNA from prostate cells taken after biopsy)  with or without cancer, at the different cancer severity indices, in order to correlate and rationalize the extent of the genes modification and the severity of the condition.

To this end, we need to collect at least 100 patients tissues (contained in hospital's patients tissues databases) for extracting DNA and assessing our working hypothesis by measuring genes modifications by appropriate molecular biology protocol (which we have designed and realized).

Funds will be needed to perform this work with a large set of patients data: larger the set, more accurate and reliable will be the test. The analysis will involve several steps requiring different expertise's, different tools and dedicated scientists:

  • selection of set of patients with tissues contained in the tissue bank
  • DNA extraction
  • purification and amplification
  • use of specific molecular probes to detect modified regions on the different onco-suppressors
  • data analysis


What We Need & What You Get

We need the required amount ($ 20.000) as we have to screen such number of patients (and healthy males) of different ages, with different prostate diagnosis (from verified cancer, at different levels of severity, to other, non tumoral, conditions) in a way to correlate the different genes modifications with their conditions. Funds will be used to cover a number of costs for an activity which is still related to R&D (particularly cost of personnel and of biological and chemical materials). According to our estimates, the fundraising campaign target would help us to analyze 100 patients (all tissues are analyzed in duplicate for measurements quality assessment). More we will be able to collect, more patients we will be able to screen. We do have ideas but not enough money for self-funding our research. Unless we break that deadlock (no money, no research), by having some funds to keep this research alive.These funds will allow us to make the most important breakthrough: the screening of a large set of patients which should end up with a robust correlation between genes modifications data and prostate cancer diagnosis. After that validation, the method and the related protocol, could be seriously tested in the clinical practice and then, in appropriate and useful, proposed to the market.

We will make use of any amount that we will get from the campaign in this direction. We do believe very much in the goodness of this solution and we wish to pursue this research up to its completion. The data of all patients we will be able to screen will not be lost. We will reach the final goal by using our funds; we are confident however, that you will be able to help us in getting enough funds to allow us to progress in this direction fast and comfortably.

The perks we have thought to provide you a nice souvenir of our common endeavor belong to the realm of arts: beauty is the most happy-maker feeling of our lives. Our perks are nice arts object made by a friend of ours, a young italian artists  whose work will be nice to show. All friends which will support our projects will be awarded: our perks will range from the quote of the supporter on our project web page to a nice digital art crafts (artistic high-resolution digital photo taken and personalized by an artist) and a limited-series T-shirt for the most generous among you.  


The Impact

As said, prostate cancer is a very common decease affecting a large fraction of males, particularly those in the class of age >50 years. A large fraction of males with altered prostate conditions are (fortunately) not affected by cancer; however, preliminary results show that, in some cases, to this non-tumoral condition is also associated the onco-suppressors modification. This makes more probable a future cancer outbreak in these patients. Our test could discover molecular modifications which could "transform" a negative biopsy (no cancer detected at the histological scale) into a "nearly positive" biopsy; the patient could be thus invited to make more frequent prostate controls due to its ascertained proneness to develop a tumor for the presence of modified onco-suppressor genes in his prostate cells. 

This would help saving lives.

For declared tumor conditions, our molecular test could increase the accuracy of the histological diagnosis, by exploring onco-suppressor modifications in patient's tissue regions not yet invaded by tumor outbreak. Results of this analysis could strengthen (or weaken) the surgery option and/or motivating (and driving) towards a pharmacological option.

We do believe that this system could be effective; our preliminary results confirm that the chosen set of genes is strongly related to the tumoral conditions and, thus, differently from PSA-type analysis, can perceive the presence of tumor or, even more importantly, the proneness of the individual to be affected. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot participate to our endeavor, we thank you anyway, for having read our project and participated (even if for a while) to our vision and soughts. 

If you would like to help us, you could advertise our initiative among your friends. If you will be able to convince a friend to adhere to our funding campaign (and he/she will do that), please let us know: we will provide a perk to you, anyway.

story:
Dave has always been selfless, always wanting for others to find pleasure and delight within their own capabilities.  He has always been a hardworking, loving, devoted husband and father.  Dave has met with many obstacles in life but has never let his spirit to carry on be broken.  Even when a back injury led to three spinal surgeries he still pushed forward in the need to provide for his family.  From this hardship he founded a school for music where he shared his love, passion and knowledge of drums and percussion to over 800 children and adults through a span of 10+ years.  Many lasting friendships and practicing musicians were fostered from his dream to share his gift of music realized through travesty.  His vision and the foundations he set is still thriving and fostering many more musicians today through one of his students. 

     Eight years ago with rising costs and the need to devote more time to family and that of his granddaughter whom he is raising he chose to go back to the simplicity of his youth.  Wanting to give back to God and devote time to family he chose to purchase a farm in Northern Maine.  He maintained many creatures on the farm while maintaining the land and the beauty that God had created.  His wife worked for the local school district to help make ends meet, life in small town America isn't easy but he was happy.  November 2012 travesty struck ago, Dave developed a stomach ache that kept worsening in nature.  He could no longer maintain the animals, the crops or the land.  The animals, equipment and everything necessary to maintain the land now gone the worse diagnosis for his pain hit on February 1, 2012.  The doctor called and stated he had pancreatic cancer and there was nothing that could be done within their capabilities he needed to leave the state if he wanted any hope for his survival.  His wife has had to leave her employment to tend to his needs while they are away from their home.

     Seven months he has been displaced while undergoing treatments for Stage 4 N1M1 Pancreatic Cancer.  He is surviving but is losing hope due to astrnomical co-payments, a vehicle that is failing, cost of fuel to make the many trips for treatment while trying to maintain his home on a meager fixed income.  Due to these mounting expenses he is struggling to maintain his mortgage and this too may lead to his home being threatened. 

     Please help Dave find peace by helping to alleviate these financial burdens, help allow him to heal without worry and help him to have a home to return too.  All contributions will go to fund medical, transportation and housing expenses. 

     The economy is tough on everyone so we understand if you are unable to help.  Prayer is as important as monetary assistance so please hold Dave and his family up in prayer for strength, healing and guidance during these very trying times. May God's blessings be with all of you!

story:
Our project is to bring the great family sport of BMX racing back to Bellingham

As you may or may not know, the sport of bicycle motocross (BMX) racing provides people of all ages a positive activity, which promotes competition and good sportsmanship.  BMX by its very nature is an individual sport that involves the entire family.  In BMX, “No One Sits on the Bench!" Riders compete not only by age but also by proficiency.  This allows participants to race others who are of similar age and skill level.  Thousands of people throughout the world can attest to the positive effects of being involved in BMX racing.

We are close to reaching our goal here in Bellingham. Your contributions would help to fund the final steps of our project. Which would include installation of our starting hill along with our new safety gate.

Having this facility here in Bellingham would provide a place for kids of all ages to get out and ride their bikes. From the 3 yr olds on balance bikes to the over-grown adult kids on cruiser bikes, the amount of joy and excitement is limitless.

Thank you and see you at the track!

Cisco

story:
Don't Tell Andrew!

Feel free to repost this on facebook, but let's make this a surprise. 

Andrew veered to avoid motorcycles which were going the wrong way in his lane.

He shattered his arm in the process.  The surgery is going to cost something like $12,000.  He has some insurance, but he's going to have to pay the bulk of it.   

Andrew is one of my favorite people, and maybe you like him, too.  I thought it would be nice of us to take him out to dinner and hand him a wad of cash to offset his expenses.  

That's it.  Even if it is just five bucks, I think it'd be a nice gesture.

** UPDATE **

With 3 days to go, this quite obviously didnt work. But hey, its was worth trying. Dont worry to those who did contribute I will make sure to get your perks to you as soon as possible.

 

Thank you,

 

Craig Anderson

 

Why does the Nurburgring need saving?


Last year the government run facility delcared bankruptcy and this year they have put up a for sale sign. Many people fear that if it falls into private hands that it will then be closed to the public. Together we can stop this!


My name is Craig Anderson and I have been passionate about motorsports since I was a child barely able to reach the pedals on a go-kart.

I have been active racing and pit crewing in various grassroots and semi-pro races such such as Formula Mazda, the MX-5 Cup series, Spec Miata,
Formula D, SCCA AutoCross and SCCA RallyCross races.

Who better to manage and run the most iconic motorsports park in the world than a true grassroots motorsports enthusiast?

What can we do?

In order to keep the Nurburgring open a private company with the right goals in mind needs to purchase it for a price of $161,000,000.00

The other $19,000,000 in this indiegogo will go to keeping the park open during the interim time while we put together a progressive and profitable business model that will keep the park open for years to come, as well as the fees associated with this method of crowdfunding.

We are only trying to buy the Nordschleife and associated property, not the Ring°park. We feel that these two entities need to be seperated and while they can encourage tourism and increase business for each other they should not be run together as one entity. We want to keep the motorsports park a motorsports park, not a theme park.

Whats in it for you?

  • For every $25 contribution you will recieve a certificate with your name on it showing that you helped save the ring!
  • For every $100 contribution, you will recieve a certificate AND an exclusive shirt that proclaims loudly to the world that you helped save the nurburgring!
  • For every $1000 contribution we will engrave your name on a commemorative placque that we will be installing near the main entrance to the park when it comes under our ownership.
  • For every $10,000 contribution we will give you two all access passes to any motorsport event weekend of your choosing, once the track comes under our ownership.
  • Corporate Sponsorships and advertising are also available, please contact us privately.

In the event that we do not reach our goal, the funds raised will go to help grassroots motorsports and will help encourage the next generation of motorsports enthusiasts.

Global Impact

Every year the Nurburgring attracts hundreds of events and thousands of fans. Professional races are televised globally, and to most motorsports fans the Nurburgring is the most well known and loved racetrack in the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

even if you cannot contribute to our cause, you can still help by spreading the word!
 
  • Share this page on social media such as Facebook.com and Twitter.com
  • Tell your friends to share our campaign, we need to make this viral!

 

While we are not associated with http://savethering.org/ We believe that we are on the same page in our views of what the fate of the Nurburgring should be.
story_txt:
** UPDATE **
With 3 days to go, this quite obviously didnt work. But hey, its was worth trying. Dont worry to those who did contribute I will make sure to get your perks to you as soon as possible.
 
Thank you,
 
Craig Anderson

story:
WHO: Anyone 18+ can participate, general admission open to all ages
WHAT: 3 sport tournament/triathlon – flag football, soccer, volleyball. In addition, there will be a beer garden(s), vendors, food, family friendly activities, and an opportunity to win great prizes!
WHEN: Saturday, July 27th, 2013
WHERE: Starfire Sports Complex, Tukwila, WA (practice home of the Seattle Sounders)
HOW MUCH: $50 for individuals (early-bird registration only)

WHAT IS TRUATHLETE?
TruAthlete is a three-sport triathlon-style tournament involving competition in flag football, soccer, and volleyball. Teams of 7-10 (at least 3 women) will compete in a March Madness style tournament throughout the day for cash prizes and the crown, TruAthlete. There will be two divisions, Division I for elite athletes, and Division II for those looking for a new and exciting challenge.

Truathlete events will begin in Seattle with plans to spread to cities around the world. If you believe in competition, unity, and getting involved on the ground floor of something special, feel free to support us. If not, hmm... :)

WHO IS TRUATHLETE FOR?
Although competitors must be 18 or older, TruAthlete is for everyone and is a family friendly event. There will be tons of great activities and entertainment for people of all ages. A $10 general admission ticket will get you access to: live music, a beer garden featuring the best northwest brews, new and exciting local vendors, delicious food, competitive activities, raffle prizes, and much more. Celebrities in both the sports and entertainment industries will be on hand for autographs and photo ops with fans.

WHO IS BEHIND TRUATHLETE? CAN WE PULL IT OFF?
Hell yes we can pull it off. We have an incredibly talented team of dedicated and hardworking, ass kicking individuals that for the last several months have been eating, sleeping, and breathing TruAthlete to ensure a killer event. While you were at home sound asleep, we were pulling all-nighters to make sure we have the best team of talent, the best music, the best beer, the best of everything for TruAthlete.

NATHAN RILEY: Nate is the founder of TruAthlete, a born athlete, business man, and inspiring leader with an impressive résumé of accomplishments, including credits as a Producer in a Hollywood film and several years operating a  successful wedding business. In the fall of 2012, Nate handed his business off to his partner in order to dedicate his talents to building TruAthlete full time. A few words with Nate and its clear that he is a driven and talented young man with a bright future ahead of him.

AMBER BUTLER: Amber is a brilliant young entrepreneur with business in her blood and a passion for sports. She attended the University of Washington and worked several years with Husky Sports Medicine before launching a successful business in the service industry in 2009. She has since worked in the fields of project management and business innovation, as well as event management. She is a masterful project manager and has come on board as the VP of Events and Operations at TruAthlete.

BRIAN ABBEY: Brian has worked in entertainment marketing, development, advertising, and event promotion for several years with Howell at the Moon Productions, an award winning Northwest production company, including work on  several documentary films and managing a 150 city world tour of the award winning documentary film, “Pedal-Driven: a bikeumentary”. He has done extensive event planning, including the World Premiere of Pedal-Driven in Monterey, Calif. in 2011. In addition, he has produced a hit dance single, and licenses music for film and TV for Simplify Recordings, a highly regarded Northwest EDM record label. He is a full time employee at TruAthlete and is working as Director of Marketing & Development for TruAthlete to ensure it reaches its full potential.

TEAM: In addition to the three principals above, there is a very talented team handling the details of sponsorship, PR, legal, marketing and social media. When it comes to business – as in sports – it’s all about teamwork, and we’re pretty stoked to have a full team of gurus, ninjas, and rockstars ready to make it happen.

BACKERS & SPONSORS

We already have an impressive resume of backers and sponsors including local and regional media and numerous celebrities and athletes, including Marshawn Lynch and Mack Strong. See the TruAthlete website for the full list.

Find us on Facebook

Find us on Twitter

Find us on the Web

story:
What Is myKin?

myKin is a downloadable App for iPhone (and Android coming soon) into which users can put their health and their family health info. The App tracks and calculates risks of various illnesses, including treatable genetic illnesses, and recommends the most appropriate course of action.

myKin also provides daily tips on how to stay healthy and enjoy the life you deserve.

With myKin you own your health and get the chance to head off risks to your health before they even happen.

Previous Projects

The developers of myKin have been in the health industry for 12 years with continual updates of their very successful TrakGene software, a revolutionary software package for managing test results of genetic diseases, including heritable cancer. TrakGene software saves doctors valuable time so they can spend more time saving lives by treating genetic cancer and other genetic diseases.

The TrakGene team recently presented to the leading heads of cancer treatment and genetic disease departments in the UK about the next step in the revolution. 

To learn more about TrakGene visit http://www.trakgene.com/take-the-tour/

How You Can Help

myKin needs your support to complete development of the App to Stage 1. This stage will allow you to enter your health info, view your health info in an easy to use format, and get tips on how to improve your health.   

What You Get

Depending on your contribution we will give you:

1) A free copy of Stage 1 of the App when it is released. Free access to all subsequent stages that get developed in the next 2 years.

2) A limited edition 'Own My Health with myKin' sticker (first 500 contributors only)

2) Your name as a founding contributor on the myKin website (if you wish)

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference in the lives of many, by putting in their hands the power to manage their health.

Our track record in the health industry (see Previous Projects above) means we are well suited to make the myKin App for you now. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Share us on Facebook, Twitter, Google+ and LinkedIn.

Give us your feedback, tell us what you would also like in the myKin App, and anything else you want us to know.

story:
http://www.smogstop.org/

Smog is a type of air pollution. The word "smog" was made in the early 20th century as a portmanteau of the words smoke and fog to refer to smoky fog. The word was then intended to refer to what was sometimes known as pea soup fog, a familiar and serious problem in London from the 19th century to the mid 20th century. This kind of smog is caused by the burning of large amounts of coal within a city; this smog contains soot particulates from smoke, sulfur dioxide and other components. Modern smog, as found for example in Los Angeles, is a type of air pollution derived from vehicular emission from internal combustion engines and industrial fumes that react in the atmosphere with sunlight to form secondary pollutants that also combine with the primary emissions to form photochemical smog. The atmospheric pollution levels of Los Angeles, Mexico City and other cities are increased by inversion that traps pollution close to the ground. It is usually highly toxic to humans and can cause severe sickness, shortened life or death.

The objective of this project is to create a system to eliminate or minimize the layer of smog in small and large cities.

For this purpose we use HEPA filters, but we need to get these filters to the layer of smog, which can be located about 300 meters from ground level.

With Zeppelin we can get our device to the desired height and start collecting the particulates.

This project has no commercial purposes. We try to solve problems that governments are unable to solve.

People who are in this project live in cities where pollution is huge and we and our children have respiratory problems.

Our councils do not listen to our requests and we want to promote this solution with the help of citizens.

We want to make the first tests in Barcelona - Sabadell (Spain). Currently the most polluted city in the country.

http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2721879/

story:
UPDATE 

Thank you all so much for your support! Hannah is currently in Children's Hospital receiving her 2nd round of chemo. She is responding extremely well to chemo and according to the most recent ultrasound her tumor has been all but eliminated. She still will receive her 52 weeks of chemo, but her prognosis is looking good.

 

Thank you everyone for your support and a special thank you to Children's Hospital!

Hannah's Story

After losing both their home and livelihood in one horrific fire one year ago, life was finally beginning to get back to normal for Hannah and her family. That was until Hannah started getting sick. Dozens of doctors visits and just as many misdiagnosis left the family feeling confused and frustrated, but it wasnt until Hannah's stomach began to grow that they got really concerned. After a handful of doctors visits and diagnosis' like bad posture and constipation the frustration was starting to set in, but it wasn't until Hannah started having trouble breathing and was airlifted to Vancouver Childrens Hopsital that the real nightmare began. 

First a tumor in her stomach and a biopsy which showed that it wasn't a tumor, but inflammation left Hannah in critical condition for several days. Than the possibility that she may have lymphoma, then leukemia and finally, after almost a week of tests there was a diagnosis. 

Stage 4, Rhabdomyosarcoma. 

 

What your contribution provides

Because Hannah's family is from Vancouver Island and she is being treated in Vancouver Childrens Hospital there are a great deal of transportation expenses. 

Helping the family with these donations will allow both of Hannah's parents to remain on the mainland with her while she undergoes treatement. By keeping both parents close, not only are the trials of chemotherapy easier on Hannah, but it makes it possible for one parent to leave at a time to care for their baby daughter Hailey who is under the care of Hannah's grandmother.

Your dontations will also afford the family the ability to take Hannah to the zoo, the aquarium and any other venues that get her away from the hopsital when her condition improves.

By helping support this family you are helping them to eliminate the worries of financial obligations and you are allowing them to focus solely on being there for their daughter as she battles this horrific disease. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you yourself aren't able to contribute, please share this story with your friends and family. Every penny counts and you are making a truly amazing difference in this little girls life.

Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Joann Gonzalez has been a dear friend of mine for the past 18 years.  I have seen her go through many ups and downs, but never anything as serious as this.  She is in her late 30s and several months ago found out she has stage 4 colon cancer.

  • I am Elizabeth Rivera a friend who wants to help someone who has impacted my life so much.
  • This campaign is to help Joann pay for the medical treatments that will help her beat cancer.
  • By donating any amount you will help me raise money so Joann can focus on getting better and not worrying about paying her bills after her job let her go.

The friends and family of Joann Gonzalez appreciate any help you may provide.

What We Need & What You Get

Any money donated will help Joann pay for medical expenses and other bills:

  • The amount raised through this site will be given to Joann to reduce the stress she is facing trying to make ends meet while battleing cancer.
  • Your perk is knowing you helped a wonderful person in need.
  • Regardless of the amount raised it will all go to Joann.  Every bit counts and anything will help.

The Impact

This idea came to me after reading about the lady bullied on the bus and I thought this would be a wonderful idea to get help for my dear friend.  When I visit her I know she is worried about how she is going to pay for everything and that is not helping her recover.  After losing her job things have become much tighter and having to pay for COBRA plus other expenses is taking a toll on her.  She had a large tumor removed from her colon in April of this year and has been in and out of the hospital ever since with stage 4 cancer.  When I told her what I was thinking of doing she started to cry and told me how lucky she felt to have such great friends.

  • This project will help Joann continue to fight her battle with cancer.
  • Everyone needs a helping hand once in a while and I hope everyone who reads this will help a friend fight cancer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please spread the word about helping my dear friend Joann:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about helping Joann battle stage 4 colon cancer.
  • Use indiegogo share tools, facebook, email, twitter, text, or even shout it from the roof tops, but please get the word out about this fundraiser.

We all thank you in advance for any help provided.

story:
What's Going On Here?

Hello everyone, my name is Jonathan Wolf. I am a twenty-eight year old former US Navy Master at Arms, and disabled with multiple spinal injuries. Unfortunately, due to regulations that I can't figure out, I cannot get disability, or proper medical care here in the US. I have even had a law firm helping me attempt to get disability here. 

What Do I Need?

I have some amazing friends in Australia whom can help me get the medical care I need, which includes the possibility of multiple spinal surgeries.

Unfortunately, it is going to take a deccent amount of money to get my passport and visa, as well as my plane ticket.

I have nothing left at this point, having sold off anything and everything I own of value to pay bills where I live. I don't even have a bed anymore, or a proper pair of shoes, since I am trying to put everything I have into this move.

I will say that a portion of the funds I am trying to raise will go to clothing and other personal neccesities, but the gross majority will be paying for my travel expenses and getting situated in Australia.

What Exactly Is Wrong?

I have:

Multiple degenerating discs

Lateral herniation T12/L1

Anterior bulge L5/S1 with the disc impacting the thecal sac.

Multiple schmorl's nodes T5-T12

Facet Joint Arthrpathy throughout my spine

Those are all from my MRI done last year. Now I cannot sleep in any position without my arms and/or legs going numb. I am unable to walk any significant distance, and normally have to have a cane to get around. I cannot pick up anything heavier than a twelve pack without extreme pain.

Unfortunately, my case is 'not of significant concern' to the doctors that are supposed to help me, and fix what is wrong with me. I have talked to other doctors, and they have expressed major concern for my case, but here in the USA, I cannot get treatment without really good insurance.

What Am I Expecting From This Campaign?

Even if I don't raise enough to fund the whole move, if I can get enough to check one item off of my list, I am that much closer to my goal.

How You Can Help

If you can donate anything, even a dollar, that is fantastic.

Spreading the word about my campaign is also a great way to help.

If you know off any veterans assistance groups that could help with the fundraising, please let them know. (I can gladly provide my DD-214 to prove veteran status)

Every little bit helps me get closer to a possibly pain free life.

If anyone is able to provide things I can use as perks, that would also be AMAZING, since I have nothing on hand to offer
story_txt:
What's Going On Here?
Hello everyone, my name is Jonathan Wolf. I am a twenty-eight year old former US Navy Master at Arms, and disabled with multiple spinal injuries. Unfortunately, due to regulations that I can't figure out, I cannot get disability, or proper medical care here in the US. I have even had a law firm helping me attempt to get disability here. 


What Do I Need?
I have some amazing friends in Australia whom can help me get the medical care I need, which includes the possibility of multiple spinal surgeries.
Unfortunately, it is going to take a deccent amount of money to get my passport and visa, as well as my plane ticket.
I have nothing left at this point, having sold off anything and everything I own of value to pay bills where I live. I don't even have a bed anymore, or a proper pair of shoes, since I am trying to put everything I have into this move.
I will say that a portion of the funds I am trying to raise will go to clothing and other personal neccesities, but the gross majority will be paying for my travel expenses and getting situated in Australia.
What Exactly Is Wrong?
I have:
Multiple degenerating discs
Lateral herniation T12/L1
Anterior bulge L5/S1 with the disc impacting the thecal sac.
Multiple schmorl's nodes T5-T12
Facet Joint Arthrpathy throughout my spine
Those are all from my MRI done last year. Now I cannot sleep in any position without my arms and/or legs going numb. I am unable to walk any significant distance, and normally have to have a cane to get around. I cannot pick up anything heavier than a twelve pack without extreme pain.
Unfortunately, my case is 'not of significant concern' to the doctors that are supposed to help me, and fix what is wrong with me. I have talked to other doctors, and they have expressed major concern for my case, but here in the USA, I cannot get treatment without really good insurance.


What Am I Expecting From This Campaign?
Even if I don't raise enough to fund the whole move, if I can get enough to check one item off of my list, I am that much closer to my goal.


How You Can Help
If you can donate anything, even a dollar, that is fantastic.
Spreading the word about my campaign is also a great way to help.
If you know off any veterans assistance groups that could help with the fundraising, please let them know. (I can gladly provide my DD-214 to prove veteran status)
Every little bit helps me get closer to a possibly pain free life.
If anyone is able to provide things I can use as perks, that would also be AMAZING, since I have nothing on hand to offer

story:
I am a 32 year old transgender male looking to get some help in funding my "top" surgery. I will be undergoing a double mastectomy with nipple reconstruction to help me obtain a more masculine figure, hopefully this June. I've been receiving testosterone injections for a little over a year, and the further along I get, the more uncomfortable I become with my breasts. At this time, I wear what is called a "binder" to help compress my chest. I wear this for 12-15 hours per day, anytime I'm out of the house. It compresses my breasts down to the point that they are barely noticeable, but at the cost of my comfort. At times it becomes constrictive and hard to breathe. It makes the simplest tasks, such as bending over to pick something up or going from sitting to standing difficult, because it constantly needs to be readjusted. It's unnerving to walk into the men's restroom and wonder if anyone "knows". I haven't had any issues as of yet, but it is a legitimate safety concern of mine. Binding is also known to cause issues with the lungs, and sometimes even fractured ribs. Most importantly is the fact that having breasts as a male is not "normal", according to society. This causes severe body dysphoria, or a severe discomfort and disconnect with one's body. 

 

At this point in my transition, I'm finally becoming the "me" that I've always felt I was inside. As each months passes, I'm able to look back and be proud of the changes I've made, both physically and within myself. I've become a better person. I've even considered going back to school, because I've FINALLY decided on something I'd like to do for a living. That's a big step for me, as I've had a very difficult time making a solid decision on my career path. I'm truly becoming one with myself and finally figuring out what I want and need out of life. This surgery is the only thing that holds me back from being my whole, true self. 

 

I've been working 60 hours per week, between my 3 jobs, for the last few months trying to save up enough money for this surgery. I'm tired, but I'm keeping in good spirits. This surgery will be life-changing, so I've used it as my motivation. Unfortunately I'm having a very difficult time saving the money. It's not that I don't put the work in, I just think I'm overwhelmed with the thought of saving such a large amount of money in such a short amount of time. I get discouraged and I give up. I'm asking for help with this one, because I can't do it on my own. I'm not a beggar, and I certainly understand that there are more pressing issues out there that could use not only your attention, but mine as well. That's why I will continue to donate to other causes whenever I can, and I would completely understand if you would feel your dollars are more suited to someone else. Please just remember that ANY amount helps and is most definitely appreciated. Also, please note that there are options to donate anonymously, if you choose not to share your identity. 

 

Any money I raise over my "goal" will be passed on to another transgendered individual in my area, to assist in their surgery costs. There are more people out there just like me than a lot of people realize, and unfortunately they will encounter the same issues as I have. Insurance companies do not typically cover ANY transgender related health issues. Mine doesn't cover hormones, surgeries, even "trans-related" doctor visits, which means I pay the full amount for all of it. It gets very expensive and has proven to be quite discouraging. Furthermore, if I raise double my goal amount, I will donate 25% of the proceeds to Transgender Youth programs in the Minneapolis area. 

 

I sincerely appreciate you taking the time to read this and I hope that you have learned a few things about who I am and why I'm doing this. I can't speak enough of the overwhelming support I've received from my friends, family and aquaintances in regards to this transition. I feel blessed and honored to have such amazing people in my life and I know that they'll be there to support me in this journey, just as they have been all along. I hope that I have your support, no matter how you choose to offer it, as well :)

 

If you'd like more information on Transgender related issues or any details of my surgery, or if you have personal questions about me and my life and history, I'd be more than happy to share those things with you. Feel free to contact me via e-mail at guitars7kp@gmail.com. You can also find me on youtube under "KPiphany" or search for me by name on Facebook. 

 

Take care!

 

Derek Price

Derek Price

story:
Background of Nicholas

Nicholas became interested in racing back in February of 2001 when he was down in Florida. Right away his favorite driver became Dale Earnhardt Jr. Nicholas wanted to become more involved with racing to the point where he decided that he didn't want to play football or t-ball but wanted to race go-karts. He started out in karts from 2003 to 2009. In that time he had become one of the best junior karters out of the Northeast and wanted to move on into bigger and better things. One of the very fortunate opportunities that Nicholas has had back in 2009 was being able to have breakfast with Joey Logano talking about racing along with each other’s goals and how to achieve them. Nicholas started out in 2010 racing a Bandolero Car at Waterford Speedbowl. After the 2010 season Nicholas ended up accomplishing more than he had expected, especially winning the Bandolero National Qualifier. In 2011 Nicholas had won again the Bandolero National Qualifier and started racing a Legend Car. For 2012 Nicholas had competed in 32 Legend Car races and had 22 young lion division top 5’s and 5 young lion division wins. At the end of the year Nicholas had finished 4th in points at the Waterford Speedbowl for Wednesday Nights along with getting the Sportsmanship Award for the Legend Car division.

Besides just racing Nicholas is involved in a whole lot more. Back in middle school he was president of the student council and on the schools basketball team. While in middle school he started up his own charity. At Christmas time he would go around school collecting money to buy gifts for the children at the Connecticut Children's Medical Center.  While in middle school Nicholas was able to achieve High Honors every semester along with being busy with racing and community service. Along with those charitable things Nicholas is also in the church choir and an alter server. This year Nicholas is in his junior year of high school at Xavier High School where he is doing Cross Country, Indoor, and Outdoor Track. He still continuously achieves Honors for his grades.

Why I’m doing this

I’m trying to raise money for Lung Cancer Alliance and to spread awareness of lung cancer through my racing. November is lung cancer awareness month. I came into partnership with Lung Cancer Alliance when a fellow competitor approached my mom about donating money to lung cancer. I was not affiliated with any lung cancer organization at that time. My mom, a lung cancer survivor, contacted Lung Cancer Alliance about going into partnership with their organization. Lung Cancer Alliance agreed and our partnership was formed. With your generous donation I will be able to give half of the money raised to Lung Cancer Alliance and the other half will be used for my racing. With the money raised I will be able to travel the United States to spread lung cancer awareness. If you do not feel comfortable donating directly to me, please feel free to donate to www.lungcanceralliance.org. Thank you for reading about my cause. 

Upcoming Events 

November 13, 2012 6:30pm: Lung Cancer Alliance Vigil, Prudential Center Plaza II, Boston Mass. 

Racing Stats

2012: 22 Top 5 Division Finishes and 5 Division Wins. Won Sportsmanship award for the Legend Car Division.        

2011: 2 Bandolero Wins. Bandolero North East Regional Champion. 

2010: 6 Bandolero Wins. Bandolero North East Regional Champion.

2009: Finished 3rd in World Karting Association National (WKA) Speedway Pavement Series Final Standings. 2 WKA Northeast Pavement Series Championships. 1 WKA National Speedway Pavement Series Pole Award.

2008: Pomfret Speedway Track Champion. Finished 3rd in WKA National Speedway Pavement Series Final Standings. 1 WKA Northeast Pavement Series Championship. Set a new track record at Pomfret Speedway and Route 106 Racepark in the Jr. 2 class.

2007: Northeast Speedway Pavement Champion. Set new track record at Pomfret Speedway in the Jr. 1 class.

2006: Pomfret Speedway Track Champion. Northeast Speedway Pavement Champion. Also was the first Jr. driver to have won all 4 races at the Woodstock Fair during the fair weekend. Along with that Nicholas had set a new track record in the Jr. 1 class at the Woodstock Fairgrounds racetrack. 

2005: Pomfret Speedway Jr. Rookie of the Year.

Lung Cancer Stats

Lung cancer is the second leading cause of all deaths in the U.S.

Lung cancer kills more than colorectal, breast, pancreatic, and prostate cancers combined.

Nearly 80% of new lung cancer cases are former and never smokers.

15.9% of lung cancer patients will live for 5 years after diagnosis.

In 2012, lung cancer will receive $1,442 per death in Federal Research Funding. Compared to breast cancer that receives $26,398 per death in Federal Research Funding.

Over 25,000 women who have never smoked will be diagnosed with lung cancer this year.

Lung cancer kills more women than any other cancer; nearly 200 women each day. Most die within a year of diagnosis.

The estimated lung cancer deaths for women in 2012 is 72,590 which is more than the amount of lives that breast, ovarian, and cervical cancers combined will take in 2012.

Links

http://www.lungcanceralliance.org/

To Donate: https://donate.lungcanceralliance.org/sslpage.aspx?pid=298 

To Like: http://www.facebook.com/lungcanceralliance

To Follow: https://twitter.com/LCAorg

http://nicholassowa.com/

To Like: http://www.facebook.com/nicholas.sowa08

To Follow: https://twitter.com/N_Sowa08

story:
We develop products containing scientifically sound natural ingredients. Through focused execution, innovative proprietary technology with strong patent protection, and committed leadership, Pervida™ connects science and healthy lifestyles. Pervida™ is anchored on innovation, naturally occurring products, scientifically proven health benefits, the highest safety standards, and quality control to generate foods and beverages that improve health and well-being.

More than 70% of our immune cells reside in the gut. The critical link between gut health and the immune system is increasingly being recognized, and consumers rate gut health as one of their top concerns. Whereas a healthy digestive system provides the foundation for overall health and wellness, a poorly functioning one can lead to food allergies, Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS), Crohn’s disease and ulcerative colitis, heartburn, a weakened immune system, and other health problems ranging from serious to annoying.

 

As we have demonstrated through almost a decade of scientific enquiry, punicic acid (PUA), found naturally in pomegranate seed oil, exerts potent digestive and immune health effects. Pomegranate seed oil is Generally Regarded as Safe (GRAS) ingredient with a demonstrated track record of effectiveness in decreasing gut inflammation and improving digestive health.

 

How will any funding from this crowdfunding campaign be used?  Mainly for four things:  

  • Product development—to bring you as many flavors as possible of our first beverage Pervida Immune.
  • Distribution--to deliver our products all over the world. 
  • Further research--to further validate the fantastic health benefits of Pervida Immune. 
  • And finally Manufacturing—to get Pervida Immune from the floor out the door.

For more information about future products, see your ABC news spot.

 

The risks and challenges of launching our first product--Pervida Immune lie mainly with shelf life and distribution. The easy part is getting people to buy the product. The product is awesome, it tastes great, and is usable in all kind of daily scenarios.

The shelf stability of the product is the most challenging concept, but with proper funding for lab testing and wholesale materials it will be easy to make the shelf life long enough for proper shipping and distribution.

Our plan is simple to tackle both the distribution and shelf-life problems.

Testing and working with partners who have a long, solid track record in the beverage industry.  That's it.  That simply.

 

 

Visit our website at http://www.pervida.net

If you have any questions or need additional information, feel free to contact us: Lee@pervida.net

Your Pervida team

story:
Balancecord : The Ultimate Chiropractic Cushion

Your posture and the health of your spine affect every other area of your life every second of every day. At the literal center of your body and very much at the center of your life as well, your spine ought to be something that you are going to great lengths to care for. Sadly, for many of us, this is just not the case. We forget all about our spines, paying attention to them only when there is some problem that pops up – a pain, a tightness, or something even more serious. While the mindset behind this problem is deep-set, we have a solution to help you to deal with the situation as it is. Balancecord is the ultimate chiropractic cushion, just what you need to treat your spine at home for any pains, tightness, or other problems.

 

Sedentary lifestyles have become an all-too-common fact in modern society, and if you are sitting in front of a computer for long periods of time, driving for long hours, or in any other situation that limits your movement, then it is likely that you have experienced aching shoulders, aching neck, lower back pain, or some combination of the three.

 

 

 

 

This is the hands-free, cost-effective, and portable method for taking care of your pain and discomfort once and for all. Featuring an upper thoracic pedestal, spinous process grooves, a transversal pedestal, a sacrum pedestal, and a waist support, Balancecord is made to eliminate your bad posture habits and create the good posture that you need in order to strengthen your core, improve your confidence, help you lose weight, help you breathe more efficiently, reduce your muscle spasms, and cut down on the load that you are carrying around on your frame.

 

 

Driving with Balancecord helps you feel relaxed and comfortable during long drives

Balancecord is designed for both restorative and preventative care. Featuring a multi-level adjustment arch, this tool facilitates greater reach than any other on the market, helping you to achieve the posture and spine health that you need in order to live the life you want to live. It is designed to be compact so that you can pack it away and use it on the go, perfect for any lifestyle, no matter how busy. This is the product of a team of body experts, including therapists, chiropractors, and trainers, coming together and committing to put out a tool that works, using only the highest-quality, durable materials.

 

Right now, we have come to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $10,000. These funds will cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing Balancecord, making it possible for us to lead the way in the posture health market. With your support, we are confident that we can make this product into the groundbreaking innovation that it is meant to be.

There is no way to overstate the importance of your posture and spine health. We have to make Balancecord available to the whole world – this is a product that could drastically improve many, many people’s lives.

 

We appreciate your support, friends, and we thank you for your time.

Featuring a multi-level adjustment arch, this tool facilitates greater reach than any other on the market, helping you to achieve the posture and spine health that you need in order to live the life you want to live. It is designed to be compact so that you can pack it away and use it on the go, perfect for any lifestyle, no matter how busy. This is the product of a team of body experts, including therapists, chiropractors, and trainers, coming together and committing to put out a tool that works, using only the highest-quality, durable materials. Right now, we have come to you, Indiegogo, for help raising $10,000. These funds will cover the costs of manufacturing, marketing, and distributing Balancecord, making it possible for us to lead the way in the posture health market. With your support, we are confident that we can make this product into the groundbreaking innovation that it is meant to be.There is no way to overstate the importance of your posture and spine health. We have to make Balancecord available to the whole world – this is a product that could drastically improve many, many people’s lives. We appreciate your support, friends, and we thank you for your time.

story:
Short Summary

We are a small, but powerful swimming team from Debrecen, Hungary. Our  swimmers rank the top swimmers not only in Hungary, but even in Europe. Our club the Sandor Swimming Workshop is a private club, which is funded only by the parents and because of that we usually train without renting a lane, swimming in the public lanes. Currently our club consists of three families and 7 swimmers.  The coaches are the parents of 8 children, four of them swimming in the club.
Our Hungarian National Championships medal count for the year of 2015: 6 golds, 1 silver and 3 bronzes.

This summer we'd like to go on a training camp abroad, but sadly we can't fund it alone. We would like to host a summer training camp abroad, somewhere near the Adriatic sea, as for a swimmer the air quality means a lot.

What We Need

We would like to place the training camp  abroad as it has the better value for money. The camp all in all costs the whole team nearly  $4,600. 

The camp costs:

  • Travel costs ( gasoline, other travelling expenses) ≈ $600 per whole team
  • Renting a lane in the pool ≈ $600 per week per whole team (24 hours of pool training per week)
  • Renting an apartment ≈ $700/week/team
  • Meal at least $700/week/team
Our goal is $2,500 which would cover approximately the half of our expenses. You would give us an enormous help by donating.  

The Impact

By training near the sea, inhaling sea air, the swimmer's performance improves greatly. our goals for this seasons are the following: 2 Hungarian National Age Group records, at least 10 number 1 placings in the Hungarian rankings, great performances at international competitions.

Check out our latest Hungarian National Gold medal swim by Annamari a 12 year old girl:


Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome any type of help so if you can't donate just share it please. Thank you!

story:
This will be my 5th trip to Port-au-Prince, Haiti.  I'll be traveling November 8th thur the 15th.  I am an EMT and I work at Abbott Northwestern Hospital in Minneapolis, MN.  I will be going for 8 days to work at Hospital Bernard Mevs, the only critical care hospital in Haiti.  The organization that I volunteer with is Project Medishare for Haiti.  Project Medishare has been in Haiti, helping since 1994.  Project Medishare also mobilized the first medical team on the ground in Haiti just 12 hours after the devastating 2010 earthquake.  I'm proud to volunteer with an organization that is so connected to Haiti and are truly rooted in helping the country help themselves.  As a volunteer, we pay $700.00 to cover the expenses of flight from Miami, food that is made for us, and the rest to help them continue to run the hospital and several clinics in rural areas.  I will also need to cover the cost of my flights to and from Miami and a night in a hotel in Miami.

Any funding over my goal will be used for buying medical supplies and pay the airline for extra fees for checked bags.  I bring a total of 3 bags-$75.00 for the second and third bag-on each flight, one to Miami and from Miami to Haiti.
I learned on the first trip that up front $75.00 each for 2 extra bags seems like a lot of money.  After you are in Haiti and see how much they have and how much they need that concern is trivial.

My first trip was three years ago.  I packed and repacked so that I had I carry on bag and 1 checked bag, to keep expenses down. 
We started right away on Saturday when we got there in the early afternoon. I seemed to fit in pretty quickly. The first couple days I just rolled with everything that I was seeing, learning tons, and trying to help and teach as much as I could. Tuesday was the day that changed everything for me. We switch shift at 7:00 am and I got report from another EMT. One of the patients was a young woman who had been assaulted. She was injured so badly that she required surgery and was waiting for the OR to be open. This young woman was lying on a black plastic mattress, unable to make eye contact with anyone, crying. It was difficult not to notice her tears rolling down the mattress. There were other patients and emergencies through the day. In the early afternoon a young mother brought her 9 month old in. The baby had fallen and hit her head many days before. The baby was lethargic and no longer eating normally. This was the first baby I had drawn blood on, really the first baby I have seen in an emergent situation, the hospital I work in does not see children. The baby had a head CT and it confirmed that there was a head bleed and there was nothing that could be done but to watch her and hope for the best. Just before the end of my shift she passed away. It was, by far, the hardest day in my professional career. By the end of the day I was standing in the courtyard of the hospital, crying and wondering why I hadn't paid $75.00 to bring an additional bag. And for that matter $150.00 two more bags! I really couldn't change what had happened, but I could change other things. On my second trip I brought 20+ sheets(the hospital has none, and the pt's only get one if we give it to them or their family brings it) and all the supplies I could. All of my trips since, I have had 3 bags and I try to get everyone on the trip to carry 3 as well.

story:
What is w/you?

w/you is a service that helps persons facing a medical situation find the right clothing, footwear, and accessories to accommodate their changing physical needs, plus a social platform that provides a convenient way for their loved ones to show their support by pooling their financial resources to help pay for items the end-user selects.

Why the campaign? 
We've recently completed the first version of our platform, which is presently in alpha testing. We need help from family and friends as we move into beta testing and to make appropriate improvements in the next version of the platform based on what we learn from our tests, which is a key element of the next phase of our development.

Why does w/you matter?

Because our surveys have shown that:

87% of people have struggled with knowing how to effectively respond or provide tangible support to someone they know well who is facing a medical situation.

71% of females who have experienced a medical situation expressed a need for different clothing, footwear, and/or accessories

95% would be willing to pay for our service as part of a group 

74% of women have expressed a desire for the kind of service that w/you provides 

80% of women who have experienced breast cancer expressed a desire for the kind of service that w/you provides. 

How else can I help? 

If you're not in a position to contribute financially, you can still help! Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign with the Indiegogo share tools!  We would appreciate any type or level of assistance you can provide as we move w/you forward into the next exciting stage of its development!
