story:
Summary

Aquawing is a swimming floatation device that glides on water.

Aquawing just passed the first round of the HYPE Rio 2016 Global Innovation in Sport Competition, with the final showdown at the Brazil Olympics in 2016: (See Competition Trailer ). You can get an idea of the global scale of this  competition from the impressive lineup: ( Jury Panel Members & Global Final Panelists )

"...its allowing you to be more streamlined on top of the water which is conducive to how people are swimming, especially a lot of speed swimmers, a lot of racers and competitive swimmers." says Bill Paine, Head Coach, MIT Masters Swim Club.  (see video: MIT Masters Swim Club meet Aquawing )

With its unique streamlined design, Aquawing replaces standard kickboards.   In addition, by simply adding more or less floats, swimmer's buoyancy can be adjusted to their weight. 

"As an avid swimmer I was getting tired of these kickboards that not only look like a gravestone but also sink like one: adult male swimmer requires different buoyancy than a young boy, same goes for female swimmers." says the founder.

Aquawing is a privately held start-up in seed stage focused on innovation in consumer products. Specifically products that solve real proven problems in our daily life with mass market potential.

----------
Video above: first dip, MIT Aquatic Center.


The Competition

"The market for innovation in sports is currently estimated at $250 billion, and, compared to other markets, is still in its infancy. The goal is to provide the first ever international exposure for Innovations that will revolutionize the world of sports as we know it," Amir Raveh, CEO of the HYPE Foundation said when the competition was announced in May.

The Numbers:

  • 71,000 Innovators
  • 46 Countries
  • 8 Regional Competitions (80 competing start-ups)
  • 8 Finalists at the 2016 Rio Olympic Games

Funding

We seek your help with $25,000 contribution which will give us a strong chance for the Brazil Olympics final showdown:

Our primary objectives for use of proceeds are as follows:

  • Prepare for HYPE Rio 2016 Global Innovation in Sport Competition in the Brazil Olympics:
  • Complete manufacturing of 30 units (functional prototypes) using rapid prototyping techniques (e.g 3D-Printing / Additive Manufacturing, with 2-3 iterations expected, incl. sandblasting, painting and waterproofing). $15,000
  • Additional Swim Tests & Validation of Swim benefits, as well as securing the right Spokesmen or Spokeswomen for Aquawing. $5000
  • Marketing Campaign $5000
  • Early adapters contributors will be able to received the device early 'ahead of the crowd' with substantial discounts.
  • Contributors can also select perks that will allow them to purchase sponsorship (For example add their logo on the product in public events, or to be included on Aquawing's marketing material)
  • If we don't reach the goal, we may not be able to complete 30 units, but it will go long way to get us closer to our long term objectives of building a product and go-to-market.



The "Kicker"


Aquawing was initially design for pool swimming and water recreation (above). The Aquawing 'open-water' concept (below) is optional add-on.   We have  indications that it could also be suitable for water sport activity such as sea-swimming, bodyboard alternative for wave surfing,  and lifeguards equipment,  but yet to be proven.



Key Features

  • Swim faster! glide on water with super efficient hydrodynamic design
  • Replaces most types of kickboards and pull-buoys whether held by hand, knees or feet
  • Connectible units make possible to adjust buoyancy for different weights
  • An ergonomic and organic design that feels natural and is easier to hold.
  • Kids delight with infinite playful water float configurations (incl. full body support!)

Traction

  • 5/9/16 - Aquawing passed the first round of HYPE Rio 2016   Innovation in Sport Competition – Brazil Olympics 

    • The HYPE RIO 2016 competition is already getting GREAT Media Coverage:  ( HYPE Rio 2016 on Yahoo )  ( HYPE Rip 2016 on Sport Techie )
  • 5/12/16 - Gabriel Mangabeira, a Brazilian Olympic Swimmer joins the team.( Gabriel Mangabeira on wikipedia )

Advantage

Competitive advantages over conventional kickboards:

  • Superior Streamline Swimming
  • Adjust amount of workout by connecting more or less Aquawings modules.
  • Comfortable and fun grab.  Aquawing can be held by one hand. Can alternate hands or even use two aquawings, one in each hand.
  • The easy-grab makes it suitable for open-water, sea-swimming, not only pools
  • Does more! Swimmer can even flip-turn with Aquawing (similar to supersonic "tuck" in flying wings, aquawing fluid-dynamics design may help push-up or roll in flip-turns)

Technology

  • Our patented device uses advanced fluid-dymanics technology to improve the motion of hand-held bodies under, through and over water, including (but not limited to) controlling buoyancy flexibility using modularity and connectibility of these bodies.

Risks & Challenges

We have a great start with working prototype, patent protection and initial traction, but we know that getting a product to market is a long road. As we learn from comparable consumer products, the number of iterations to perfect the device's snap-fit using the right combination of materials and water-proofing could vary from 3 to as much as 15.  

  • As a founder I am a "swiss-army-knife" and stops at nothing in reaching our goal. My record speaks for itself as an effective leader.
  • To overcome these challenges I have developed a clear roadmap:
  • We will continue to work lean and clean in product development.
  • We will work diligently to secure sales channels.
  • We will make every effort to work with the right strategic partners.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute with cash, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools or go here:  ( Aquawing on Facebook )

story:
GoRelax is the Ultimate Stress Buster Tool that harnesses the power of deep touch stimulation to help increase blood circulation and reduce muscle tension. Use it daily for only 15 minutes to completely unwind and reach a deep state of relaxation.

GoRelax helps relax the nervous system by replicating the feeling of getting a massage. A massage everyday can become your reality with GoRelax. 

GoRelax works on the principle of Acupressure. Acupressure is one of the oldest natural therapies used for relief against stress, back pain, neck pain & insomnia. However, society at large hasn’t had access to it until now. With GoRelax, we are working to put Acupressure in a form that is accessible to everyone.  

 

 

 

You can simply unzip it and use it anywhere you want. This makes the mat versatile and easy to carry. Use any section you want as per your need.     

 

You can easily fold GoRelax to 1/3rd of its size which makes it easy to carry on the go. It also occupies less space and is very convenient to store.

 

Crafted with 100% Eco-friendly material that is good for you and the environment. The outer fabric is made of 100% cotton fabric filled with natural coconut fiber.  

 

 

GoRelax is labelled with foot and hand reflexology charts. It showcases how different organs are being stimulated by applying pressure on different parts of the body.

 

 

It is designed scientifically and contours perfectly to your body. GoRelax is unique specially because of the curvature around the neck. You don't have to buy a separate pillow for your neck pain. 

 All branches of medical science agree that human body possesses immense natural strength to cure itself from any health problem. By utilizing our body’s natural energy system, GoRelax stimulates pressure points within our body which increases blood circulation and helps reduce muscle tension and aids in the body’s natural healing process.

When you lay on GoRelax, the muscle tension on your back yields to the pressure generated by the lotus simulators. It enables muscle fibers to elongate and relax, blood to flow freely, and endorphins (natural pain relieving hormones) to be released.    

With high endorphin levels, we feel less pain and fewer negative effects of stress. 

There are several studies and clinical trials conducted that prove that 2 weeks of daily use of Acupressure Mats for 15-20 minutes helps relieve pain and reduce stress.  

 GoRelax is for everyone - office workers, new moms, sports people, insomnia sufferers, weight watchers, healthy living advocates. Just take out 15 minutes from your daily routine and make GoRelax your wellness habit.  

Hey Kickstarter, we are Aditi and Akshay, the founders of GoRelax. We are so excited to introduce GoRelax to you!

We want to give you a little background on how GoRelax came to life. Here is our story:  

It all started when we were living in New York. Life in the city was extremely fast paced and everyone seemed to be in a state of constant struggle. We were taken aback by the sheer tension that seemed to absorb almost everyone around us. While for some of us it was about struggling hard to be successful at work, for others it was about finding quality time for family. Life had become so busy that we hardly took time out for ourselves. Instead, the overpowering effects of stress deeply disturbed our lifestyles and severely affected health. We just couldn't make our peace with this and this problem gripped our minds for months.

In our search for a solution, we wanted something that was natural, effortless and effective at the same time. But we just couldn't find the right answer....Then one day, Aditi had a severe back ache due to lack of sleep and tensed muscles. Her grandmother seeing her pain suggested a more traditional approach to treatment. With limited downside and her grandmother’s conviction – she decided to give the treatment a shot. 

Over the next 4 days - her grandmother's solution worked like magic. With gentle pressure using a tool with spikes, different points on the back were kneaded. Aditi was skeptical, but come day 4, there was a visible improvement in pain. We instituted regular use of the pressure therapy and there was no looking back. It not only helped ease pain but Aditi felt a lot more relaxed and energetic during the day.

This incident is what triggered the idea of GoRelax. If there was knowledge transmitted over generations that worked, why not validate with research, and create something usable by others? With a lot of research and validation from various medical and renown acupressure bodies, we came up with a product design, created experiments, and perfected our product over the next year. After countless hours of toil, we’re immensely proud to bring our product to market and hope to see millions benefit from this ancient wisdom, solving for some of the most chronic stress and posture induced problems.

We hope our story resonates and gives others like us a simple respite to this chronic problem. Join us in our quest to GoRelax!  

- Aditi and Akshay

 

Lead Marketing Partner:

This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with

700+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.

 Other Partners:

Customs & duties information

GoRelax cannot mark orders as gifts. This is illegal, so we will not be able to do this.

Our prices DO NOT include VAT, GST or other country taxes.

As many of you know, our terms of sale for international orders are FOB destination. This means that you pay all duties or taxes. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Kickstarter.

For international customers who are required to pay customs, you will receive an email from USPS, FedEx, DHL, or your local customs authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Unfortunately, there is no legal way around customs. Once you make that payment to the customs broker your order will be processed for final delivery.

Shipping procedure

Your order will be handled by USPS, UPS, FedEx, or DHL up to the entry of your country. Once your order enters your country your order may be handed off to your local post office for final delivery. International transit will have a 7-21 Business day delivery time. U.S Domestic shipments will take 3-7 business days. 

Within 24 hours of your order being shipped, you will receive a tracking link with your shipping details. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package. If you do not receive your order within the above mentioned timeline, please reach out to us so that we can file a claim with the shipping services.

Shipping policy

If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and you don't get it because you’re not there, wrong address, moved without notifying us, and the package returns back to our warehouse, it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package.
story_txt: GoRelax is the Ultimate Stress Buster Tool that harnesses the power of deep touch stimulation to help increase blood circulation and reduce muscle tension. Use it daily for only 15 minutes to completely unwind and reach a deep state of relaxation.GoRelax helps relax the nervous system by replicating the feeling of getting a massage. A massage everyday can become your reality with GoRelax.  GoRelax works on the principle of Acupressure. Acupressure is one of the oldest natural therapies used for relief against stress, back pain, neck pain & insomnia. However, society at large hasn’t had access to it until now. With GoRelax, we are working to put Acupressure in a form that is accessible to everyone.     You can simply unzip it and use it anywhere you want. This makes the mat versatile and easy to carry. Use any section you want as per your need.       You can easily fold GoRelax to 1/3rd of its size which makes it easy to carry on the go. It also occupies less space and is very convenient to store.  Crafted with 100% Eco-friendly material that is good for you and the environment. The outer fabric is made of 100% cotton fabric filled with natural coconut fiber.     GoRelax is labelled with foot and hand reflexology charts. It showcases how different organs are being stimulated by applying pressure on different parts of the body.   It is designed scientifically and contours perfectly to your body. GoRelax is unique specially because of the curvature around the neck. You don't have to buy a separate pillow for your neck pain.   All branches of medical science agree that human body possesses immense natural strength to cure itself from any health problem. By utilizing our body’s natural energy system, GoRelax stimulates pressure points within our body which increases blood circulation and helps reduce muscle tension and aids in the body’s natural healing process. When you lay on GoRelax, the muscle tension on your back yields to the pressure generated by the lotus simulators. It enables muscle fibers to elongate and relax, blood to flow freely, and endorphins (natural pain relieving hormones) to be released.    With high endorphin levels, we feel less pain and fewer negative effects of stress.  There are several studies and clinical trials conducted that prove that 2 weeks of daily use of Acupressure Mats for 15-20 minutes helps relieve pain and reduce stress.   GoRelax is for everyone - office workers, new moms, sports people, insomnia sufferers, weight watchers, healthy living advocates. Just take out 15 minutes from your daily routine and make GoRelax your wellness habit.  Hey Kickstarter, we are Aditi and Akshay, the founders of GoRelax. We are so excited to introduce GoRelax to you!We want to give you a little background on how GoRelax came to life. Here is our story:  It all started when we were living in New York. Life in the city was extremely fast paced and everyone seemed to be in a state of constant struggle. We were taken aback by the sheer tension that seemed to absorb almost everyone around us. While for some of us it was about struggling hard to be successful at work, for others it was about finding quality time for family. Life had become so busy that we hardly took time out for ourselves. Instead, the overpowering effects of stress deeply disturbed our lifestyles and severely affected health. We just couldn't make our peace with this and this problem gripped our minds for months.In our search for a solution, we wanted something that was natural, effortless and effective at the same time. But we just couldn't find the right answer....Then one day, Aditi had a severe back ache due to lack of sleep and tensed muscles. Her grandmother seeing her pain suggested a more traditional approach to treatment. With limited downside and her grandmother’s conviction – she decided to give the treatment a shot. Over the next 4 days - her grandmother's solution worked like magic. With gentle pressure using a tool with spikes, different points on the back were kneaded. Aditi was skeptical, but come day 4, there was a visible improvement in pain. We instituted regular use of the pressure therapy and there was no looking back. It not only helped ease pain but Aditi felt a lot more relaxed and energetic during the day.This incident is what triggered the idea of GoRelax. If there was knowledge transmitted over generations that worked, why not validate with research, and create something usable by others? With a lot of research and validation from various medical and renown acupressure bodies, we came up with a product design, created experiments, and perfected our product over the next year. After countless hours of toil, we’re immensely proud to bring our product to market and hope to see millions benefit from this ancient wisdom, solving for some of the most chronic stress and posture induced problems.We hope our story resonates and gives others like us a simple respite to this chronic problem. Join us in our quest to GoRelax!  - Aditi and Akshay    Lead Marketing Partner:This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with700+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $300MM raised between them.  Other Partners:   Customs & duties informationGoRelax cannot mark orders as gifts. As we are shipping these products all over the world, it is impossible for us to build in the various duties, VAT and GST tax for each location through Kickstarter.For international customers who are required to pay customs, you will receive an email from USPS, FedEx, DHL, or your local customs authorities asking for payment to have your order processed through customs. Unfortunately, there is no legal way around customs. When you receive your tracking #, please keep an eye out for the package. If you do not receive your order within the above mentioned timeline, please reach out to us so that we can file a claim with the shipping services.Shipping policyIf our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and you don't get it because you’re not there, wrong address, moved without notifying us, and the package returns back to our warehouse, it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. story:
Chan-Sung Jung (a.k.a The Korean Zombie) used BULO to make a video about Lung capacity and upload his Youtube channel.

 

 

Think about the things healthy lungs can do for you. Rooting for your favorite team, singing to your jam, yelling at someone who drives you crazy, holding your breath, climbing up the stairs, dancing…

With so many factors threatening your lungs, you need to consciously care for your lungs to be able to do these for the rest of your lifetime. 

 

 

BULO is used to measure your breathing activity. It connects to the Bulo app and gives you data that you can use to train harder and adopt healthier lifestyle habits! 

 

The Bulo app comes with a library of performance breathing exercise videos that also has a library of performance breathing exercises that will always be available to make sure that you can perform better at whatever task you're aiming to accomplish!

 

 

 

 

 BULO stores the measurements and displays them weekly, monthly and yearly. Use this data and tailor it to your own regiments.

 

 

 

BULO measures airflow at intervals of 10ms. It can precisely measure the amount of air that is being exhaled.  This data is then transferred to your smartphone via Bluetooth and is then calculated through our own algorithm to display the final figures.

 

 

 

 

 

About Bulo

Breathing is one of the most crucial daily activities that we engage in. We all know that. The way we breathe affects our performance, focus level, stress level, and many more. 

But so many people underestimate the importance of breathing. Most of us blindly assume that they are breathing properly. 

It all started when the three of us were engineers at Samsung Electronics. We met at Samsung's annual Hackathon and started developing a breathing training device. Samsung absolutely LOVED our first prototype and recommended that we fully devote our time to developing the device. 

So here we are, perfecting our design of Bulo, diversifying the mobile application, and preparing to mass-produce it. The current version of Bulo can sense and analyze your breathing rapidly and accurately. Based on the collected data, Bulo's system suggests the right breathing exercise for you.

story:

The most effective skincare mask will bring best result in a short period of time.

story:
Meet Quietly, a handmade weighted blanket that’ll give you the best sleep of your life and make you feel your best.

 

Weighted blankets have been around for over 30 years, and we think it’s time they be given a fresh look that is both beautiful and practical. If you've been struggling to fall asleep or feeling stressed lately, then this blanket is for you. 

The moment you put on our blanket, you'll feel grounded. The heavy weight creates a natural calming effect that will help you relax — called a deep pressure stimulation that relaxes your nervous system. It ends up changing your nervous system from "fight or flight" mode to "rest and digest" mode. It has the same effect as a newborn baby being swaddled, which stops them from crying and being startled. As a result, it helps improve pain, sleep, anxiety and mood by increasing your happiness hormones.

11 million Canadians are experiencing high levels of stress as people continue to stay home and isolate during the pandemic, so it’s no surprise it’s taking a toll on mental health. That’s 1 in 3 Canadians. 

And over 70 percent of Canadians have experienced one traumatic event, so it’s not a surprise that 1 out of 10 Canadians may develop PTSD at some point in their lifetime. 

Weighted blankets have a lot to offer, there are numerous benefits to someone’s health and they've become one of the top health trends in the last few years. But they’re not just a trend, they're an important medical device that’s been around since the 1990s. It was originally designed for people living with autism, PTSD and sensory issues and was used a form of therapy, helping people suffering from a range of symptoms including:

  • Anxiety
  • Insomnia
  • Depression
  • ADHD
  • Restless Leg Syndrome
  • Autism Spectrum Disorder
  • Seasonal Affective Disorder 
  • Sensory Processing Disorder
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Panic Disorder
  • OCD
  • Dementia
  • PTSD  



My journey started when a car accident left me with life-changing injuries in 2016. My new normal changed overnight. Everyday tasks became a challenge like chewing food, reading, and washing the dishes. Even my sleep became an issue, the loud noise in my ears would keep me from falling asleep, then I started getting painful spasms in my ribs at night, that would leave me gasping to breathe.

It was only a matter of time before my mood changed, stress level increased, and I started using heavy pain killers. Something had to change. So I quit my corporate job and set out on a path to find natural ways to heal my body and focused on both passive and active rehab for two years. I learned how to read again, strengthened my body, and calmed my mind.

But it wasn’t enough, I needed something more - and that's when I came across weighted blankets. I put my weighted blanket on, and after one night of being up at 4 am again, I instantly fell asleep — that never happens.

Overcoming these injuries has been the biggest challenge in my life, and not a day goes by that I don’t work on trying to heal my injuries. This has led me to shift my priorities, now, my sole focus is to calm my mind and body, and help others benefit from it too. That’s why I decided to start Quietly — a natural tool to help improve your sleep and stay calm.

Michelle Beauregard, Founder  

 

Our weighted blankets are built to fit the size of your body, with four weighted options to choose from, there’s something for everyone.

For the best fit, choose a blanket that is about 10% of your body weight. If you’re in between sizes, go with the next size up. 

Our blankets are weighted by the material itself, without the use of pellets. We use 100% natural organic cotton. Each blanket is made with up to 280 meters of fabric in each blanket, which distributes the weight more evenly and makes our blankets easier to machine wash and dry. The cotton we use is durable, breathable and super soft and using only GOTS certified material. We only use eco-friendly fabric, that's it.

Inspired by a chunky braid, we knit the blanket in a braided pattern making it both breathable, and a beautifully designed blanket. Say goodbye to plastic pellets, and say hello to Quietly.

Just toss the blanket in the machine, and wash cold, delicate cycle. Tumble dry low for a few cycles or hang it to dry, laying it flat. Avoid hanging it upright as this will stretch the braids.

For the 25 lbs blanket it's recommend you wash it in a commercial washer, or check the capacity of your washing machine to find out if it can handle the weight. 

Support our project by selecting a perk. This is essentially pre-ordering our first batch of blankets. As thanks, you’ll get an exclusive discount before we release it online. 

Color choice will be confirmed in a post-campaign survey.

1. Choose your perk option

To order your blanket, choose your perk, you can only choose one. Perks can’t be exchanged at a later time, so choose the perk you want carefully. See the FAQ for why we can’t make exceptions.

All details like shipping information, weight options, colour preferences, will be collected via survey once this campaign has ended.   

2. Sit back, and relax.

You might be wondering how to select your weight or colour when ordering, don’t worry, we got you. We’ll be collecting all the information, like colour preference and weight options in a survey, after this campaign has ended.

3. Snuggle up

US and Canada

We are currently charging a flat fee of $20 for shipping to the US and Canada just for our Indiegogo campaign, that’s it. No additional charges after the campaign ends. 

After the campaign ends, and production is completed we will ship out your order.

International

Due to high shipping costs, we do not ship internationally at this time.

Risks and challenges

With any project there are always risks and challenges, but we've thought about it and we've taken action to minimize the risks to bringing Quietly to life in a few important ways: Covid-19: Shipping delays due to Covid-19 is a potential risk, so we've decided to push our expected delivery date to February.

Product design: We carefully designed and tested our first prototype and we're proud of!

Inventory: We're ready to go, we won't be wasting any time with packaging and shipping. Please keep in mind, each blanket is handmade and if we get a high volume of orders, it will take a bit longer to fulfill orders.

story:
Friends Don’t Let Friends Breathe Oil Fumes on Aircraft: Contribute to Crew and Passenger Health Research Project  (GIVE TEN, GET TEN...)

We are re-launching our campaign on this important subject, having raised more than $3000 which has already been forwarded to the research team. We are again calling everyone who flies to join our campaign to make air travel healthier. Please GIVE $10 (or something comparable, any currency) to a talented university research team to finish developing an important blood test for airline crews and passengers (more information below). Also, GET 10 more people (Facebook friends, any friends, anybody with a pulse...) to do the same.

Ever smelled dirty socks during an airline flight? A dirty socks smell coming from the aircraft air supply vents is likely to be engine oil fumes in the ventilation air. You read that right: the air that comes through the cabin and flight deck vents is first compressed in the engines, and it isn’t filtered before you breathe it. Many crew unions around the world receive regular reports from members who report dirty socks or musty fumes in the cabin supply air, followed by problems with memory, balance, and speech, for example. Nobody thinks it will happen to them, until it does.

Every day, just in the US alone, there is an official report of toxic oil fumes contaminating the air you breathe on regular commercial flights.  Let alone the many more reports documented around the globe. Aviation engine oils contain neurotoxic additives, so breathing the fumes can cause lasting damage to your brain. Also, flight safety can be compromised when crews are impaired inflight. You will meet some affected crew members in our video.  

As things stand, few people  can  access the aircraft maintenance records to PROVE that oil contaminated the cabin air. And there is no blood test specific to these fumes, so airlines often say that “nothing was wrong” and that crews and passengers are just imagining their disabling symptoms. Fortunately, a dedicated research team at the University of Washington is developing a blood test specific to the aviation engine oil. You can help by donating to this campaign. 

If you breathed oil fumes on YOUR flight today, how would you prove it? If you’re a crewmember, would the airline doctor listen and support you, or pressure to you to return to work sick? Would your doctor tell you that you’re over 50 now, so maybe that explains your memory problems? Can you afford to not work and not get paid for a while? These are the stories that previously-healthy crewmembers share, and passengers breathe the same air...

Everyone who flies needs this blood test, so we all need to GIVE 10 of any currency and GET 10 friends to do the same. If you are exposed to oil fumes onboard, then you need to be able to prove it, and all of us need the industry to feel more motivated to clean up the cabin air.

A single person’s TEN DOLLARS won’t fund anything, but our GOAL is to bring ENOUGH people onboard that ENOUGH ten dollar donations are received, that the research will be a success, for the good of crews everywhere. So please, GIVE TEN, GET TEN, and encourage your flying partners, family, friends, people you don’t even like, your dog, your barista, the guy who fixes your car, anyone and everyone, to do the same. 

Don’t leave the page until you have given $10 and sent the link to ten people!  The GIVE TEN, GET TEN! campaign is overseen by Clean Up Cabin Air, run by volunteer cabin crew and their supporters. You can make an anonymous donation, or you can put your name to it - either way works.

Join us. Change the way the industry handles the air you breathe on regular commercial flights. Donate now! Currently, 95% of your donation goes directly to the researchers, and 5% to Indiegogo, per their rules. We have been approved as a non-profit organization, such that contributions (made in the US, at least) will be tax-deductible. EVERY dollar, euro, pound, peso and yen, every bit – however small - helps. Larger contributions are also encouraged... Go ahead, watch our video and add your voice to the people who want clean cabin air now. We thank you.

More information:

1) 60 Minutes Australia video – oil fumes story aired in 2013. Many more videos posted here.

2) Practical advice if you breathe oil fumes on aircraft: Cabin crew union offers practical advice for you and your doctor if you breathe oil fumes onboard.

3) Additional information on the research project: Status of current research and proposed work, CVs of research team members, in addition to an abbreviated less-technical overview

4) Global Cabin Air Quality Executive: Global coalition of airline worker unions dedicated to networking, education, and research. If your union is not yet a member, sign up!

5) Aerotoxic.org: Non-profit organization dedicated to raising awareness about the health and safety impact of breathing oil fumes on aircraft, supporting those affected, and pushing for change. Website includes an impressive list of relevant media articles and videos.
story_txt:
Friends Don’t Let
Friends Breathe Oil Fumes on Aircraft: Contribute to Crew and Passenger Health Research Project  (GIVE TEN, GET TEN...)
We are re-launching our campaign on this important subject, having raised more than $3000 which has already been forwarded to the research team. We are again calling everyone who
flies to join our campaign to make air travel healthier. Please GIVE
$10 (or something comparable, any currency) to a talented university research team to finish developing an important blood
test for airline crews and passengers (more information below). Also, GET 10 more people (Facebook friends, any friends, anybody with a pulse...) to do the same.
Ever smelled dirty
socks during an airline flight? A dirty socks smell coming from the aircraft
air supply vents is likely to be engine oil fumes in the ventilation air. You
read that right: the air that comes through the cabin and flight deck vents is
first compressed in the engines, and it isn’t filtered before you breathe it.
Many crew unions around the world receive regular reports from members who
report dirty socks or musty fumes in the cabin supply air, followed by problems
with memory, balance, and speech, for example. Nobody thinks it will happen to
them, until it does.
Every day, just in the
US alone, there is an official report of toxic oil fumes contaminating the air
you breathe on regular commercial flights.  Let alone the many more
reports documented around the globe. Aviation engine oils contain neurotoxic
additives, so breathing the fumes can cause lasting damage to your brain. Also,
flight safety can be compromised when crews are impaired inflight. You will
meet some affected crew members in our video.  
As things stand, few
people  can  access the aircraft maintenance records to PROVE that
oil contaminated the cabin air. And there is no blood test specific to these
fumes, so airlines often say that “nothing was wrong” and that crews and
passengers are just imagining their disabling symptoms. Fortunately, a
dedicated research team at the University of Washington is developing a blood
test specific to the aviation engine oil. You can help by donating to this
campaign. 
If you breathed oil
fumes on YOUR flight today, how would you prove it? If you’re a crewmember,
would the airline doctor listen and support you, or pressure to you to return
to work sick? Would your doctor tell you that you’re over 50 now, so maybe that
explains your memory problems? Can you afford to not work and not get paid for
a while? These are the stories that previously-healthy crewmembers share, and
passengers breathe the same air...
Everyone
who flies needs this blood test, so we all need to GIVE 10 of any currency and
GET 10 friends to do the same. If you are exposed to oil fumes onboard,
then you need to be able to prove it, and all of us need the industry to feel
more motivated to clean up the cabin air.
A single person’s TEN
DOLLARS won’t fund anything, but our GOAL is to bring ENOUGH people onboard
that ENOUGH ten dollar donations are received, that the research will be a
success, for the good of crews everywhere. So please, GIVE TEN, GET TEN, and encourage your flying
partners, family, friends, people you don’t even like, your dog, your barista,
the guy who fixes your car, anyone and everyone, to do the same. 
Don’t leave the page
until you have given $10 and sent the link to ten people!  The GIVE TEN, GET TEN! campaign is overseen
by Clean Up Cabin Air, run by volunteer cabin crew and their supporters.
You can make an anonymous donation, or you can put your name to it - either way
works.
Join us. Change the
way the industry handles the air you breathe on regular commercial flights.
Donate now! Currently, 95% of your donation goes directly to the researchers,
and 5% to Indiegogo, per their rules. We have been approved as a non-profit organization, such that contributions (made in the US, at least) will be
tax-deductible. EVERY dollar, euro, pound, peso and yen, every bit – however
small - helps. Larger contributions are also encouraged... Go ahead, watch our
video and add your voice to the people who want clean cabin air now. We thank
you.
More information:
1) 60
Minutes Australia video – oil fumes story aired in 2013. Many
more videos posted here.
2) Practical
advice if you breathe oil fumes on aircraft: Cabin crew union offers
practical advice for you and your doctor if you breathe oil fumes onboard.
3) Additional
information on the research project: Status
of current research and proposed work, CVs
of research team members, in addition to an abbreviated
less-technical overview
4) Global Cabin Air
Quality Executive: Global coalition of airline worker unions
dedicated to networking, education, and research. If your union is not yet a
member, sign up!
5) Aerotoxic.org:
Non-profit organization dedicated to raising awareness about the health and
safety impact of breathing oil fumes on aircraft, supporting those affected,
and pushing for change. Website includes an impressive list of relevant media
articles and videos.

story:
On September 25, 2012, David Faeller was diagnosed with Esophagus Cancer and it changed his life forever

 

David Faeller, a Bellevue resident, was diagnosed with esophagus cancer on 9/25/12. We are asking for your love, support and help for David and his family at this time. Dave has always been a very caring and loving person to his family and friends. He is the loving father of three young girls, an uncle, a brother, a caring son and many other roles to people in his life. This incident happened a month before his 49th birthday.

 

March 9th. Dave had emergency surgery; during surgery he had a minor heart attack. This fund will be given to the family to help pay for medical expenses, family travel, lost work and incidental expenses to help the family through this difficult time.

 

Now David needs your friendship and support so he can get through this difficult time and be there for everyone that needs him, especially his 3 young girls. His family needs our help too, so they can afford to take care of him and get him to doctor appointments, chemo appointments and Rehab in order for Dave to stay at home. He still has hope, but his life has changed forever.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

ANYTHING you can donate WILL help!  If you have spoken to him since he was diagnosed with Esophagus Cancer with , you know that he is staying positive and is thankful to be alive. In order for David to stay at home, and recover. David will need his rest and not worry about the medical bills or all of the rest of the bills such as rent. He would be more comfortable being able to recover at home with his family and friends around. We hope to at least help them fund this effort. Before this happened, David could not afford health insurance with his job as a truck driver. His medical costs are undetermined right now, but he already has several costly bills and many future expenses. No matter what amount you can donate it will greatly help him and his family with the related costs from his cancer

 

If we do not reach the goal, the funds will still go to the same place and help his family with medical bills and associated costs.

 

The Impact

 

Your donation will not only help Dave and his family with the costs they are incurring from this horrible situation, but it will ultimately show your love and support for his recovery. He needs this positive impact right now.  Becoming temporally disabled right now at the age of 49 and not being able to work right now to provide for his family is a lot to swallow, but not the end! You can also help Dave turn his life into something positive for other people facing similar issues.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

If you cannot give a monetary donation, there are many ways you can help and show support.

 

You can visit Dave or send him a card or something to brighten his spirits.

story:
Hi there,

      My name is Joel Rex. I was born with a genetic disorder called Marfan Syndrome. There is no cure and you never know when some thing will happen to you. There are so many things that can happen to sameone that it would take to long to list so I'm not going to. but I will tell you about me.

    I had a heart attack when I was only 4 this is how we found out that I had Marfan Syndrome. after I spent 7 days in a coma, the docters  told my mother that i would not be the same when I woke up. Oh, no! not me I was just fine and ready to go home. The rest of my child hood was good, like any other Montana kid. I never let Marfan's slow me down or hold me back. I was 24 years old when I had my first major haert operation. This is where they replaced my aortic arch and the mitral valve. 8 mouths later I had the mitral valve replaced again. I made it about 6 years from that and had the mitral vale replacsed one more time. The 4th heart sugery I just had done in Seattle WA, on January 6 2012.  I'm now in need of my fifth haert sugery. I need this one done because of Aneurysm on my AV node. I'm not looking forward to this. but I will beat this just like I always do.

    I would like for all of you to go with me on this journey in my life for my 5th haert sugery. So I will be updataing this post as much as I can.

    I'm here to ask for all your help. I need to go to Seattle one more time. I have every thing I need for this. What I need your help with is the co pays on my Insurance and with paying for my living cost as I recover from my sugery. If everyone gives a little I will reach my goal in no time. For you that took the time to read all of this I Thank you and the best wish for you and for the rest thank you.

story:
Put a hat on the baby!

An effort to ensure that every baby born in MHI's clinic in Uganda has a hat to wear and to raise fund for vitial supplies.

Please note that the babies are not hatted immediately after birth and these hats are gifted when the family prepares to leave the birth clinic. 

How does it work?

You buy an infant hat from me and donate it right back.

Both the hat and the $5 it costs goes straight to MHI 

Your $5 will go to provide LIFESAVING supplies to the clinic

I will crochet each hat so that the new baby has a soft handmade item to keep (oh boy I hope to be busy!) 

You can include a note to the new Mother letting her know who was kind enough to provide some warmth for her new baby. 

You make a difference in the life of a baby, prehaps even save a life.

It's easy! 

The Impact

Many of you will have watched the Kony2012 video last year and while it failed in it's endeavor to have that monster brought to justice, it did highlight the plight of the people in Northern Uganda. As often is the case in war, the women and children suffered the greatest, held captive as sex slaves or conscripted into Kony's army of child soldiers. We can't begin to fathom the horrors they experienced, the survivors are scarred both physically and emotionally. Abducted as children, they disappeared but they need to know they are no longer invisible children.

Mother Health International's Earth Birth Clinic in Atiak serves these women everyday. 
This is the population who were the main target of the LRA's brutality in Uganda.


Understaffed, underfunded and operating on the skills of the volunteer midwives and Traditional Birth Attendants they are doing something no one else is. They offer a safe place, kindness and gentle holistic support to women.  With the nearest hospital being over 2 hours away and running way over capacity, the Birth clinic is a haven for the community.

With some of the highest maternal & neonatal mortality rates in the world Uganda is not a safe place to give birth. But we can change that. One birth at a time, one healthy baby at a time. We can show these women kindness in their most vulnerable period, they can be treated with love and dignity like every woman should be.
We can acknowledge that we see them.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Please pass this along to anyone you feel can contribute $5 

Got the urge to splurge? Contribute more, every $5 sees me making a hat! 

Visit Motherhealthinternational.org for more ways to help 

C'mon how many babies can we put a hat on??

story:
Destinee is currently seeking donations & business sponsors to help offset the cost of the 2012-2013 competitive season.  Competitive cheer is a rewarding sport but can be costly; we are asking for your help by making a donation; the amount you donate is at your discretion.

Triple Threat All Stars is a competitive all-star program, they have youth ages 3-18 years old competing around the United States to earn numerous titles and championships.  Triple Threats creation stems from the need of area cheerleaders and dancers to have an outlet to feed their competitive drive while balancing family, academics, and other school obligations.  The company's goal is to enable athletes to have it all whether it be at the local, regional or national level. www.3tallstars.com

Local businesses, no matter how big or small, can showcase themselves by being involved with one of the most innovated cheerleading programs in NYS. Below are many different sponsorship levels you can choose from to get your business out there in our community. 

*In the event that you do not have a credit card, checks will also be accepted; please make checks payable to Triple Threat All-Stars. Please note in the memo Destinee Ruffin* we can pick up checks or they can be mailed to Stephany Quevillon po box 37 Saratoga Springs NY 12866*

 

I love to cheer and dance competitively and I would like to keep growing in this industry. Any donation you could make to help to make it a little easier for my parents and I will be greatly appreciated.   Thank you very much! LETS GO x x x  3T!

-Destinee

story:
My mother, an OBGYN/LABOR/DELIVERY NURSE, was ending her 12 hour shift at her local hospital on August 10, 2013.  When suddenly she collapsed. She was immediately airlifted to a specialist hospital. Keep in mind she has never smoked, drank, or used any illicit drugs. She was diagnosed with  MRSA, with clots in both lungs, among a few other things. Taking Coumadin along with many other medications for clot reduction. She is having issues regulating her INR with medications. She is only one clot away from a heart attack, a dead lung, or even death.

My mother has been a registered nurse, working in the labor/delivery department for as long as I can remember (over 20 years). She has brought so many lives into the world, and been the one to console those, who at a time of joy had to endure sadness! Once she was released to go home, to relax and recooperate, she found her house in total disarray. To add to the turmoil of this life threatening incident, her now husband (soon to be ex) became extremely abusive, and in her weakened state was forced to leave her home. Temporarily staying with my brother, her son.

Now this is not the end. Due to "red-tape" and timing issues, she has no immediate income to support her. She will eventually start getting a temporary payment from her employer but there is no set date that will kick in. So, at this very moment she is struggling with day to day necessities.......even purchasing food. This breaks my heart!

As a single mother of five, living on a modest $1200 per month I can only contribute so much!

I am asking all of my friends, family, friends of family, anyone to help contribute. Even the smallest amounts help!

Please keep in mind my mother is a very proudfull person and her stubborness will not allow her to ask for help on her own. I literally had to pry the information I got from her to get the truth about her situation. Knowing she would never openly admit it.

If there is anyone interested in donating, in any amount, please contact me as soon as possible. I would like to acquire enough funds to help cover her bills, food, and much needed medication  for at least one month.

I have set up an account for The Janice Calabro Fund and have the accounting and routing numbers if anyone would be interesting in helping during this trying time. Please feel free to contact me 9153177766 or an Facebook as Faith Spradling.

I send prayers and blessings to all those who can contribute and to all those who wish they could contribute!

Thank you so very much,

Faith Spradling

story:
Thank you for checking out our project!

We're featured here: 

http://www.crowdfundingguide.com/

and here: 

http://www.eetimes.com/

Introduction

Our tracking system has already come a long way before becoming an Indiegogo project. We developed the tracker for a pilot project at a company that was specifically looking for simplicity (both hardware and software wise), ease of use and low cost while also being able to be manufactured in non-optimal conditions: even soldered and assembled by hand with minimal training or older equipment. These goals were met within the pilot project; prototypes were produced on a small scale and the project was an overall success.

After the pilot project, we intend to commercialize the tracker on a larger scale, with a roadmap leading to more advanced trackers. We first tried to do this through a Kickstarter campaign, but we believe our funding goals were set too high, even though there were good reasons for the amount of money we asked for. We went back to the campaign drawing board and took input from our Kickstarter backers and critics - and here we are.

We had to make a few concessions on the software timeline, scaled back the roadmap and developed more aspects of the project on our own without relying on crowd funding. This is the reason we were able to scale back the funding from 80.000£ to the current 20.000£. There have been no concessions on hardware, quality, and our aim to manufacture in Europe and the States.

So what do we need the remaining funding for? Besides finalization, some minor tweaks and an initial production run set-up: the plastics. Building custom plastic enclosures is expensive due to the moulds required. The design is kept simple to keep the costs of the molds low, but will still run in the thousands of Euros.

One more important thing to know: for every pledge equal to or greater than 89£ we donate a tracker to the non-profit Technology for Change Foundation - in particular this project. Should you desire to financially contribute to this project, just add the amount you wish to donate to your pledge and let us know.

What can I track?

Basically anything you want! Some use case examples:

- Track your children coming from and going to school.

- Track your loved ones when they go on a trip. It gives you the ability to feel much closer to them even when they are away. Plus, you can guide them to local sights to see even when you're 1000 Miles away.

- Add the tracker to your dog's collar just in case.

- Use as a GPS data logger for geocaching or mapping, or to replay that hiking trip or bike ride you took.

- Use as an early car alarm system notifying when your car is moving when it shouldn't be.

- No more lost luggage, just drop the tracker in your case.

- Need to mail valuable items? Include your tracker in your package and you can follow it every step of the way.

- Moving home? Just pack a tracker and you’ll know exactly where your treasured belongings are.
 

System Overview

The Hardware

- Quad-band GSM/GPRS engine works on frequencies :

  • EGSM 900 MHz/DCS 1800 MHz
  • GSM850 MHz/PCS 1900 MHz.

- GPS receiver with SiRFstar III chip set

  • A 20-channel receiver, which can process the signals of all visible GPS satellites simultaneously
  • 180mW Max. with active antenna (continuous mode)
  • Tracking Sensitivity: -157 ± 2 dBm

Hotstart: < 1 seconds, open sky
Warmstart: < 38 seconds, open sky
Coldstart: < 42 seconds, open sky

- Standard microUSB charger port.

- Power consumption ~5mA or less in STANDBY mode, translating into 2 to 3 weeks standby with  2450 mA battery.

- In POWER OFF mode, using e.g., a motion sensor to activate the device, power consumption  is 10uA for the main system and 140uA for the sensor (both worst case, plus some leakage). This translates into a battery life between 1 to 2 years.

- Overall battery lifetime during active tracking is dependent on amount of tracking updates sent.

- Tracker has expansion port for sensors, data loggers, etc. and combinations. We currently have motion  sensor and microSD card logging. In the future we will add other sensors.

Tracking Features

- Request update at any time
- Software control for tracking interval (10min, 30min, 1hour)
- Tracking mode: instead of timely intervals, send updates based on target speed and heading changes

- logging of data to SD card automatically when present, and 'frequent logging' mode can be set through the software to log location to SD card in 15 second intervals (for hiking applications, etc).

- Mapping software supports Google maps and OpenStreetMap by default. Google StreetView is also integrated.

- Each tracking point contains location, speed, heading, time/date. These can be accessed through markers on the map. The software also supports showing tracks, geo-fencing and GPX export. SD card tracking logs can be imported and visualised.

- Multiple trackers can easily be managed through the software under different categories. All remote configuration of the trackers (e.g. pairing with the software) is done within the software.

- Supports both metric and imperial units

- Reporting in graph form showing speed and distance travelled

- Software is fully cross platform (Windows, Linux, MacOS and FreeBSD). Android application is under development. You can combine the PC software with Android for example to set which device is tracking which asset.

- Independent of third party service provider. Works with prepaid as well as contract SIM cards. This gives you maximum flexibility; if you don't track, you don't pay. No set-up fees, etc. and your sensitive data does not reside on a third party server somewhere.

- You can use Clickatell (http://www.clickatell.com/) for the software to send SMS's to the tracker, or use the USB modem provided. This gives you flexibility to use whatever works out cheapest for your tracking station. When using Clickatell, the modem only needs to receive data from the tracker and thus won't need any credit.

 

There are plenty of other trackers out there, so what makes this one special? We see that most trackers today fall in two categories:

  1. uses hardware which is sold at a loss with a monthly contract to access the tracking data
  2. sends tracking information to a cell phone using SMS where the user can see the coordinates and open a link in Google Maps

Both have some serious disadvantages. The first one has a monthly cost attached even if you're not using the tracker. You could deactivate the subscription for a certain amount of time, but usually there is a reactivation fee when you want to use your tracker again. Furthermore, all the tracking data sits on a third party server. If there is a security breach or if the provider goes out of business your data could very well be compromised or lost.

The second one has a problem of usability. What if you want to track 3 or 4 or a lot more vehicles? How do you efficiently manage this data? Sending text messages to the tracker is prone to errors and can be very tedious. Getting the data back and clicking on a link to get you to a Google map might work for one tracking point, but what if you are tracking a vehicle over time and need to see a history?

The advantage of the second one however is that it uses SMS for the communication of tracking data from or commands to the tracker. Why SMS is a good idea over other technologies such as GPRS, EDGE or 3G/4G?

  • Coverage: works even with connections that are not good enough for voice, and is available where other network services are not
  • The network itself acts as a buffer in case one of the communicating ends has no connection
  • The amount of power needed to send an SMS is much less than to e.g., set up a TCP connection over GPRS
  • Point to Point communication without the need for a server with static IP address

These criteria make that SMS is a very good method. Our software eliminates the disadvantages mentioned before. The application handles all the data coming from the tracker (or trackers), manages settings, has a central map on which to see your data and allows for easy asset management including geofences, integrates Google StreetView capability and can produce a graph showing distance and speed over time.

The application is cross platform and runs already on Windows (XP/7/8), MacOSX, Linux and FreeBSD. It is written in Qt. To send commands to the tracker and receive the data, a simple GSM modem is used by the application. The Android version is being actively developed.

The Raspberry Pi and other low cost ARM devices can be used in combination with a display as dedicated tracking station. Just connect to a screen and you're set to go.

 

Risks and challenges

As always, there are some risks and challenges involved in a project like this, but we can mitigate most of them.

- Since this is based on an existing hardware platform with an existing software application, there is no development that needs to be done from scratch. The production version PCB is ready. The software is ready. Updates will always be possible to enhance functionality, but these are not critical to a fully working system.

- The experience of the team makes that none of the aspects of the project such as developing and commercializing hardware, writing and releasing software, managing projects and funds are new. Everyone on the team has a proven track record.

Nevertheless, some other potential problems can arise:

- Component supply. If there are some components and modules with a larger than expected lead time, we might go over our estimated schedule. This is something we have experience with in the past, and we're trying to mitigate these situations to the best of our abilities, but it can be completely out of our hands. We have multiple suppliers lined up to mitigate this risk.

- Production. A lot of delays on projects like this one is producing in quantity. Building 200 units is not the same as building 2500. The logistics, set up times, and manufacturer choice are just a few of the variables here. For example, getting a batch of 100 units at a prototype facility may be all well and good, but if you suddenly need 1000 each month, this facility most likely will not be able to cover this. We have a range of suppliers and manufacturers lined up to make sure that we can produce any quantity we need. We don't rely on a single source for components, PCB's, etc. This alone means we can be as flexible as possible and not introduce delays due to lead times or congestion at one specific manufacturer.
story_txt:
Thank you for checking out our project!
We're featured here: 
http://www.crowdfundingguide.com/

and here: 
http://www.eetimes.com/

Introduction
Our tracking system has already come a long way before becoming an Indiegogo project. We developed the tracker for a pilot project at a company that was specifically looking for simplicity (both hardware and software wise), ease of use and low cost while also being able to be manufactured in non-optimal conditions: even soldered and assembled by hand with minimal training or older equipment. These goals were met within the pilot project; prototypes were produced on a small scale and the project was an overall success.

After the pilot project, we intend to commercialize the tracker on a larger scale, with a roadmap leading to more advanced trackers. We first tried to do this through a Kickstarter campaign, but we believe our funding goals were set too high, even though there were good reasons for the amount of money we asked for. We went back to the campaign drawing board and took input from our Kickstarter backers and critics - and here we are.
We had to make a few concessions on the software timeline, scaled back the roadmap and developed more aspects of the project on our own without relying on crowd funding. This is the reason we were able to scale back the funding from 80.000£ to the current 20.000£. There have been no concessions on hardware, quality, and our aim to manufacture in Europe and the States.
So what do we need the remaining funding for? Besides finalization, some minor tweaks and an initial production run set-up: the plastics. Building custom plastic enclosures is expensive due to the moulds required. The design is kept simple to keep the costs of the molds low, but will still run in the thousands of Euros.
One more important thing to know: for every pledge equal to or greater than 89£ we donate a tracker to the non-profit Technology for Change Foundation - in particular this project. Should you desire to financially contribute to this project, just add the amount you wish to donate to your pledge and let us know.

What can I track?
Basically anything you want! Some use case examples:
- Track your children coming from and going to school.
- Track your loved ones when they go on a trip. It gives you the ability to feel much closer to them even when they are away. Plus, you can guide them to local sights to see even when you're 1000 Miles away.
- Add the tracker to your dog's collar just in case.
- Use as a GPS data logger for geocaching or mapping, or to replay that hiking trip or bike ride you took.
- Use as an early car alarm system notifying when your car is moving when it shouldn't be.
- No more lost luggage, just drop the tracker in your case.
- Need to mail valuable items? Include your tracker in your package and you can follow it every step of the way.
- Moving home? Just pack a tracker and you’ll know exactly where your treasured belongings are. 
System Overview
The Hardware
- Quad-band GSM/GPRS engine works on frequencies :

EGSM 900 MHz/DCS 1800 MHz
GSM850 MHz/PCS 1900 MHz.

- GPS receiver with SiRFstar III chip set

A 20-channel receiver, which can process the signals of all visible GPS satellites simultaneously
180mW Max. with active antenna (continuous mode)
Tracking Sensitivity: -157 ± 2 dBm

Hotstart: < 1 seconds, open skyWarmstart: < 38 seconds, open skyColdstart: < 42 seconds, open sky
- Standard microUSB charger port.
- Power consumption ~5mA or less in STANDBY mode, translating into 2 to 3 weeks standby with  2450 mA battery.
- In POWER OFF mode, using e.g., a motion sensor to activate the device, power consumption  is 10uA for the main system and 140uA for the sensor (both worst case, plus some leakage). This translates into a battery life between 1 to 2 years.
- Overall battery lifetime during active tracking is dependent on amount of tracking updates sent.
- Tracker has expansion port for sensors, data loggers, etc. and combinations. We currently have motion  sensor and microSD card logging. In the future we will add other sensors.

Tracking Features
- Request update at any time- Software control for tracking interval (10min, 30min, 1hour)- Tracking mode: instead of timely intervals, send updates based on target speed and heading changes
- logging of data to SD card automatically when present, and 'frequent logging' mode can be set through the software to log location to SD card in 15 second intervals (for hiking applications, etc).

- Multiple trackers can easily be managed through the software under different categories. All remote configuration of the trackers (e.g. pairing with the software) is done within the software.
- Supports both metric and imperial units
- Reporting in graph form showing speed and distance travelled
- Software is fully cross platform (Windows, Linux, MacOS and FreeBSD). Android application is under development. You can combine the PC software with Android for example to set which device is tracking which asset.
- Independent of third party service provider. Works with prepaid as well as contract SIM cards. This gives you maximum flexibility; if you don't track, you don't pay. No set-up fees, etc. and your sensitive data does not reside on a third party server somewhere.

This gives you flexibility to use whatever works out cheapest for your tracking station. When using Clickatell, the modem only needs to receive data from the tracker and thus won't need any credit.

sends tracking information to a cell phone using SMS where the user can see the coordinates and open a link in Google Maps

Both have some serious disadvantages. The first one has a monthly cost attached even if you're not using the tracker. You could deactivate the subscription for a certain amount of time, but usually there is a reactivation fee when you want to use your tracker again. story:
Our Mission 

Students at Manchester Community College will travel to Santo Domingo, Ecuador from January 11 - 19 for a medical mission through with Timmy Global Health.  While in Ecuador, we will help provide primary care and health education to a community supported year round by Timmy Global Health brigades like ours at Manchester Community College.  

What We Need - Help us go above our goal!

Our goal is small, but we would love to exceed it! With the money raised, we will purchase medical supplies, medicines and vitamins to take with us to Ecuador.  

Promoting Global Health Equity (from timmyglobalhealth.org)

At Timmy, we believe that addressing today’s most pressing global health challenges and ensuring that everyone has access to quality healthcare will require a combination of two things:

-Fostering sustained commitments to our communities, patients, and our amazing partner organizations on the front lines of providing quality healthcare to the underserved;

-Inspiring the next generation of healthcare professionals and leaders to actively fight health disparities, tackle global health challenges, and promote health equity throughout their personal and professional lives.

Through our programming, Timmy does both. By supporting the missions of our partner organizations and complementing their work with short-term medical service teams, in-kind resources, and year-round funding, we seek to build their capacity, expand their outreach, and help provide quality healthcare to marginalized, underserved communities in the developing world.

Our deadline is December 2nd.

story:
PROJECT HOKA HEY

(Hoka Hey means, "It's a good day to die.")

Matthew 16:25 "For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for My sake will find it."

We look at Hoka Hey twofold: As warriors willing to die for what we believe in and as men of God who seek the Lord by dying to ourselves everyday.


Hi, my name is Philip Craig and I love changing peoples lives through fitness!
As part of growing up the only thing I ever felt connected to was sports. I worked hard to be the best at everything I did, especially on the football field. Striving to be the best came at a heavy price with countless hours of training, going over plays, and pushing my body to places few people can go. This training encouraged me to graduate high school being first team all league and got me a football scholarship to college where I finished as an All American running back and received my BS in Movement of Sports Science. From there, I was given a once in a life time opportunity to travel to Germany to play in the European Football League.

Coming back from Germany, I tried countless NFL Combines where I just couldn't make my brake at the NFL. With failure all around me, one thing remained constant, my work ethic, which the Lord left me with that changed not only my life but changed other peoples lives too. This work ethic pushed me to begin my own personal training business. As a trainer I was reliving my high school/college career through athletes by giving them the football knowledge I learned to get bigger, faster, and stronger and watch them grow as I did.

Just as my training career started, so did my CrossFit career. With crazy workouts, putting me on the floor, only after 5 minutes of work, I found a new way to push my body and a new way to implement athletes with training schemes and functional movements they could not only use on any field but in everyday life as well. After about a year of learning the methodology of CrossFit through the workouts, I decided to take my new found knowledge and apply it to everyday people to help them get fit, lose weight, compete against themselves and to have FUN! A year later, countless pounds and countless people have been changed due to CrossFit and Gods power to stick to a fitness program and reach their goals.

That's where you come in.  With your donation I will be able to get my own building to share my knowledge with countless people that want to get into shape, stay in shape or just give them something to do.  Each donation will bring me one step closer to achieving a plan to help the obesity crisis, giving children and kids activities and a  positive environment to be in and to be healthy.  Fitness, health, camaraderie, family, and competition are things I can bring to the table, all I need is capitol to make it all happen.  Please help me achieve a goal that I have set for myself, and when I achieve my goal it can help you achieve your goal of getting in shape! NOW GET OFF YOUR BUTT AND DONATE SO WE CAN GET TO WORK!!! 

THANK YOU AND GOD BLESS =)



What We Need


This is the breakdown of what we are asking for:


  • Building ($5,000 Zoning Fee)
  • Gym Flooring ($3,000)
  • Pull Up Rig ($1,500)
  • Gym Name Fee ($3,000)
  • ANYTHING EXTRA WE MAKE WILL GO STRAIGHT TO THE GYM (WEIGHTS, DRY ERASE BOARDS ECT..) 


These are the main obstacles we're encountering with opening this gym.

We have a building location that is perfect but the zoning needs to be reevaluated for a fitness center. The City will approve the zoning once the fees are paid and all the necessary conditions of the facility are met.

The Gym Flooring and Pull Up Rig come next. With heavy weight being lifted and dropped, we need thick rubber flooring that can absorb the shock. The Pull Up Rig is for doing Gymnastic movements such as Ring Pull Ups, Bar Muscle Ups and of course your regular Pull Ups and as well as being used for racking barbells for Squats, Bench Press and things alike when working out.

Last comes the Name of the Gym. We want to be affiliated as a CrossFit gym. There is a $3,000 fee that comes from the name alone.

If we don't reach the funding, we will keep pressing forward. I will do anything and everything it takes to make this happen with relentless drive. This is important to me, and I will make it happen.

The Impact

Bringing this fitness facility would make a huge impact on the community and the surrounding area. This is important because school athletes would have a place to workout to get better at their sport and get in shape as well as  adults and young children within the city. This would give residents an in-town place and not have to drive far to get a workout in. Exercising daily will help us be healthy and give us better lives and fight against the American obesity crisis.

We make it easy on you by planning out the workouts at weight for your strength, make it FUN and most of all make it FAMILY oriented to come in and reach goals we never thought possible.

My family impact

My family is the most important thing in my life!  I have a beautiful wife who is pregnant as we speak, and two handsome boys that are full of energy.  My wife who is a homemaker works tirelessly to take care of  my sons as I am working throughout the day.  With your help I will be able to take my business to the next level and provide for my family through the success of this venture.  The lord has provided so much for us and we use the talents that he has given us to empower others to reach their goals.   

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help spread the word about our campaign to your family, friends and co-workers. Like us on Facebook and share our Indiegogo Page. Let all those whom you know to get involved and purchase some of the products of ours. We need every ones help to make this happen. As always we appreciate your support to contribute to our funding needs.


Thank You!

May God Richly Bless You!

story:
Short Summary

I am working on the last year and a half of my bachelor's degree in Psychology, and will continue to work on a Master's in Psychological Nursing. In addition to having a strong desire to help humans, I have always loved cats, striving to help promote the bond between humans and animals. To help with both my passions, humans and animals, I would love to get certified as a Pet Therapy Team with my cat, Todd. Not only will this fulfill my passions, but it will also benefit my continuing education as Certification is highly desirable in finishing my degree and becoming a better candidate for employment in my field.

You might ask what a Therapy Pet is; in short, therapy pets are pets that volunteer to visit hospitals, nursing homes, and other locations where people could benefit from interactions with animals (pets are known for lowering stress, which includes illness-related stress). The most common type of pet used are dogs, so my goal is a bit unique in the sense that I will become certified with my cat, whom I believe to be a good candidate for this program.

In terms of my cat, Todd, he is one of those types of cats who enjoys meeting new people, loves to explore places he's never been (as seen by his love of going for stroller rides to beaches, around the neighborhood and through stores he's allowed in), loves to cuddle (once he's done exploring), and doesn't scare too easily. For these reasons, I believe he's a great candidate for becoming a therapy cat.

What I Need & What You Get

Since I am a student, I am unable to pay the fees associated with Pet Therapy certification. The required class to start the process of becoming certified  is $70, a health certificate for Todd for being a Certified Therapy cat ranges from $50-$100, and the actual certification itself to start volunteering to help people with Todd is $95. This amount adds up to between $215 and $265, depending on the cost of Todd's health certification. Indiegogo requires a minimum initial asking price of $500, so I've chosen the flexible funding option. Should I get up to the actual $500, the remainder will still go towards the promotion of the human-animal bond; it will be donated to the Berkeley Humane Society. If I don't raise enough to cover the entire costs of becoming certified, I will use what is raised to start the process by registering in the required class for certification and as far past that as I can go.

The Impact

Cats are under-represented in the Pet Therapy world, despite the fact that they are one of the most popular pets in the United States. Further, research has shown that cats have the ability to lower stress levels and to elevate moods. This can benefit the overall health of those who are unable to have pets of their own or are unable to have pets with them in hospitals or nursing homes. If you've ever spent time in a hospital, imagine the surge of happiness you would have felt if you were visited by a dog or cat; how bright your day would have become!
