In addition to having a strong desire to help humans, I have always loved cats, striving to help promote the bond between humans and animals. To help with both my passions, humans and animals, I would love to get certified as a Pet Therapy Team with my cat, Todd. Not only will this fulfill my passions, but it will also benefit my continuing education as Certification is highly desirable in finishing my degree and becoming a better candidate for employment in my field.You might ask what a Therapy Pet is; in short, therapy pets are pets that volunteer to visit hospitals, nursing homes, and other locations where people could benefit from interactions with animals (pets are known for lowering stress, which includes illness-related stress). The most common type of pet used are dogs, so my goal is a bit unique in the sense that I will become certified with my cat, whom I believe to be a good candidate for this program.In terms of my cat, Todd, he is one of those types of cats who enjoys meeting new people, loves to explore places he's never been (as seen by his love of going for stroller rides to beaches, around the neighborhood and through stores he's allowed in), loves to cuddle (once he's done exploring), and doesn't scare too easily. For these reasons, I believe he's a great candidate for becoming a therapy cat.What I Need & What You GetSince I am a student, I am unable to pay the fees associated with Pet Therapy certification. The required class to start the process of becoming certified  is $70, a health certificate for Todd for being a Certified Therapy cat ranges from $50-$100, and the actual certification itself to start volunteering to help people with Todd is $95. This amount adds up to between $215 and $265, depending on the cost of Todd's health certification. Indiegogo requires a minimum initial asking price of $500, so I've chosen the flexible funding option. Should I get up to the actual $500, the remainder will still go towards the promotion of the human-animal bond; it will be donated to the Berkeley Humane Society. If I don't raise enough to cover the entire costs of becoming certified, I will use what is raised to start the process by registering in the required class for certification and as far past that as I can go.The ImpactCats are under-represented in the Pet Therapy world, despite the fact that they are one of the most popular pets in the United States. Further, research has shown that cats have the ability to lower stress levels and to elevate moods. This can benefit the overall health of those who are unable to have pets of their own or are unable to have pets with them in hospitals or nursing homes. If you've ever spent time in a hospital, imagine the surge of happiness you would have felt if you were visited by a dog or cat; how bright your day would have become!

story:
Hi Friends!

Justin here! As you may know, I recently found myself in a hospital with a really bad infection! This came as something of a surprise. A medically induced coma and several spinal taps later, I'm back out! 
Happily, I'm doing quite better, if a little worse for wear. As part of my recovery, I'm under doctor's orders to work on a creative project without stress. 

What's In It For You? 

As a thank you for your contribution, I'd like to produce a mini-comic and send you a copy! 

Who am I supposed to be? 

  • I am an Emmy-award winning Animator 
  • Seven years animation experience
  • Fairly tall
  • Fairly bald (prior to hospitalization) 

    • Contributing to this campaign will help me immeasurably; bills continue to pile up, and I'm still too broken to go back to work. This will help pay for a portion of my hospital bills  and keep my head above water while I recover from seizures and ventilators. 
    For your much-needed help, I'd like to make you a comic! I'd like to produce a run of mini-comics to send out to contributors to this cause. 
    Each copy will have a unique hand-drawn sketch, too! 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Are you broke! That's ok! Please just share this around! 

    And that’s all there is to it.

Contributing to this campaign will help me immeasurably; bills continue to pile up, and I'm still too broken to go back to work. This will help pay for a portion of my hospital bills  and keep my head above water while I recover from seizures and ventilators. 


For your much-needed help, I'd like to make you a comic! I'd like to produce a run of mini-comics to send out to contributors to this cause. 
Each copy will have a unique hand-drawn sketch, too!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
This is the AquaSafeBag!



If you are the kind of person who likes to have total control over every aspect of your life and feel relaxed, then we have a product for you!

AquaSafeBag is a product that can store your phone, money and keys away from water, and potentially save your life.


Are you a sea or water sports lover? Here is why you need this bag!

Thousands of people become victims of theft at the beach every year, which leads to the unpleasant situation of not being able to relax because they must keep an eye out for their belongings, while instead, they should be chilling out and enjoying their vacation or their favorite water sport!

Usually we place all our stuff in a sea bag and try to enjoy swimming. This can be quite an issue, since, no one really likes staying behind alone to watch out for such an occasion. We would hate to come back only to find everything stolen. A very unpleasant situation as you can imagine.

Of course you could also try to hide them under the sand :)

But don't worry. AquaSafeBag can solve this problem!

What AquaSafeBag can do to solve this?

AquaSafeBag deals with this problem by being made entirely of waterproof material, as well as having an airtight/waterproof case, that allows us to place our valuables inside and protect them from harm or theft. This special case, provides excellent protection against water and even if it is left unsealed, water still cannot penetrate it.

Why is this so special? 

Well, we have taken it a step further by implementing a life preserver! In the small front pocket of the bag, we have placed an air cartridge that can make the life preserver spring out of its container and be fully fledged in less than 3 seconds by simply pulling a small cord.

Just attach the air cartridge:

Fold it and put it inside the bag:

If you need to use it just pull the string:

And the life preserver will automatically inflate in just 3 seconds:

The preserver and the bag can be of course used as many times as you like, either by replacing the air cartridge or by just blowing in the tube.

And don't worry about the cost of the air cartridge, we converted the air cartridge mechanism to use common affordable bike air cartridges (bike pumps) that can be found easily at various bike stores or other hardware shops.

The life preserver can support enough weight for a big swimmer, and it is not just for personal use since it can be easily detached from the bag!

Have you ever been for a swim and a person near you needs help?

If we are not familiar with the correct way to assist that person, we might run into a very serious issue or other unpleasant scenarios.

However by using AquaSafeBag, we can simply pull the cord:

...and give that person the life preserver from a safe distance and then easily help that person swim out.

So having AquaSafeBag with you makes you feel secure because it can help you in any case of panic, fear or sickness, while at the same time your personal items are secured with you.


Use AQUASAFEBAG everywhere

AquaSafeBag can be used in many cases where we cannot take things like our iPhone with us, since water can irreparably damage it. These cases could be:

- All sorts of water sports like Water Ski, Kite Surfing etc


- Swimmers

- Fishers, sailers

- Lifeguards

Of course aside from the aforementioned uses, AquaSafeBag can be used for everyday activities since it's a really nice fit for men:

or women:

The idea is to just feel relaxed and secure

By using AquaSafeBag you can feel the required safety for you and your family since it can help someone in any case of panic, fear or injury when at the same time it keeps your belongings safe at all times.

Fabric and design features:

All fabric selections have been specifically chosen to make you feel great whilst everything is safe in the water resistant material. Zip pullers, size, heat transfer, labels and all accessories are carefully selected for best bag efficiency. Here's some of the technical details:

  • Nylon cloth: Nylon oxford (210D)
  • Nylon compound TPU: N210D / TPU 
  • Oral Tube: KQZ 
  • Webbing: D-66 
  • Thread: 20S/2/2150D 
  • Buckle: 38mm 
  • Inflation Device: AHA4013
  • Weight with air cartridge: 33.2gr
  • Weight without air cartridge: 27.4gr


How we did it (some history, some prototype designs and actual tests in the water)

Christos invented the product after many different designs and variations. Here are some of the designs that he tried before the last improved design:

Of course he didn't came up with the right combination right away! He spent many hours and effort and have designed many prototypes to get to the right one.

Here are some of them:

Prototype #3

Prototype #6

Prototype #7

And here are some actual tests at the beach with different bags:

And different life preserver sizes:

And different inflation systems:

Do you see the sand on the inflation devices? We tried it out over and over with as many different conditions as we could!

Patent documentation

Christos went a step further by filing a patent of his invention. 

Here is the PCT of the invention of AquaSafeBag:

And here is the patent file for Greece (in Greek):

AquaSafeBag has also made it to the Europe Enterprise Network web site which is the biggest European Technology Transfer Market!

The next steps

We are happy to be currently at final prototype stage on our first order batch. Our first 300 AquaSafeBags (first design version) are already here and have been quality control checked.

On reaching our funding goal your money will go directly on moving the AquaSafeBag from final prototype stage into serious production numbers with a much lower cost. 

The original AquaSafeBag was created for local use but we decided to move it to production since the reviews to it from friends has been very enthusiastic. USA, Australia, Greece, Spain, Portugal, Italy, France, Brazil, Caribbean, Turkey, Croatia, Egypt are only some of the countries with great beaches and famous locations for sports like surfing, kite surfing, water skiing and others. 

So in the last 12 months we redesigned it and made a few improvements along the way for production at a low cost. We also converted the air cartridge mechanism to use common affordable bike air cartridges (bike pumps) that can be found easily at various bike stores or other hardware stores.

We already have made 300 of them (first design version), but we’ve found a manufacturing partner capable of delivering the level of quality that is needed, at the right low price if we can order batches of 2500 bags or more. And this is where we need all you, since when you back this project you actually pre-order your very own AquaSafeBag.

Of course we have to note that AquaSafeBag is a gadget and not a safety tool, so it cannot replace a life vest or any other certified safety equipment.

(We are also looking for partners all over the world)

story:
Short Summary

For 8 years we have offered our educational events and materials FREE to attendees at our pain education events throughout the country. These attendees are often low income, under insured and under treated. These are the people, along with their families, who need this information the most. To offer this event FREE to attendees year after year we have to raise the funds for each event. 

The Power of Pain Foundation is pleased to announce their hosting of the 8th annual National P.A.I.N. Summit based on donations from the general public and sponsors who will allow us to choose our presenters and a wide variety of pain topics. 

The next P.A.I.N. Summit will feature talk show host Montel Williams, Derek Amato, of Ingenious Minds on the Discovery Channel, Dr. Nat Strand winner of the CBS Amazing Race, Drew Ryniewicz finalist on X-Factor, providers presenting on traditional and non-traditional treatment options and other motivational speakers throughout the day. 

The Power of Pain Foundation (POPF), a National 501-C-3 charity, donations are tax deductible to the maximum amount allowable by law. 

POPF’s National P.A.I.N. Summit – No Charge for attendance

This event takes place on November 14, 2014 in Chandler, AZ and will also be broadcast live via the world-wide-web for people who cant attend in-person. This annual event provides a great avenue of pain education for providers, patients and their caregivers. This year’s conference consists of an exhibit area and educational sessions that focus on better diagnosis and treatment options for pain patients, chronic pain issues (as a whole), prescription monitoring programs, and proper opioid management. This event will offer patients and healthcare professionals in search for answers to the complex questions surrounding chronic pain illnesses and disabilities. There will be focus on a multimodality approach to care. This event will be marketed throughout the entire country and we anticipate over 1,000 attendees.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $50,150 for the upcoming event on November 14, 2014 to provide all of the opportunities to the attendees that we feel are valuable and necessary. Below is a breakdown of the costs. 

Total Cost of Program $50,150
Honorarium: Speakers $10,000
Speakers Travel Expenses (airfare/hotel) $5,000
Venue $7,000
Marketing $15,500
Audiovisual $1,800
Meeting Materials - Printed $5,350
Production Expenses $5,500

Some of our unique perks include Virtual Event Bags, In-person event bags, Orange carpet entrance, Photo opportunities with the speakers, T-shirts, POPF promo items, Donor name recognition at the event, Flights, Hotel stays and more. 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still offer the speakers who are already contracted to speak, the venue, web services, and event marketing. Some of the items that will be forgone are meeting materials and all production expenses we are able to cut out. We are hoping that we do meet our entire goal in order to provide the best event possible for those that participate as attendees. 

    The Impact

    The Power of Pain Foundation is dedicated to increase the number of patients receiving effective pain relief. This event will accomplish this by arming pain patients, caretakers, family and healthcare professionals with cutting edge and motivational information. POPF is working to empower patients to be self-advocates, improving pain care, and positioning pain management as a priority. The goals for this event are to address some of the challenges faced by the 116 million people in the United States with a chronic pain diseases.

    POPF understands the importance of early diagnosis and treatment and recognize that there is not yet enough education in the healthcare field for professionals and patients. POPF is very proud of what we have achieved as a nonprofit charity and as a great motivator of patient rights and advocacy and keeping this program free for attendees. 

      Risks & Challenges

      The risks and obstacles we may face on the way to achieving our goal is that we wont reach our projected budget to make the best event possible and may miss out on providing the best resources for attendees due to the budget restraints. We are growing each year and this will be our biggest in-person attended event of the past 8 years. We are working hard to overcome our budget difficulties and provide all attendees with the best event we can afford while costing the attendees nothing out of pocket. We want attendees and participants to know pain education, learn about ways to control their pain levels, and receive the best information available to date at this event. The more we raise the more FREE education events we can provide across the country. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        Even if you don't have have funds to donate you can still help this event by getting the word out and making noise about the campaign. Spread awareness so people know pain and no pain. And if you are in Arizona, we could use more event day volunteers to help everything run smoothly. Also please feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools! And that's all there is to it.

story:
I need a golf cart to cruise the East Side in. Nothing else really needs to be said to rationalize that, but for the sake of filling this space: Everyone wins if this happens. This is a wonderful opportunity for you to experiment with philanthropy. Just consider the glorious scenario of this campaign succeeding: some guy in Houston, Texas got a golf cart for free because of the internet. That concept alone is worthy of a donation.




Praise Bob! Hail Eris!

story:
Hi I’m Mike, a local organic farmer here in Ottawa, Ontario.  Below you will find more information about my certified organic market garden, founded in 2012, currently completing it’s first year of operation on River Road as well as my hopes for the future of Mike’s Garden Harvest.

It has been an excellent season!  I have grown vegetables for 32 local families, been to the Parkdale Market and become a member of Savour Ottawa raising the farm's profile among the restaurant community. My submitted crop plan to MyPick Ontario passed and I became a verified local commercial grower. I also managed to earn my organic certification from Ecocert Canada, after their rigorous inspection of my field.

Before starting my current farm, I spent over a year searching to find a spot with the ideal growing conditions. I feel truly fortunate to have found just such a field with good earth, excellent airflow and full sunlight in such close proximity to my current and potential markets.

After looking at a lot of different models, I determined that my crop plan would based on a farm of a very similar size located in southern Quebec run by a man named Jean-Martin Fortier and his wife Maude-Helene Desroches. Now in their tenth year, their emphasis is to "grow better not bigger", where they have perfected a successful micro-farm system which is both highly productive and profitable.

I have my feet planted firmly in the soil; I don’t expect Mike’s Garden Harvest to be able to immediately emulate Les Jardins de la Grelinette.

My priorities this year have been to:
- increase my share base
- get the feel of the soil at my new location
- contrast my projected numbers with the results I achieved as my crop plan was put in motion

This might not sound very earthy but it needs to be done to ensure the farm is viable.

Which brings me to why I am seeking help funding my dream on Indiegogo.

As I indicated in my video, building a system of raised 30" beds with 18" walkways using a BCS 739 two-wheel tractor to maximize the space I have is the next step. It's a diesel tractor and very fuel efficient with  some very innovative attachments.  The most important of which is the rotary power harrow that allows me to work the surface without inverting the layers of the soil protecting its’ structure.

In addition, floating row covers to protect my crops from frost and insects will both lengthen my season and expand where I can sell my produce. It will cost about 4,500 dollars in total but with care much of this can be used for a number of years.

I am also aiming to install high tunnels so I can string tomatoes and cucumber protecting them from blights and bugs.  

Compared to the conventional farming systems that I knew as a youth and studied at the University of Guelph, the capital investment is marginal. However, from my vantage point it, at this juncture, it is out of reach for me.

So... this is me asking you, my neighbour, for a boost as I prepare my field for a good start in 2015. I am quite resourceful and can make a little go a long way. I already have an eye on a barely used BCS tractor and a complete set of attachment for under $10,000. I also know where I can get some old greenhouse hoops for cheap.  So your hard earned support will work as hard for me as you did for it.

As for me, it is fair to say that I am as far from a 'tree hugger' as you are going to find in organic circles. But I truly believe in in the importance of growing food honestly and with care, the way it is meant be grown. The way it is meant to be consumed.

Thank you for this time, your consideration of this project and please at the very least I ask that your response be to share my venture with others who you believe might share this passion. Any questions or insights that you might have can always be directed to me. This is all of me in the writing and so with that, I wish you and your family an excellent day! 


Sincerely, 



Links for more Information:

This is an article written by esteemed blogger Valerie Ward (@Earthward)after she spent a couple of hours visiting with me and touring my field. I was honoured to draw the attention of someone so significant in our community.

Mike’s Garden Harvest: First-season CSA focuses on success


Below is a video link that introduces Jean-Martin and also gives you a very good visual of how their farm is set up.  The farm now has four full time employees and throughout the season has grossed more than $150,000 dollars last year. Just as importantly, their practices are environmentally responsible and their vegetables are delicious :-) 

Introducing Jean-Martin - The Market Gardener


And finally, here is the link for those of you who want a hard look at the kind of equipment and supplies that I am talking about and the sources that I would likely go to if I am having to purchase brand new.  Many of the hand tools and seeders have already been purchased and were found very effective.

The Equipment and Tool List


Some testimonials from some happy customers:

Hey Michael,

I did get the basket, and it looks fantastic! The first thing on my agenda for this morning was to email you to tell you that, but you beat me to it. 

Thanks so much!

Ashley

__________________________________

Hi Mike,

Just wanted to say thanks again for today’s basket. We had the green beans with fresh salmon, local corn and a small salad with the greens. It was fantastic. Tomorrow we are going to do something with the beats.

Casey

__________________________________

Hey Mike.

The basket of goodies was very much enjoyed.  Thank you.

We particularly enjoyed the mesclun mix.  Lots of greens we have not tried before, so wonderful to experience something new!

Thanks so much.

Sue

__________________________________

Got the box. Thanks very much! The beans are amazing.

Best Regards Kevin …..

__________________________________

Hello, 

We just want to say thank you for this season's first veggie supply :) The salad mixes are great! Love the radishes!!! 

Looking forward to the rest of the season's "goodies" 

Thank you, 

Ewa and Matt

__________________________________

Hi, I thought I'd send an email.

I'm quite happy to be part of this venture. It just gives me a good feeling. I'm always pleased to support a local business.

That said, the quantity of vegetables arriving all at once is a lot for me. I was wondering if, next season, it would be possible to donate my share to a foodbank. Or part of it.

I sincerely hope it's going well.

Michelle
__________________________________

Thank you for following up! We got last night.  We are feasting on them today with some new recipes.  Carol unleashed!!   The veggies look and taste great!!!

Peter

__________________________________

Our first salad!!  Thank you so much.

Arika
story_txt:
Hi
I’m Mike, a local organic farmer here in Ottawa, Ontario.  Below
you will find more information about my certified organic market garden,
founded in 2012, currently completing it’s first year of operation on River
Road as well as my hopes for the future of Mike’s Garden Harvest.It has been an excellent season!  I have grown vegetables for 32 local families,
been to the Parkdale Market and become a member of Savour Ottawa raising the
farm's profile among the restaurant community. My submitted crop plan to MyPick Ontario passed and I became a verified local commercial grower. I also managed to earn my organic certification from Ecocert Canada, after their rigorous inspection of my field.
Before
starting my current farm, I spent over a year searching to find a spot with
the ideal growing conditions. I feel truly fortunate to have found just such a
field with good earth, excellent airflow and full sunlight in such close
proximity to my current and potential markets.
After
looking at a lot of different models, I determined that my crop plan would
based on a farm of a very similar size located in southern Quebec run by a man
named Jean-Martin Fortier and his wife Maude-Helene Desroches. Now in their
tenth year, their emphasis is to "grow better not bigger", where they
have perfected a successful micro-farm system which is both highly productive
and profitable.
I
have my feet planted firmly in the soil; I don’t expect Mike’s Garden Harvest
to be able to immediately emulate Les Jardins de la Grelinette. 
My priorities this year have been to: 
- increase my share base
- get the feel of the soil at my new location
- contrast my projected numbers with the results I achieved as my crop plan was
put in motion
This might not sound very earthy but it needs to be done to ensure the farm is
viable.
Which brings me to why I am seeking help funding my dream on Indiegogo. 
As
I indicated in my video, building a system of raised 30" beds with
18" walkways using a BCS 739 two-wheel tractor to maximize the space I
have is the next step. It's a diesel tractor and very fuel efficient with  some very innovative attachments. 
The most important of which is the rotary power harrow that allows me to
work the surface without inverting the layers of the soil protecting its’
structure.
In
addition, floating row covers to protect my crops from frost and insects will
both lengthen my season and expand where I can sell my produce. It will cost
about 4,500 dollars in total but with care much of this can be used for a
number of years.
I
am also aiming to install high tunnels so I can string tomatoes and cucumber
protecting them from blights and bugs.  
Compared
to the conventional farming systems that I knew as a youth and studied at the University
of Guelph, the capital investment is marginal. However, from my vantage point
it, at this juncture, it is out of reach for me. 
So...
this is me asking you, my neighbour, for a boost as I prepare my field for a
good start in 2015. I am quite resourceful and can make a little go a long way.
I already have an eye on a barely used BCS tractor and a complete set of
attachment for under $10,000. I also know where I can get some old greenhouse
hoops for cheap.  So your hard earned
support will work as hard for me as you did for it.As
for me, it is fair to say that I am as far from a 'tree hugger' as you are
going to find in organic circles. But I truly believe in in the importance of
growing food honestly and with care, the way it is meant be grown. The way it is meant
to be consumed.Thank
you for this time, your consideration of this project and please at the very
least I ask that your response be to share my venture with others who you
believe might share this passion. Any questions or insights that you might have
can always be directed to me. This is all of me in the writing and so with
that, I wish you and your family an excellent day! 

Sincerely, 
Links for more Information:This is an article written by esteemed blogger Valerie Ward (@Earthward)after she spent a couple of hours visiting with me and touring my field. I was honoured to draw the attention of someone so significant in our community.Mike’s Garden Harvest: First-season CSA focuses on successBelow is a video link that introduces Jean-Martin and also gives you a very
good visual of how their farm is set up.  The farm now has four full time employees and
throughout the season has grossed more than $150,000 dollars last year. Just as
importantly, their practices are environmentally responsible and their
vegetables are delicious :-) 
Introducing Jean-Martin -
The Market GardenerAnd finally, here is the link for those of you who want a hard look at the kind of equipment and supplies that I am talking about and the sources that I would likely go to if I am having to purchase brand new.  Many of the hand tools and seeders have already been purchased and were found very effective.The Equipment and Tool List Some testimonials from some happy customers:

I did get the basket, and it looks fantastic! The first thing on my agenda 
for this morning was to email you to tell you that, but you beat me to 
it. 
Thanks so much!

Just 
wanted to say thanks again for today’s basket. We had the green beans with fresh 
salmon, local corn and a small salad with the greens. It was fantastic. Tomorrow 
we are going to do something with the beats.
Casey

The basket of goodies was very much enjoyed.  Thank you.
We particularly enjoyed the mesclun mix.  Lots of greens we have not tried

Thanks so much.Sue__________________________________Got

story:
Help Me Spread Hope

I want to recover 100% from Lyme Disease and show others who are also suffering that it is possible! I want to spread hope in this seemingly hopeless illness. There aren't enough recovery stories out there, but I am confident that the only thing holding me back from a full recovery, is the cost.

If I reach my goal for this campaign, I will donate $1,000 to the LymeLight Foundation to help a child in need.

I am 32 years old and have a lot of life left to live. I think I can make a difference in the Lyme world if I am given the opportunity.

What You Get

Part of this journey for me has been learning humility and discovering the beauty in vulnerability. Since I was ill and could not be physically active, I was forced to find other ways to spend my time. My partner, Jason, suggested that I paint. I had always believed that I didn't have a creative bone in my body, so I was hesitant (to say the least) to explore art. I told him I didn't know HOW to paint. His response was, "there's no rules"! I bought some paint and paper. I sat down and painted for this first time in my life and was amazed at how it instantly soothed my irritated nervous system. 

Painting has become a really helpful tool in healing for me. No, I am not a trained artist with incredible ability, but putting color on paper in whatever form my mind wants is allowing my body to heal. I want you to have a piece of that experience and I want to motivate myself to spend more time in that space. So, if you donate $100 or more, you will receive a hand-painted 5x7 card. The photos on this page are examples of some of the cards I have already painted.

My Motivation to Heal

My biggest passion in life is playing. Playing in any way I can. My life before Lyme was full of fun adventures in every season. I miss those adventures. My heart aches to be able to play in the woods all day like I used to.

When I got sick, I couldn't even walk one block without collapsing. I sometimes couldn't talk. There certainly were times where I felt I would be defeated. But, I always kept coming back to that fire inside. That will to be free. That longing to be in the mountains. 

So, I did everything I possibly could to fight this infection. I have dramatically changed my diet and lifestyle. I quit coffee, alcohol, sugar, dairy, and grains. I eat only organic whole foods. I started a meditation practice. I get a minimum of 8 hours of sleep a night (which usually means very little socializing). I overcame my fear of needles and I give myself an intramuscular injection every morning. I take 85 pills a day. I drink only water and lots of it. I commit at least one night a week to soaking in an epsom salt bath. I regularly sit in an infrared sauna. I eat (drink?) whatever disgusting green algae potion my doctor wants me to without hesitation. I stay current on new research and developments in Late-Stage Lyme Disease and change my treatment accordingly. I am fully dedicated to living the best life I can live with this illness. I do it for myself and I do it for others. 

I maintain a blog (www.lymeoutlyndsey.com) to have open communication with other Lyme patients and to offer them hope and guidance when I can. It's not an easy journey at all, but my efforts have been worth it.

The Scooter Years

I have done everything I can as far as changing my lifestyle to fight this disease, but I have also done everything I can to pay for it. I went through nearly 2 years trying to get a diagnosis for what was wrong with me. That involved multiple expensive procedures (multiple MRI's, CT Scans, nerve conduction studies, heart monitoring, etc). Despite having health insurance, I had to pay for my diagnostic years on my credit card. I moved to a tiny house for cheap rent. Then, when I finally got a diagnosis and a treatment plan, I sold my favorite Subaru and rode a bike or scooter year round. After that money ran out, I took out 2 personal loans. After that money ran out, I tried to take out another loan, and was of course denied. As a last resort, I took the money out of my 401K. My debt to income ratio is now too high, my credit is maxed out, and I have nothing that I actually own. I am not saying this to paint a poor- pitiful-me picture. I am saying this, because I want you to know that I have tried. Also, I want people to know what a terrible situation Lyme patients are in with denial from insurance companies. Something has to change!

The Numbers

Thankfully, I am able to work about 32 hours a week now, which I am incredibly grateful for! I work as a geologist in environmental cleanup. All of my income goes towards minimum payments on my multiple loans and credit cards from medical expenses, my student loans, rent, food, body work to help my muscles deal with infection and treatment, and regular visits to a somatic psychotherapist to help heal my damaged nervous system and learn how to live with chronic pain. Since I am still paying for previous treatment, I have no funds available to pay for current treatment.

 

My current debt is $52,500.

My treatments costs $1,900 per month. That's $22,800 per year.

My treatment consists of multiple antibiotics, high-dose prescription vitamins, herbs, minerals, enzymes, and high-dose probiotics. 

To give you an idea of where my cost comes from, just my probiotics alone cost $300 per month. 

There is no Lyme doctor in-network for my insurance. 

Insurance companies go by out-dated treatment guidelines for Lyme patients and therefore, deny new treatments.

Also, even if they did update their treatment guidelines, many of the things that are crucial to recovery from Lyme Disease, like high-dose vitamins, are never covered by any insurance company for any reason. 

We all know the system is broken. We are going to have to help each other. I am humbly asking for help.

It All Adds Up

I am asking for enough money to cover the next 3 years of my treatment, which is about $68,000. The money will go directly into an account that I have created specifically for treatment alone and will not be used for anything else. 

Every little bit that is contributed really adds up! If you can't contribute, it's just as important to share this campaign with anyone you can. Let's see how far we can spread awareness on an issue that is just recently gaining exposure!

I could reach my goal if 680 people donate $100. 

Or if 6,800 people donate $10. 

Maybe it's possible!

The Impact

If this campaign is successful, the impact it will have on my life will be monumental. Just the stress relief from knowing that I don't have to worry about what will happen if I have to stop treatment, is healing in itself. If this campaign is successful, I believe that I will fully recover (in time) from Late-Stage Lyme. I will be able to help so many others on their journey learn how to change their lifestyle for healing and move through this illness a little easier. 

If my treatment is covered, I can think about my future in a different light. Maybe I would have the chance to buy a car again or have the option of having a family someday. 

More importantly, if I recover faster and I am still in remission after 3 years, I will give the money to someone else to cover their treatment! How fun would that be?

Additionally, if I reach my goal of $68,000, I will donate $1,000 to the LymeLight Foundation. The LymeLight Foundation helps raise money to fund treatment for children. Please help me reach this goal and have the chance to change the life of a child with Lyme!

My Promise To You

I believe that we are all connected and we all need support at some time in our lives. If you are able to help me by contributing in any amount or by sharing my story with others, my promise to you is that I will live the rest of my life with gratitude and focus on community. I will help anyone I can whenever I can. I will work to raise awareness about Lyme Disease, educate others on prevention, and contribute to research working towards a cure. 

Spread the Word!

Please help spread the word about this campaign. Facebook, twitter, blogs, websites, emails. Part of my mission is to spread Lyme Disease awareness, so please share my story with everyone you can. Protect yourself and your family from Lyme Disease!

THANK YOU FOR BEING PART OF MY JOURNEY!

 

With So Much Love and Appreciation,

Lyndsey


Special thanks to:

Emilie Hester of Jogo Crossfit Bellingham (www.jogogym.com) for her inspiring words on the wall of the best little gym around. Choose to grow!

Sam Giffin for the wonderful video.

story:
Short Summary

Last week I was accepted to massage school.  On the spot I was offered a $1400 scholarship and was approved for financing. All that separates me from attending Kneaded Energy School of Massage is a deposit of $1000, ideally turned in by August 1st, but there is some wiggle room as far as that goes. 
 
But this is only the beginning of a much bigger goal of mine that, if I can get this license, will positively affect the lives of many.

What We Need & What You Get

My bare minimum needs are simply $1000.  Anything raised above that will contribute to my monthly tuition payments of $288 per month as well as any ongoing needs while in the program.  In a very optimistic situation, where my total tuition is covered, I will be using the leftover funds from this campaign to contribute to an organization that will bring "good touch" into the lives of those who had hope ripped from them.
 
I can't offer much in return immediately except offering to practice on you what I learn in classes.  I will be learning the basics of many different styles of massage for an array of personal needs.
 

The Impact

Going to massage school is just the first step towards a much bigger, much more important goal of mine.  While in school, I will be working on a plan to start an organization that works closely with mental health care professionals in order to reintroduce "healthy touch" to survivors of physical and sexual abuse.

Touch is a basic human need and it's heart breaking to think of how many people get stuck in a cycle of returning to their abusers, either because it's all they know, or they are afraid of even good touch. With the help of other caring massage therapists and mental health care professionals, I aim to help these individuals regain their strength and confidence that not all touch is harmful.


The massage therapists who get on board with this will train in counselling and to read the boundaries of these individuals, and only progress at a comfortable rate for the client.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand if you can't help financially, but you can still contribute by spreading the word.  $1000 really is such a small amount of money, I just wasn't prepared to have dish it out so suddenly.

story:
Kirby’s involvement in the Edmonton music scene stretches back to the 1970s when she was a sound tech for local blues outfit Tacoy Ryde. Kirby later formed Ramparts Entertainment and was instrumental in the careers of Bomba, Bobby Cameron, Mike Mcdonald, The Piemyn, Scotty Hills and many more. She has been involved with local institutions such as The Sidetrack Café, Black Dog Freehouse and Alberta Music as well as written hundreds of grants to help musicians reach the next step in their careers. 
And now, it’s time for us all to give back. 

Recently Kirby was diagnosed with cancer, and as someone who has spent a life working in the arts, is not in a position to pay for the alternative treatments to combat the disease. Medical bills and medicines will not be cheap ... this campaign is for those who cannot be here to help her fight in person.

For those who can ... The Newcastle Pub will be the site for a two day benefit on June 10 & 11 for "Be Here Now", benefitting the cancer treatments for local musician promoter, manager, publicist, journalist, sound tech, consultant, loveable loudmouth fan, and most importantly, friend to the scene, Kirby.

From Tacoy Ryde to the recently reunited Jr Gone Wild, from young artists like Braden Gates and reuniting veterans The Rockin’ Highliners – everyone wants to lend a helping hand.  The organizers have not only put together a stellar line-up, but also organized a silent auction of art and music items to bring more to Kirby’s fight. Tickets are only $20 at the door each night, and all proceeds and any donations go directly to Kirby. 
Much like Kirby herself, the mood of the night will be nothing but positive and something all friends and fans should be a part of. We hope everyone, and Kirby, will Be Here Now. 
Be Here Now – A Benefit For Kirby June 10 & 11, 2014 Featuring Tacoy Ryde, Jr. Gone Wild, Souljah Fyah, The Almighty Turtlenecks, The Superband, The Rockin' Highliners, Scotty Hills, Rusty Reed, The Dungarees, Bobby Cameron, Tim Koslo, Braden Gates, Dana Wylie, Rob Heath, Stew Kirkwood, Front Porch Roots Revue, Joint Chiefs & more

Newcastle Pub - Edmonton, AB 8170 – 50 Street 780-490-1999 Doors at 6:30 Music at 7:30 Tickets are $20 at the door  Silent Auction Art & Music ALL PROCEEDS GOING TO KIRBY AND HER FIGHT AGAINST CANCER
story_txt: Kirby’s involvement in the Edmonton music scene stretches back to the 1970s when she was a sound tech for local blues outfit Tacoy Ryde. Kirby later formed Ramparts Entertainment and was instrumental in the careers of Bomba, Bobby Cameron, Mike Mcdonald, The Piemyn, Scotty Hills and many more. She has been involved with local institutions such as The Sidetrack Café, Black Dog Freehouse and Alberta Music as well as written hundreds of grants to help musicians reach the next step in their careers.  And now, it’s time for us all to give back.  Recently Kirby was diagnosed with cancer, and as someone who has spent a life working in the arts, is not in a position to pay for the alternative treatments to combat the disease. Medical bills and medicines will not be cheap ... this campaign is for those who cannot be here to help her fight in person.For those who can ... The Newcastle Pub will be the site for a two day benefit on June 10 & 11 for "Be Here Now", benefitting the cancer treatments for local musician promoter, manager, publicist, journalist, sound tech, consultant, loveable loudmouth fan, and most importantly, friend to the scene, Kirby.From Tacoy Ryde to the recently reunited Jr Gone Wild, from young artists like Braden Gates and reuniting veterans The Rockin’ Highliners – everyone wants to lend a helping hand.  The organizers have not only put together a stellar line-up, but also organized a silent auction of art and music items to bring more to Kirby’s fight. Tickets are only $20 at the door each night, and all proceeds and any donations go directly to Kirby.  Much like Kirby herself, the mood of the night will be nothing but positive and something all friends and fans should be a part of. We hope everyone, and Kirby, will Be Here Now.  Be Here Now – A Benefit For Kirby June 10 & 11, 2014 Featuring Tacoy Ryde, Jr. Gone Wild, Souljah Fyah, The Almighty Turtlenecks, The Superband, The Rockin' Highliners, Scotty Hills, Rusty Reed, The Dungarees, Bobby Cameron, Tim Koslo, Braden Gates, Dana Wylie, Rob Heath, Stew Kirkwood, Front Porch Roots Revue, Joint Chiefs & more Newcastle Pub - Edmonton, AB 8170 – 50 Street 780-490-1999 Doors at 6:30 Music at 7:30 Tickets are $20 at the door  Silent Auction Art & Music ALL PROCEEDS GOING TO KIRBY AND HER FIGHT AGAINST CANCER

story:
About Us & KENEFA

CODERS4AFRICA (C4A) was created in 2010 through the efforts of friends (C4A Leadership) who collectively have over 35 years of experience in the software and computer engineering field. C4A's mission focuses on providing practical software engineering training, IT services to the African Market as well as setting the company up with capacity and capability that can handle IT contracting and outsourcing from all over the world. After years of interaction with technologists in Africa, the C4A leadership decided to focus on software development as a way of giving back to the communities where they grew up.

KENEFA was developed during CODERS4AFRICA 2012 PPBT (Practical Project Based Training) in Senegal. Access to adequate healthcare remains a public health challenge within the sub-Saharan Africa region. 

Community members and governing organizations alike need accurate, continuous data surrounding health care facility capacity and utilization in order to make informed decisions for individual care and resource allocation, respectively.

The system proposed here, Kenefa, is a centralized data repository of healthcare provider and facility data. Kenefa will be accessible via mobile (SMS, USSD) and web for community members seeking near-real-time occupancy information and capacity data, which will be collected daily by regional call centers. Different views will be tailored for individual roles and audiences, including community members, government, and health staff. This proposal describes a pilot implementation of this platform in the Dakar region of Senegal.

Objective and Budget

Raising $5,000 will give us enough momentum to raise the rest of $45,000 from other sources including grants. Google RISE will give $1,000 towards our campaign if we reach our goal. We will need $50,000 to deploy Kenefa in one test country Senegal. 

  1. The interactive database of hospitals, health centers, and health huts within the pilot program area will be put in place, making information about capabilities, supplies, and staffing available to the community via web and mobile
  2. Testing and putting into routine practice a pilot, near-real-time database allowing members of the community to query nearby facilities via SMS to determine whether they are equipped with needed supplies, personnel, or capabilities
  3. Sharing the output of this system with decision-making authorities within the relevant district/region and to identify methods by which to integrate this data into relevant health and surveillance systems.

The money will go towards:

  • Initial manual data collection need to hire 6 people for that 
  • 2 personnel staff for a call center responsible of collecting real-time data from facilities and push it through Kenefa repository
  • Equipment: Computers for call center Hosting of Kenefa on cloud and buying SMS/USSD  shortcode  from telecom provider
  • Direct supply: Cost of rent for call & data collection center, Internet and 3G Access

Monitoring and Evaluation

The utility of this program will be assessed using the following criteria:

  1. System Use: If the system provides practical benefit to stakeholders, use will increase throughout the duration of the implementation period.
  2. Stakeholder Participation: If the system provides practical benefit to stakeholders, they will be more likely to contribute their own program/facility data. This will be monitored throughout the program to identify barriers, trends, and interest.
  3.  Stakeholder Review: Key stakeholders will be surveyed for opinions on the system. 

The Impact

During a recent WHO survey of Health Systems in Africa, over 66% of survey participants rated services as "inadequate," with 13.1% of respondents referencing delays in the provision of care and long waiting times. The WHO report notes that, "to access basic health care services, community members – women, men, and children – walk for 20 kilometers or more to the nearest health facility, sometimes to find no health worker and no drugs." [1]

The availability of hospital beds, or lack thereof, is problematic from both the perspective of access to care and resource use. Low occupancy rates in Mali and Uganda have been attributed to inappropriate allocation of healthcare funds, a lack of trained personnel, and sporadic supply of drugs or medical supplies. [2,3] Similar issues are raised in Senegal, where one interviewee cited in the above-referenced WHO study noted that, "If you're just here at 11p.m. when you are sick, whatever the gravity of your illness, you will wait until the next day." [1] Conversely, acute disease outbreaks within sub-Saharan Africa often result in overcrowding at local health centers and hospitals. 

During this deployment perdio, we will generate a starting database of health facilities and associated capacity within the pilot region (InfoSanté), as well as a daily log of occupancy rates, collected by a local call center, at five (5) of these facilities throughout a six-month period (Allo Santé). Specific data categories for InfoSanté will include: facility name; specialization; location; personnel; hours of operation; laboratory and diagnostic capabilities; ER capacity and hours; medical equipment; hygiene and infrastructure-related equipment; diagnostic equipment; pharmacy availability; number of rooms and beds; and costs of admission and treatment.

Ultimately, the data available through Allo Santé will empower community members to make informed decisions about where to seek care by sending a simple SMS, as well as providing an invaluable baseline for patterns of availability. This will inform analyses regarding patterns of disease, contribute to early detection of seasonal or epidemic increases in morbidity, and facilitate identification of “health facility deserts,” where supply is insufficient for local demand.

By incorporating both high- and low-tech data retrieval methods (web crawlers and a call center), we build on the recent “data explosion” without losing sight of community members’ need for accurate, timely, and hyperlocal information. 

[1] WHO. "Health Systems in Africa, Community Perceptions and Perspectives. The Report of a Multi-Country Study," June 2012. Available at http://www.afro.who.int/index.php?option=com_do... (retrieved: 26 July 2013).

[2] Coulibaly SO & Keita M. "Economics of health care in Mali." Sante 1996 Nov-Dec; 6(6):353-9.

[3] Okello D et al. "Low bed occupancy rates in Uganda's peripheral health units: is it a policy problem?" East Afr Med J 1994 Sep; 71(9):601-3.

[4] "The United States Global Health Strategy | Senegal Global Health Initiative Strategy." Available at http://www.ghi.gov/documents/organization/17889... (retrieved: 5 September 2013).

story: My daughter, Katelyn, who just turned 20, has been dealing with some major medical issues since 2009 including a severe form of POTS. A few months ago her teeth started breaking off, small pieces at a time. We knew she had a problem with dry mouth from medications and possibly from medical conditions but it turned out that her saliva is almost absent from her mouth. As a result, her teeth are ruined at no fault of her own. There was nothing she could do as reinforced by her dentist. We were told by her dentist that they can't be saved. Any repair work we have done on them will just need to be redone every 1-2 years and eventually they will become unrepairable. This was the second opinion, Individual dental implants will not work as the lack of saliva will undermine them and bone will erode. Her only option is implanted dentures. Dentures that are screwed into the bone. With regular denture use the bone in the jaw breaks down over time. Since she is only 20, that would disfigure her at a very young age. Implants into the jaw to fasten the dentures in her mouth act as tooth roots and prevent bone loss therefor preventing the disfiguring effects. We need your help badly. The cost of extracting the remaining teeth, the specialized dentures and the cost of implants is around $52,000. Insurance won't cover this type of surgical procedure. Katelyn helps everyone, human or animal. She is kind and thoughtful and never asks for anything in return. Those of you who know her know this well. But this time, she needs YOUR help. Katelyn is devastated by this new problem. She knows I can't afford what she needs and was hoping for help within the family because this problem is very embarrassing to her, but I just don't have the resources and she MUST have this type of procedure due to her tender young age. Katelyn, (an honor student, an American Scholar)  plans on becoming a veterinarian,  and she will be a great one. Her compassion and kind heart will make her one of the best. She always helps anyone who needs help whenever she can and has saved 8 litters of kittens, a few dogs and even wildlife. She needs these specific type of dentures and soon. Her teeth are disintegrating on a daily basis and won't last long. I have to have the money secured before the dentist and oral surgeon will start the work which will take several months to complete.  I even tried The Ellen show, sending 4 requests a day for over a month with no luck. I thought if we got on the show not only would Katelyn get help but also bring awareness of the severe damage dry mouth can cause. Any help you can give (donations, support, suggestions or even passing our story along) will be deeply appreciated. Your help will literally improve the life of someone kind-hearted and giving who gives every chance she gets.  P.S. There are images of her teeth but they don't show the damage as well, but it does give you the basics. Sorry but I am not good with the camera and lighting. Estimate from dentist is in the gallery.  Please pass this along and help me find caring people to help her. Thank you. All money raised, if not enough, will go into a savings account which other fundraising events will be added to until we get the amount she needs. Thanks.

story:
Dear Visitor of our TROPHIN Campaign and Indiegogo Supporter!


If you or someone you love struggles with KIDNEY DISEASE, this campaign was carefully, lovingly and specifically made for YOU.

                                              

We have created a breakthrough gourmet-grade food for KIDNEY DISEASE patients on DIALYSIS (although ANYONE can ENJOY them and everyone does!).
                                              

                                            

Created by a master chef and expert dieticians, our delectable high protein TROPHIN biscuits contain delicious quality nutrients and— most important — none of the ingredients that can be dangerous to kidney patients on dialysis.

                                           


TROPHIN biscuits offer a solid food option, which means that fluid restricted patients can enjoy a beverage, in place of an artificial clinical tasting concoction many are currently required to consume while on dialysis.

In addition, TROPHIN biscuits are carefully crafted also to be kind for Diabetics, suitable for vegetarians, and we are working on a Halal and Kosher certificate.

                                                  

We have teamed up with one of London’s finest and most charitable bakeries to hand-make TROPHIN biscuits, with part of all proceeds supporting women with vulnerable backgrounds.

All of this is welcomed news for the millions of people around the world who have kidney disease. While we would love to have the cure for the disease, what we can do is enhance KIDNEY PATIENTS’ lives one biscuit at a time... that is, with a little help from our Indiegogo friends.


Our Story

But more important than our background in science and business, Spiros has watched two dear friends struggle with kidney disease for the past 20 years. As a result, we felt called to create this special product. The thought of our friends not being able to enjoy some of the foods we love so much was troubling. That’s why we have taken great care in making sure TROPHIN biscuits are not only nutritious and life-affirming— but that they are yummy as well.

                                


Our choice of flavors addresses the all important taste fatigue patients experience, aids compliance and helps maintain a better nutritional status.

  1. Paprika & Chili - spiced up without salt!
  2. Oregano - spiced up without salt!
  3. Cinnamon - a sweet version, carefully crafted also to be kind for diabetics!
Up until now we have self-funded all of the research, development and the promotion of TROPHIN biscuits. At this point we need some high-octane rocket fuel to launch TROPHIN biscuits worldwide so that dialysis patients everywhere can enjoy these delectable treats without one iota of worrying about side effects.

                                      

                         That rocket fuel of course is your support!

With enough support and momentum from our caring community, we will create more gourmet food products for kidney patients and, eventually, hospital patients who are served foods lacking in nutrition, taste and quality. But first, we are firmly focused on giving TROPHIN biscuits its best chance of success.


What we need

Now that we have perfected TROPHIN biscuits through stringent research and development (as well as focus groups and taste tests), we need seed money for big scale manufacturing, distribution and packaging. We also need to expand our sales and marketing activities (global online presence, direct sales). And finally, we need to move forward on product development for additional food items suited for kidney patients. We estimate that costs will total about £50,000 ($70,000) for a proper launch.

                                               


What’s in it for you?

1. Good karma
Support us with a no-strings donation and watch in rapt amazement as the universe returns your kindness in unexpected and creative ways that will delight you. 
£5, £10, £25, £100 … any amount is gratefully appreciated!

To just contribute please go the 'Contribute Now' button
at the top of this page!

Or check out our great perks:

2. Yummy TROPHIN biscuits
Get the complete tasting experience': handmade with a lot of TLC with one of the highest quality whey protein available, low in sugar and salt!
Available in 3, 9, 15 and 21 packs (each pack contains 3 biscuits).

3. Dietetic Consultation with Expert Dietitian
Sign up for a dietetic consultation for a range of medical problems like renal disease, weight management, cholesterol reduction, high blood pressure, irritable bowel syndrome and many more.
Consultation in person (London based) or online via Computer (10 x available).

4. Soothing Meditation
Your kidneys have an important role within the balance of the body! They regulate the water in our bodies, remove waste products, help to balance the body's minerals and produce hormones. This gentle meditation honors this important role and supports a natural flow and balance of the renal system and offers you an opportunity to tune into the healing nature of your body (mp3 download).

5. Artwork by Artist Melissa Wadsworth
Melissa's work is a fitting reflection of the love, goodness and high vibration we put into every aspect of TROPHIN biscuits. Beyond that, there is a wellness connection (explored below) that is particularly relevant to renal disease. 

1. Wholeness
The human body is designed for wholeness and harmony. Like the seed center of this spiraling energy, we can set the intention to be healthy and to tune into wellness.

2. Cellular Rebirth
Cells hold intelligence. Each cell contains the blueprint for the whole being. When we shine a light on the body’s ability to heal, we actively take part in this renewal process.


3. Circulation
Circulation is primary to good health -- circulation of oxygen, circulation of blood, circulation of nutrients. When active circulation is present, the entire human health field is uplifted. 

4. Elemental Change
Air, Fire, Water, and Earth represent the powerful elements from which universal balance arises. When these divine energetic forces are in flow, we move through life and health challenges knowing that positive changes are possible each new day.

All 4 paintings are available as digital download, premium canvas print or original.


The Impact

This is the first-of-its-kind gourmet-grade food specifically created for kidney disease patients on dialysis. Just imagine the happiness you will add to the world when you help to make life better for people who are dealing with a difficult disease.  More people smiling, more people remembering a little act of kindness every day…

                                             


Risks & Challenges

For two years we have worked tirelessly on pulling together the team and resources to create TROPHIN biscuits and to establish the TROPHIN brand. In every way we have invested heavily in our dream to make this product available to dialysis patients worldwide.

We are totally committed to continue implementing our plan until TROPHIN is a household name among kidney patients and their loved ones. As with any new business, there are risks.

We have had so many great, positive and encouraging comments from patients and dieticians alike. This has established that our products are something that will make a significant difference to a lot of people, which will keep us going should obstacles arise.

We have also received solid guidance and support from respected colleagues in finance and healthcare, giving us a good sense that our plan is strong, strategically astute and on target to meet the benchmarks we have set forth.

Sharing is caring

Whether or not you’re able to make a financial contribution, please spread the love by spreading the word to kidney disease patients in your life, as well as their loved ones and your friends!

Social media has tremendous power, so share this Indiegogo page now with a click of a button. It’s amazing how fast good energy travels - and how far it can reach!

With our deepest thanks and profound gratitude

Gabriele & Spiros

cholesterol reduction, high blood pressure, irritable bowel syndrome and many
more. Consultation in person (London based) or online via Computer (10 x available).4. Soothing MeditationYour kidneys have an important role within the balance of the body! They
regulate the water in our bodies, remove waste products, help to balance the
body's minerals and produce hormones. This gentle meditation honors this
important role and supports a natural flow and balance of the renal system and
offers you an opportunity to tune into the healing nature of your body (mp3 download).5. Artwork by Artist Melissa WadsworthMelissa's work is a fitting reflection of the love, goodness and high vibration we put into every aspect of TROPHIN biscuits. Beyond that, there is a wellness connection (explored below) that is particularly relevant to renal disease.  1. WholenessThe
human body is designed for wholeness and harmony. Like the seed center of this spiraling energy, we can set the intention to be healthy and to tune into
wellness.2. Cellular RebirthCells
hold intelligence. Each cell contains the blueprint for the whole being. When
we shine a light on the body’s ability to heal, we actively take part in this
renewal process. 3. CirculationCirculation
is primary to good health -- circulation of oxygen, circulation of blood,
circulation of nutrients. When active circulation is present, the entire human
health field is uplifted.  4. Elemental ChangeAir,
Fire, Water, and Earth represent the powerful elements from which universal balance
arises. When these divine energetic forces are in flow, we move through life
and health challenges knowing that positive changes are possible each new day. All 4 paintings are available as digital download, premium canvas print or original.
The
Impact
This
is the first-of-its-kind gourmet-grade food specifically created for kidney
disease patients on dialysis. Just imagine the happiness you will add to the world when you help to make life better for people who are dealing with a difficult disease.  More
people smiling, more people remembering a
little act of kindness every day…                                              

Risks
& Challenges
For
two years we have worked tirelessly on pulling together the team and resources
to create TROPHIN biscuits and to establish the TROPHIN brand. In every way we
have invested heavily in our dream to make this product available to dialysis patients
worldwide. We are totally committed to continue implementing our plan until TROPHIN is
a household name among kidney patients and their loved ones. As with any new
business, there are risks. 
We have had so many great, positive and encouraging comments
from patients and dieticians alike. This has established that our products are something that will make a significant difference to a lot of people, which will keep us going should obstacles arise.
We have also received solid guidance and support from
respected colleagues in finance and healthcare, giving us a good sense that our
plan is strong, strategically astute and on target to meet the benchmarks we
have set forth.
Sharing
is caring
Whether or not you’re able to make a financial
contribution, please spread the love by spreading the word to kidney
disease patients in your life, as well as their loved ones and your friends! Social media has
tremendous power, so share this Indiegogo page now with a click of a button.
It’s amazing how fast good energy travels - and how far it can reach! With our deepest thanks and profound gratitude
Gabriele & Spiros

story:
As I live and breathe.

I am very ill.  I have a degenerative lung disease called Pulmonary Fibrosis, the result of repeated bouts of pneumonia complicated by rheumatoid arthritis.  Simply put, fibres are growing in my lungs and reducing my ability to breathe.

My last Pulmonary Function Test (six months ago) measured my lung capacity at 50%.  I feel like it has deteriorated since then, but tests in September will show for sure where I am at.

My doctors and specialists estimate that, without treatment, I have three to five years before my lungs cease their function altogether.  

That is the first option presented to me by Dr. Ian Waters, my respirologist: Do Nothing.   He is a very nice man and a fine doctor with the difficult task of dispensing bad news.  He told me that I could carry on for a few years with just minor deterioration until a sudden decline takes away my remaining lung capacity in very short order.

According to Dr. Waters, my second option is treatment with pharmaceuticals.  The treatment is about 50% effective, that is: the pharmaceuticals work in about half the cases.  "Work" in this context means that treatment 'may' slow down the fibre growth. There is no cure, according to my doctors, but this option may extend my life a little.  There may be side effects with these pharmaceuticals, but Dr. Waters said that these can be dealt with by more pharmaceuticals.

The third option is lung transplant.   If  I survive a lung transplant surgery, I will have a less than 50% chance of living 5 years.  I will live on anti-rejection drugs which have potential side effects affecting liver, kidney, heart and brain.  There are other pharmaceuticals that will address the side effects of the first.  I will be very sick for a while, immune system kaput and energy weak.  Quality of life can be okay after a lung transplant.  Dr. Waters likes to talk about one young fella who had a transplant and now rides the Rocky Mountains on a bicycle on his new lung.  I am not so optimistic about the odds.   I have a few good years (decades, even!) left in me, but I am not a young fella.  If my body rejects the transplanted lung, it is unlikely I will be eligible for another due to my age.  They generally balk at lung transplants when the recipient is over 65, as I will be in two years.

Lung transplants cost (according to the surgeon and the surgical nurse who interviewed me at the transplant clinic) between one and two million dollars.  Our socialized medical program will pay for this.  Remember this.  Our BC Medical will pay a minimum of one million dollars to give me another person's lung that may (or may not) help me to live another five years.

There is something else.

During the two years, while I was undergoing diagnosis, it became very obvious to me that I was deathly ill and, as my condition worsened, not one health practitioner, from the specialists and surgeons to the nurses and technicians offered me any hope of surviving this horrible disease beyond a few years.

I am not despairing, however, and I will tell you why.

What now?

I decided to seek another route.

I called upon a doctor of Traditional Chinese Medicine, Dr. Fei Yang.  ( http://www.drfeiyang.ca/ )

When I told her, over the telephone, what my condition was Dr. Fei responded with "We will fix those lungs of yours."  What?  Fix my lungs?  Did she just promise to cure my incurable lung disease?

I went to visit her.  During that first consultation she confirmed that she would cure my Pulmonary Fibrosis.

Before we begin to work on my lungs, however, Dr. Fei said, we must address the cause of my illness, the rheumatoid arthritis, and cure it.

Over the last year and a half, we have done that.  I no longer have pain in my wrists, shoulders, hands and feet.  The swelling in those areas has gone.  

Although Western Medicine says that there is no cure for it, I no longer suffer from rheumatoid arthritis. 

It has not been easy.  I got very sick at times and in addition, it was very expensive. Traditional Chinese Medicine is not covered by our wonderful health plan.

But I have made it this far.  For the first time in almost a decade, I can make a fist.  I can open jars and doors without pain.  I can sleep on my side without pain in my shoulders.  

Dr. Fei cured me.  I believe in her.  What is more important is that she has given me hope.  

Hope that we can cure my lung disease.

The Cure.

Dr. Fei says it will take two to five years to cure my Pulmonary Fibrosis.   She says I will become very ill, much more than present, because I must journey through this illness in order to confront it and expel it from my body.  We will do that, she says, through use of herbs and acupuncture, counselling  and nutrition and life style change.  

And I believe her.  

I will be cured.

My Situation

I am currently able to work only in flexible circumstances and with light physical requirements.  I tire easily and lack stamina.  Any exertion sends me running for my oxygen tank in order to catch my breath.  I cannot hold down or sustain a full-time job.  My income has been severely impacted by this disease. 

I have approached Human Resources for assistance.  I am ineligible for a disability pension because I have been collecting my CPP ($130 per month!) for more than fifteen months.

So I need assistance, both with the fees associated with my treatment and with income in order to live when I become entirely unable to work.

This is my campaign:

To raise funds to pay for my treatment and to sustain and support me while I heal.

Like any system of medicine, Traditional Chinese Medicine is expensive.  Unlike our Western Medicine, this treatment is not covered by our Canadian Health Care program.

I will be visiting Dr. Fei twice a week for treatment.  A single half-hour consultation costs $80.  This compares favourably to Western Medicine.  

The herbs and medicines used in my treatment also compare very well in price to Western treatments like chemotherapy or dialysis. 

The combined cost of consultations,  and treatments such as acupuncture and herbal medicines will be 1,200 dollars per month.  Over five years, this amounts to 72,000 dollars.  I have chosen to be optimistic and have set a goal for three years of treatment, totaling 43,200 dollars.  

For the duration of this campaign, I have budgeted 1,000 dollars per month living expenses.  I currently have a small monthly pension and hope to work part-time during at least some of the time but I will likely have to give up much of my working income during the period of my treatment.  As Dr. Fei says, getting well is my full-time job now.  I gather that I will be too ill most of the time to do much else.

The Goal

The total goal of this funding campaign is 79,200 dollars.  This will see me through three years of treatment with support for living.

This is a huge amount, an ambitious goal and is somewhat daunting (though not as intimidating as this disease!).  I thought of breaking it down to yearly increments of 26,400 dollars and an annual breakdown will be my personal measure of progress for this fund raising campaign, by years rather than dollars.

26,400 dollars will see me through one year.

52,800 dollars funds two years of treatment.

79,200 dollars will cover the three years I anticipate being in treatment.

If my treatment takes longer, then I will have to seek further funding to cover it.

I have considered what to do with the funding, should we not reach the ultimate goal.  

Whatever amount is raised will be applied to my treatment first and my living expenses second.  My goal is to get well.  That is what this campaign is all about: curing me of this disease so I can once again be healthy and productive.

Treatment alone for one year costs 14,400 dollars.  For two years 28,800 and for three years, 43,200 dollars.  

(Remember that a lung transplant would cost a minimum of one million dollars and BC Med would cover that cost.  It will not cover the cost of this treatment.)

We plan on embarking upon treatment to save and restore my lungs in September.  By late September, I should have a good idea of how we stand in terms of fund-raising.  I hope to be close to our goal but understand that we may not fully succeed.  I will proceed with however much treatment I can then afford.  Perhaps I will launch another campaign in the future to help pay for any shortfall from this one.  

In the interim, I will focus on this campaign and hope that help will come from my friends and community and beyond.

How You Can Help

Donate.  I know some will be unable to do much here, but any amount will help.

Share this campaign.  This is where this kind of campaign succeeds or fails.  Sharing and linking the campaign, letting your friends and networks know about this campaign is pivotal.   Idiegogo provides easy 'share' tools.  Please.  Circulate this widely.  Help is welcome from all sources.  In order to reach our goal we need a broad coverage.

Offer up incentives.  If you are able to offer up a service, product or object as an incentive for others to donate, please do so.  I don't personally have much to offer in this department.  Just the promise of my personal gratitude with every breath I take with my own renewed lungs into my dotage.


With your help, we can beat this disease and save my lungs.  I will keep the lungs I was born with and live to a ripe old age.  

With your help, I will breathe easy once again, I will not cough myself awake every couple of hours every night.  I will be able to focus on writing and pottery and family: my children, grandchild and Rebekah, my life-partner of nearly thirty-five years.    

With your generous help, I will once again walk distances, ride a bike and work maintaining our property and house, none of which are within my means at present.

I will be able to work for a living again.  

I will have a life again.

You will literally save my life by giving me back my breath.

As I live and breathe...
