story:
First, let me personally thank you for taking time to look at our product page.  Our team is extremely passionate about Nite Track.  We have no doubt that given the opportunity to succeed, it will change the way you look at night time activities.2

Nite Track was created by a group of four guys who came together through professional affiliations and friendship. Our technical, market and product expertise is based on years of technology application and operational experience in various industries.  Our overall goal with Nite Track is to provide outdoor enthusiasts  a great performing, hands free, night vision platform at an affordable price. 

If you’ve ever walked through woods at night with a night vision monocular or tried to navigate a small boat at night while holding a scope to your eye, you will appreciate Nite Track’s enhanced situational awareness, depth perception and ease of use.  Operationally, it will bring a high performance night vision system on par with major marine systems costing over $10,000 at a small fraction of the price.  Yet, Nite Track is much more adaptive and versatile.

We’ve been collaborating on Nite Track for over a year and field testing for over six months. As we’ve built prototypes, gathered data and accumulated results, we’ve defined a product that meets our specifications for performance, ruggedness, versatility and reliability.  We humbly yet confidently hope our project will receive your support and enthusiasm! We know Nite Track is a viable and innovative product with great potential and with your backing we can begin the process of bringing it to production.  Please contact us if you have any questions or would like more information by using this email address: nitetrackinfo@gmail.com


So, what is Nite Track?

Nite Track is a new hands free night vision product used by outdoor adventurers to safely increase their activities into the night. Boating, off-road applications, hunting, farming, ranching and anything else outdoors where being able to comfortably see at night is important.



Unlike traditional night vision systems such as hand held image intensifiers (green display) or Microbolometers (Thermal imaging), Nite Track offers a combination of wide dynamic range video processing and switchable near infrared illumination. The result is a hands free crisp black and white video image displayed on an HD monitor.



These features are particularly important for night time boating and off road use.  Night time navigation can be extremely challenging even for the most experienced operators. Getting lost, running aground or colliding with other objects  is a very real hazard and keeps many people off the water at night and from many other night time activities.  Nite Track has three main goals;

1.  To be able to safely, comfortably and confidently boat at night

2.  To be widely affordable and simple to install and use on any boat, vehicle or even structure

3.  To positively enhance night time recreational activities for the broadest range of people possible.

Nite Track has several features that differentiate it from anything else available.

·  As a hands free system, Nite Track can be remotely placed and remotely viewed on a flat screen display. Being able to refer to the displayed image as needed, the user doesn’t have to hassle with mounting head-worn devices or holding a monocular up to their eye. This greatly improves overall situational awareness and also allows others nearby to share the image.


·  The black/white image allows for great detail, even ability to read text. Thermal imagers cannot do this nor can they “see” the stars, moon, clouds, buoy numbers or signs.

·  Unlike image intensifiers or thermal imagers, Nite Track can use any standard video lens desired. The standard lens supplied is an HD 35mm lens which produces an image approximate to the human eye, meaning that images are about as far away as they appear. If however, a user wants to use a zoom or wide angle lens, it is easily done.

·  Nite Track is not vulnerable to image bloom and white out as many image intensification systems are, when subjected to headlights, street lights etc..

·  In extreme low light or zero light situations, Nite Track features on-board near infrared illumination that can be switched on as desired.  This illumination is essentially invisible to humans and won’t affect ones natural night vision or interfere with others ability to see.


·  Nite Track can be powered from any 12 volt source and doesn’t require special batteries or chargers. The Nite Track sensor will operate on a minimum of 200 milliamps and thus can be mounted on any kind of vehicle with an electrical system. It can also be powered from standard AA, C or D sized batteries.

·  Nite Track does not require permanent mounting to be used. It can easily be removed or swapped into another vehicle.

Why we’re doing it:

There have been many technologies deployed for years for military and law enforcement organizations that improve an operator’s night time effectiveness, safety and survivability.  Usually, over a period of years, these technologies filter down to commercial markets in the form of surplus, or re-packaged commodities that do not meet the original quality assurances.

We believe that if you want an excellent night vision system for a boat it’s often better to design the system leveraging newer and evolving technologies from multiple industries and disciplines into a tailored design. This approach can generate truly new solutions rather than simply recycling or re-purposing expensive hardware. We don’t want people to have to strap devices on their heads to see where they’re going or to spend exorbitantly for a remotely displayed thermal  imaging system.

Near Infrared (IR) Illumination:

Nite Track uses on-board near IR illumination. When switched on, these small illuminators emit a 10 degree beam of IR light that's near the peak spectral response of the CCD chip set. While essentially invisible to humans, the CCD sensor "see's" this light much as a human eye will see a spotlight.  This allows a user to illuminate a close in terrain or shoreline feature even in zero light conditions.  Nite Track utilizes two illuminators, one on each side of the CCD sensor. This allows uniform illumination overlaying the lens field of view. 

Low Light Sensitivity:

CCD (Charge Coupled Device) sensors are used in Nite Track. These are inherently low lite sensitive chip sets and widely used in surveillance applications. For Nite Track, the CCD's used are far more sensitive than those used in a typical surveillance camera.  This is due to enhanced signal processing capabilities. These capabilities allow a wide dynamic range of exposure control based on ambient light levels and shuttering. This allows for better processing of low contrast environments, such as open water and/or gray horizons.  Terrain features such as grass, dirt, trees, leaves, rocks etc... are also highly reflective of IR  and allow for  highly detailed images. 

Lensing:

Nite Track utilizes a 35mm lens.  The lens is an f1.4 HD C-mount lens that allows an operator to view night time images at approximately the same distance as the human eye.  In practical terms, it allows you to see an object well before you run into it.  Objects appear to be approximately as far away as they actually are.  This is very important when navigating at night and you will quickly see why Nite Track instills the confidence it does.

Mounts:

Nite Track units may be mounted with any 1/4-20 mount. A machined mounting plate on the bottom of both Explorer and Ranger is compatible with popular electronics mounts such as RAM etc...

 

How we will use our funding:

Funding will be used for fixtures, fabrication, component and finishing costs to do an initial low volume production run.  We will also fabricate a mold and other production related tooling that will allow us an economy of scale for long term production. We have a solid supply chain in place with all critical components fully sourced. All CAD files, drawings, schematics are completed.


Stretch Goals

$100,000

Remote Controlled Pan/Tilt

A remote controlled Pan/Tilt OEM module has been sourced that we will integrate  as an added option to Nite Track units.  This will be a single cable integration providing the operator the ability to remotely move the sensor left and right 350 degrees and a tilt angle of 60 degrees.  


$150,000

Wifi Application

This will allow creation of an iPhone/Android application that will provide a real-time wireless connection to your smart phone allowing remote viewing and control of Nite Track.


  Nite Track Specifications
       
Sensor        
CCD  1/2" format interline transfer
Video output Composite  
Lens Type CS/C    
Power  12 VDC at 110ma
 
 

 
Illumination      
Near Infrared 860nm    
Power  12 VDC at 500 ma
 
Beam Angle 10 Degrees  



 


     
Housing Material  Aluminum
   
Finish  Powdercoat
 
Dimensions 5.875" W  x  2.375" T  x 4.0" L
Ingress protection IP67    
Mount 1/4-20 Tapped Holes  (3)

the price.  Yet, Nite Track is much more adaptive and versatile.
We’ve been
collaborating on Nite Track for over a year and field testing for over six
months. As we’ve built prototypes, gathered data and accumulated results, we’ve
defined a product that meets our specifications for performance, ruggedness,
versatility and reliability.  We humbly yet confidently hope our project
will receive your support and enthusiasm! We know Nite Track is a viable and
innovative product with great potential and with your backing we can begin the
process of bringing it to production.  Please contact us if you have any questions or would like more information by using this email address: nitetrackinfo@gmail.com
So, what is Nite
Track?
Nite Track is a new hands
free night vision product used by outdoor adventurers to safely increase their
activities into the night. Boating, off-road applications, hunting, farming,
ranching and anything else outdoors where being able to comfortably see at
night is important.
Unlike traditional
night vision systems such as hand held image intensifiers (green display) or
Microbolometers (Thermal imaging), Nite Track offers a combination of wide
dynamic range video processing and switchable near infrared illumination. The
result is a hands free crisp black and white video image displayed on an HD
monitor.


These features are particularly important for night time
boating and off road use.  Night
time navigation can be extremely challenging even for the most experienced
operators. Getting lost, running aground or colliding with other objects  is a very real hazard and keeps many people off the water at night and from many other night time activities.  Nite Track
has three main goals;

1. 
To be able to safely, comfortably and
confidently boat at night
2. 
To be widely affordable and simple to install
and use on any boat, vehicle or even structure
3. 
To positively enhance night time recreational
activities for the broadest range of people possible.
Nite Track has several features that differentiate it from
anything else available.
· 
As a hands free system, Nite Track can be remotely placed and remotely viewed on a flat screen display.
Being able to refer to the displayed image as needed, the user doesn’t have
to hassle with mounting head-worn devices or holding a monocular up to their
eye. This greatly improves overall situational awareness and also allows
others nearby to share the image. 



· 
The black/white image allows for great detail,
even ability to read text. Thermal imagers cannot do this nor can they “see”
the stars, moon, clouds, buoy numbers or signs. 
· 
Unlike image intensifiers or thermal imagers,
Nite Track can use any standard video lens desired. The standard lens supplied
is an HD 35mm lens which produces an image approximate to the human eye,
meaning that images are about as far away as they appear. If however, a user
wants to use a zoom or wide angle lens, it is easily done. 
· 
Nite Track is not vulnerable to image bloom and
white out as many image intensification systems are, when subjected to
headlights, street lights etc..
· 
In extreme low light or zero light situations,
Nite Track features on-board near infrared illumination that can be switched on
as desired.  This illumination is
essentially invisible to humans and won’t affect ones natural night vision or
interfere with others ability to see.
· 
Nite Track can be powered from any 12 volt
source and doesn’t require special batteries or chargers. The Nite Track sensor
will operate on a minimum of 200 milliamps and thus can be mounted on any kind of vehicle with an electrical system. It can also be powered
from standard AA, C or D sized batteries.
· 
Nite Track does not require permanent
mounting to be used. It can easily be removed or swapped into another vehicle.
Why we’re doing
it:
There have been many technologies deployed for
years for military and law enforcement organizations that
improve an operator’s night time effectiveness, safety and survivability.  Usually, over a
period of years, these technologies filter down to commercial markets in the form
of surplus, or re-packaged commodities that do not meet the original quality assurances.
We
believe that if you want an excellent night vision system for a boat
it’s often better to design the system leveraging newer and evolving technologies from
multiple industries and disciplines into a tailored
design. This approach can generate truly
new solutions rather than simply recycling or re-purposing expensive hardware. We
don’t want people to have to strap devices on their heads to see where they’re
going or to spend exorbitantly for a remotely displayed thermal  imaging system.

Near Infrared (IR) Illumination:Nite Track uses on-board near IR illumination. When switched on, these small illuminators emit a 10 degree beam of IR light that's near the peak spectral response of the CCD chip set. While essentially invisible to humans, the CCD sensor "see's" this light much as a human eye will see a spotlight.  This allows a user to illuminate a close in terrain or shoreline feature even in zero light conditions.  Nite Track utilizes two illuminators, one on each side of the CCD sensor. This allows uniform illumination overlaying the lens field of view. 
Low Light Sensitivity:
CCD (Charge Coupled Device) sensors are used in Nite Track. These are inherently low lite sensitive chip sets and widely used in surveillance applications. For Nite Track, the CCD's used are far more sensitive than those used in a typical surveillance camera.  This is due to enhanced signal processing capabilities. These capabilities allow a wide dynamic range of exposure control based on ambient light levels and shuttering. This allows for better processing of low contrast environments, such as open water and/or gray horizons.  Terrain features such as grass, dirt, trees, leaves, rocks etc... are also highly reflective of IR  and allow for  highly detailed images. 
Lensing: 
Nite Track utilizes a 35mm lens.  The lens is an f1.4 HD C-mount lens that allows an operator to view night time images at approximately the same distance as the human eye.  In practical terms, it allows you to see an object well before you run into it.  Objects appear to be approximately as far away as they actually are.  This is very important when navigating at night and you will quickly see why Nite Track instills the confidence it does. 
Mounts:
Nite Track units may be mounted with any 1/4-20 mount. A machined mounting plate on the bottom of both Explorer and Ranger is compatible with popular electronics mounts such as RAM etc... How we will use our funding:

Funding will be used for fixtures, fabrication,
component and finishing costs to do an initial low volume production run.  We will also fabricate a mold and other
production related tooling that will allow us an economy of scale for long term
production. We have a solid supply chain in place with all critical components
fully sourced. All CAD files, drawings, schematics are completed. 



Stretch Goals

$100,000
Remote Controlled Pan/Tilt

A remote controlled Pan/Tilt OEM module has been sourced that we will integrate  as an added option to Nite Track units.  This will be a single cable integration providing the operator the ability to remotely move the sensor left and right 350 degrees and a tilt angle of 60 degrees.  

$150,000

Wifi Application

This will allow creation of an iPhone/Android application that will provide a real-time wireless connection to your smart phone allowing remote viewing and control of Nite Track. 






  Nite Track
  Specifications


 
 
 
 


Sensor
 
 
 
 


CCD
 1/2" format interline transfer



Video
  output
Composite
 


Lens Type
CS/C
 
 


Power
 12 VDC at 110ma

 


 


 


Illumination
 
 
 


Near Infrared
860nm
 
 


Power
 12 VDC at 500 ma

 


Beam Angle
10 Degrees
 





 




 
 
 


Housing Material
 Aluminum

 
 


Finish
 Powdercoat

 


Dimensions
5.875" W  x 
  2.375" T  x 4.0" L


Ingress
  protection
IP67
 
 


Mount
1/4-20 Tapped Holes  (3)

story:
Chinese Food Therapy Rx for Self Healing: Volume 1

Help us complete the next phase towards publication of this comprehensive book that provides valuable information and recipes that can assist you to support your health with healing foods. Chinese Food Therapy Rx for Self Healing: Volume 1. A Thousand Years of Chinese Medical Wisdom is the second book by Helen H. Hu, OMD, L.Ac.,  a San Diego Doctor of Oriental Medicine and Licensed Acupuncturist. Her first book, Body Without Mystique, helps the reader understand, in layman's terms, Traditional Chinese Medicine, the basis of philosophy and treatments. Now you can finally understand the mysteries of diagnosis and treatment plans that you get from your practitioner!

Dr. Hu's biography:

She was a medical doctor and a cardiologist in China, and was fortunate enough to also study with well known Traditional doctors, learning acupuncture and the use of herbs and food as medicine. She has been  practicing for over 25 years. Her biography can also be found at: http://www.bodywithoutmystique.com/about-the-author-dr-helen-h/

More about her practice can be found here: http://omdweb.net/



A Little About TCM: 

TCM (Traditional Chinese Medicine) teaches “food and herbs come from the same source.”  By using natural foods and herbs to balance the body, the body’s energy is restored which is crucial for wellness and longevity.

In our modern society, food and medicine are totally different entities, and nutritional values all point to supplements from vitamin A-Z, protein and fiber contents.  Unfortunately, we use the same modern jargon to classify natural plants and food.  However, we have left out something that doesn’t fit commercial jargon – the real healing power of food.

In Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) the three most vital components for life are Jing (physical body), Qi (energy), and Shen (spirit).  These are the so-called “Three Treasures.” A good diet not only nourishes our physical body and our organs, giving us vital energy, but it also nourishes our spirit. When Chinese medicine speaks of organs, it refers more to the energetic function of each organ than to anatomy only, as in Western medicine. If a person has a weakness in a certain organ and an imbalance between organs, as part of the treatment protocol, the diet can be modified to reestablish the balance and strength.

This book provides recipes for treating diseases named as in Western Medicine and different recipes to fit each Pattern Diagnosis by TCM.

     Our goal is to educate and guide our readers to choose the right foods for a nourishing life and for healing. It requires a life time practice to reach our maximum life span (heavenly age). It is called Yang Sheng (Nourishing life).

     Your contribution can help us finish and deliver a helpful book that is easy to read and use and can help you with your self healing process. The book has fairly large type and large headings and includes the original Chinese brush stroke paintings by Dr. Hu as well as well known Chinese brush stroke artist Yue Juan. 

The Draft Contents Pages, without page numbers yet:


In case the contents page pdfs do not load, the book is divided into several sections, with each section describing conditions in both Western terminology and with the TCM treatment patterns: How to Use This Book, What is TCM Food Therapy, The Healthy Pantry, Food Therapy for Circulatory Conditions, Respiratory Disease, Digestive System, Urology Disorders, Endocrine Disorders, Neurological and Psychological Disorders, Gynecology Disorders, and Auto-Immune Disorders. 

Each section has several subsections, for instance: in the Endocrine Disorders section, the book explains the disorder and provides recipes to assist people with Hypothyroidism, Hyperthyroidism, Diabetes, Gout and Osteoporosis. Each section follows a similar format.

Please note that this book is designed to help people who are under a health professional's care to prepare healthful recipes to assist the patient and their treatment plan. There are about 400 pages, without the final index included yet.

 We are looking forward to your help with Volume I's completion so that we can complete Volume 2: Beauty and Longevity. Volume 2 is complete as to the text, recipes and most, but not all, of the photography. The index also has to be completed on the book's 285 pages. Both of these volumes are  close to being finished and those of us on Dr. Hu's team are very excited. Preliminary drafts have been reviewed within a close circle and the feedback has been very positive!


What We Need to finish the eBook in Phase 1 & What You Get

We are two-thirds finished at this point: the text, layout and design of the book are complete, and is available in a Draft version (not for circulation yet) but we need additional funds in this Phase 1 towards: 

 1.  The completion of the photography and the purchase of copyrights to some necessary photographs. 

2.  Preparing the comprehensive index to label the categories, information and recipes (and attach the page numbers) to over 400 pages and about 300-400 recipes in Volume I. 

3. The numerous fees and costs to finalize the editing to prepare the book for publication as an eBook in different usable formats. 

4. Printing a very small initial print run for proofreading purposes to begin preparations for Phase 2 ( a later campaign): printing the hard copy so that the book is available to those people who prefer print. Right now, we are looking at a spiral bound version that will lay flat so that the reader can follow recipes more easily. We are open to suggestions as to later bindings, depending on what we raise in Phase 2 ( or in this Phase 1). The book is written with fairly large type so that people who may be ill or suffering from various conditions can read it with ease. This does make it a larger book, but it also makes it more accessible.

5. We can make do with about $2,800 in funds, bare bones, but we could use more in this phase. With more funds, we could do more food photography to illustrate the recipes with quality work, and we could move on to Phase 2, printing the hard copies. If enough is is raised, a larger print run for the book can be achieved, bringing the book to more people.

If that goal is not reached, whatever is achieved will be distributed throughout what is needed in Phase 1  in the most practical way. 

If a really substantial  amount is raised, an expanded herbal and food "pantry" section could be added to the the ebook and hard copy.

We are projecting completion in about 2 to 3 months, about November 2014, depending on how things go. We are hoping for earlier and are working towards an earlier release date.


The Perks! What You Get:

1. For a $10.00 partner contribution:
  •  you will receive an acknowledgment in the ebook's donor page as one of our project partners
  • updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures, classes and other developments!
2. For a $30.00 partner contribution you will be getting:
  • an advance copy of the completed eBook before general distribution, and partner acknowledgment in the ebook's donor page,
  • updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures, classes and other developments
  • We have 40 of these perks available.
 
3. For a $50.00 partner contribution you will receive:
  • an advance copy of the completed eBook before general distribution ( one for you and one for a friend!)
  • an autographed, hard back copy of Dr. Hu's first book: Body Without Mystique
  • partner acknowledgment in the ebook's donor page, updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures, classes and other developments
  • We have 30 of these perks available
  • Please add an additional $10.00 for shipping only if you want the hard back book shipped outside the U. S. 

4. For an $80 partner contribution you will receive
  • two advance copies of the completed eBook before general distribution ( one for you and one for a friend!)
  • an autographed, hard back copy of Dr. Hu's first book: Body Without Mystique
  • partner acknowledgment in the ebook's donor page, updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures, classes and other developments
  • We have 30 of these perks available
  • Please add an additional $10.00 for shipping only if you want the hard back book shipped outside the U. S.  

5. $110.00 partner contribution: In this special perk  you will receive
  • two advance copies of the completed eBook before distribution ( one for you and one for a friend!)
  • two autographed, hard back copies of Dr. Hu's first book: Body Without Mystique
  • you will also receive an original, signed brush stroke painting by Helen Hu. Sizes vary -- many are about 8.5x11 to 8.5 x14
  • partner acknowledgment in the eBook's donor page, updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures, classes and other developments
  • We have 10 of these perks available, so act fast!
  • Please add an additional $10.00 for shipping only if you want the hard back book and painting shipped outside the U. S. 

6. $140.00 partner contribution: In this special perk  you will receive
  • two advance copies of the completed eBook before distribution ( one for you and one for a friend!)
  • two autographed, hard back copies of Dr. Hu's first book: Body Without Mystique
  • tea or Coffee with the author, at a nearby location to her office
  • an original, signed brush stroke painting by Helen Hu. Sizes vary -- many are about 8.5x11 to 8.5 x14
  • partner acknowledgment in the eBook's donor page, updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures, classes and other developments 
  • We have 8 of these perks available, so act fast!
  • Please add an additional $10.00 for shipping only if you want the hard back book and paintings shipped outside the U. S. 

7. $240.00 partner contribution. A very special perk, only one being given:
a consultation with Helen Hu at her office in San Diego and:
  • two advance copies of the completed eBook ( one for you and one for a friend!)
  • an autographed hard back copy of Dr. Hu's first book: Body Without Mystique
  • partner acknowledgment in the eBook's donor page, updates on progress of this book and any new books, videos, lectures and other developments
  • We have only one of these perks available, so act fast!
  • Please add an additional $10.00 for shipping only if you want the hard back book shipped outside the U. S. 

There are just a few samples of Helen Hu's paintings in the Gallery section. These particular pieces may not be available when the perks are taken, but  has many pieces from which to choose.

The Impact

This book will provide help to people in understanding their condition according to Traditional Chinese Medicine ( TCM), and provides recipes to help support one's treatment protocol. It is a beautiful book to look at, and is easy to read and understand. People will have more tools they can use to improve their health.
Information and comments about Dr. Hu's first book, Body Without Mystique, can be found here:
http://www.bodywithoutmystique.com/blog/praise-...

We have tried to upload a few pages from the book into the gallery section, but something is hanging it up. We are still trying to figure out how to get them posted. 

Risks & Challenges

We don't anticipate any risks and the only challenges will be the normal process of editing and coordinating the publication of the eBook. Sometimes things take a little longer, and sometimes they go quicker. Since the book is now 3/4 complete most challenges have been over come at this point.

We have had a great team of helpers working to get this book completed and are confident that any unforeseen challenges will be met and handled with ease. We will update this campaign with each accomplishment towards the final goal.

    Other Ways You Can Help!

    If you  can't contribute, there are still ways that you can help:

    • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the book and the campaign.
    • You can send the campaign information out on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and regular email. You can use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Ivana Saveska is a lovely young lady from the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia. She cannot see due to having Retinal Pigmentosa. An operation to put in a retinal implant would help Ivana to see light, movement, shapes and perhaps even be able to walk down the street and read big signs by herself. Ivana and her family cannot afford the cost of the surgery so if you can donate any amount you can help Ivana to see.

Any amount donated will go directly to funding the surgery which costs approximately 7000 Euro and to any other fees, follow-ups, prescriptions, etc incurred from this procedure. Even if the full amount is not raised, all donations will still go towards the operation and / or therapies for her eye condition.

Ivana is a happy, compassionate young woman who loves watching (listening) to tennis matches on television. She loves animals especially dogs and to take walks in her town of Kicevo, Macedonia and visit with her family and friends. Ivana could see a bit until her teens but her vision then deteriorated to where she could no longer see. She is only in her late twenties now so being able to see something would have an immense impact on her life and her independence.

Unfortunately, Ivana's parents do not make a lot of money so they are unable to afford paying for retinal implant surgery.

By making even a small donation you can help one person to see!

Updates will be done frequently to let you know where we are in the process and how Ivana is doing.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign on twitter, facebook, google plus, etc!
story_txt:
Ivana Saveska is a lovely young lady from the Former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia. She cannot see due to having Retinal Pigmentosa. An operation to put in a retinal implant would help Ivana to see light, movement, shapes and perhaps even be able to walk down the street and read big signs by herself. Ivana and her family cannot afford the cost of the surgery so if you can donate any amount you can help Ivana to see.
Any amount donated will go directly to funding the surgery which costs approximately 7000 Euro and to any other fees, follow-ups, prescriptions, etc incurred from this procedure. Even if the full amount is not raised, all donations will still go towards the operation and / or therapies for her eye condition.
Ivana is a happy, compassionate young woman who loves watching (listening) to tennis matches on television. She loves animals especially dogs and to take walks in her town of Kicevo, Macedonia and visit with her family and friends. Ivana could see a bit until her teens but her vision then deteriorated to where she could no longer see. She is only in her late twenties now so being able to see something would have an immense impact on her life and her independence.
Unfortunately, Ivana's parents do not make a lot of money so they are unable to afford paying for retinal implant surgery.
By making even a small donation you can help one person to see!
Updates will be done frequently to let you know where we are in the process and how Ivana is doing.

Other Ways You Can Help Please share this campaign on twitter, facebook, google plus, etc!

story:
AMPSound Bluetooth Hearing Amplifiers are unique in the way that they combine the benefits of not one, but three different products into a pair of beautifully designed stereo headphones. Use AMPSound as personal hearing amplifiers, Bluetooth stereo headphones or a Bluetooth earpiece for phone calls. With the ability to enhance sounds, you’ll be able to hear the world around you better than you ever have before. Designed as regular in-ear earbuds, AMPSound headphones are easy to use, easy to wear and require no adjustments to give you the most comfortable fit.



AMPSound offers 16 levels of personalized sound. Whether you’re sitting in the back row at the movies straining to hear or in the middle of a busy coffee shop, you are in control of the noise around you.


Forget about fidgeting with bulky hearing aids and painful earbuds. AMPSound Bluetooth Hearing Amplifiers are easy to use and easy to wear. Insert one of the three different earbud sizes for a custom fit that feels and looks natural. 


Enjoy high sound quality with or without the boost. To experience the gift of hassle-free, high-quality sound, simply hold down the “Mode” button for approximately two seconds to turn on the amplifier. If you decide you don’t need the amplifying feature, double click the Mode button again to turn it off.


Enjoy music 24/7 with AMPSound’s compact “Portable Power Pack.” This Portable Power Pack allows for on-the-go charging and uses a built-in 3000 mAh capacity, which provides at least 21 cycles of charging. While you’re at it, feel free to charge your smartphone and other electronic devices with the Power Pack’s USB charging port! 


AMPSound is designed for everyone. Unlike other hearing aids, AMPSound Bluetooth Hearing Amplifiers can be purchased without a medical referral, making them accessible to anyone who wants a little help with their hearing!


Take your daily phone calls and music streaming to the next level by easily connecting AMPSound to your mobile phone through Bluetooth. Want to jam out to your favorite tunes? Utilize the aptX technology and listen to your favorite songs in high quality.



  • 16 levels for personalized sound enhancement
  • Removable battery capsules (2 x 50mAh, total 100mAh)
  • 3000mAh Power Pack that can charge mobile phones and other electronic devices
  • High-fidelity sound quality with built-in Automatic Gain Control (AGC)
  • One set of headphones, three different uses: Boost your hearing, answer calls or listen to music
  • Magnetic lock earbuds to answer and hang up phone calls - pull apart the earbuds to answer an incoming call and when the call ends, simply magnet the earbuds to automatically hang up
  • When AMPSound is in amplifier mode, they will automatically switch to Bluetooth mode when there is an incoming call. When the call ends, AMPSound will automatically switch back to amplifier mode 
  • Adjust the volume level of each ear bud independently - AMPSound will include a small screw that will allow you to increase or decrease the volume of the ear buds, individually

    HOW TO CUSTOMIZE THE VOLUME OF EACH EAR BUD

    Increase volume: Remove the battery capsule and screw clockwise


    Decrease volume: Remove the battery capsule and turn counter-clockwise


    **Turning the screw one time most likely won't result in the preferred volume level, so we recommend screwing it bit by bit and listening to it a few times in your ear to see if you've reached the desired volume**


  • Bluetooth Version: V4.1
  • Support aptX for CD-like quality sound
  • Dual microphone for noise reduction
  • Can support 2 phones connections at the same time
  • Voice prompt
  • Coin battery
  • Maximum saturated sound pressure level (SSPL): ≤125dB +-3dB
  • High frequency average gain: 118dB +-3dB
  • Average full-on gain: 58dB +-5dB
  • Standard frequency response curve: 300Hz-5KHz
  • Equivalent Input Noise (EIN) level: ≤18dB
  • Harmonic distortion: ≤4%





  • AMPSound offers affordable costs for quality hearing amplifiers
  • Comfortable ear pieces that you can put in and take out as easily and quickly as you like
  • Two removable battery capsules so you can charge one or two at the same time and always have power
  • Combined music streaming, handsfree phone calls and sound amplification features into one device
  • No medical evaluations needed, so you can pre-order AMPSound without a medical referral
  • Modern in-ear headphone design so you can ditch your old, embarrassing hearing amplifiers
  • AMPSound will automatically answer when there is an incoming call and will switch back to the mode you were previously in when the call ends 
  • AMPSound's coin batteries are imported from Germany. The remaining battery capacity can reach 90%, even after 800 cycles













We went through countless hours of research and testing to develop AMPSound. To us, the design of the earbuds was just as important as the performance, and we made sure to create the best of both. 

Initial 2D Sketches of AMPSound


Working hard during the design phase


Our first set of prototypes


Testing out AMPSound  in the temperature and humidity environmental test chamber


We have created fully-functional prototypes of AMPSound and our research and development team is now working on fine-tuning the audio and tooling fabrication.

At Jabees, we’ve been working on developing the best personal hearing amplifiers for quite some time. With our in-house production/quality control facilities, you’ll receive the best quality product when you receive your AMPSound in September.

Now, we need your help to make it all come together. Please, support our campaign and help us reach our goal by joining the AMPSound movement. We can’t do it without you!




How can we get in touch with your team?
We welcome you to visit our website, www.jabees.com, or our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/JabeesAudio/, for instant contact if you have any questions regarding AMPSound or our Indiegogo campaign. 


When will the first AMPSound headphones be delivered? When will I get my own headphones? Where do you ship?
Our pre-production will start in August 2016. The target for the first product deliveries is September 2016, but we will make sure to keep you posted along the way.


How do I choose my color?
You will receive a survey to choose the color of your AMPSound.


Is there a microphone included?
There are two microphones on AMPSound, one is for hands-free use, the other is for reducing any  background noise.


Is there a warranty?
We pride ourselves in giving our supporters the best user experience possible, but we do offer a 1-year limited warranty.


I have smaller ears, will the earbuds still fit?
Designed as regular in-ear earbuds, AMPSound headphones are easy to use, easy to wear and require no adjustments to give you the most comfortable fit.


Are the earbuds sweatproof?
Yes. AMPSound has a nano-coating to protect the earbuds and in-line remote from being damaged due to sweat. So even if you start to sweat, you won’t have to worry about a thing.


What happens if I change my address before you ship?
We'll make an announcement 1 month before we ship and you'll be able to update your shipping address through your Indiegogo profile.


What comes in the box?
You will get a pair of AMPSound Headphones a portable power pack, three different in-ear earfin sizes, three different single-flange eartip sizes, three different double-flange eartip sizes, and a USB charging cable. 


Can I answer or make phone calls while I'm in 'amplifier mode'?
Yes, AMPSound can automatically switch to handsfree mode when you want to make or answer a phone call. The mode will switch back over to 'amplifier mode' when the call ends.


Can I listen to music under ‘amplifier mode’?
No, you will need to switch to 'Bluetooth mode' if you want to listen to music.


How long can the battery last if I just use AMPSound as a hearing amplifier?
You can use AMPSound for up to 7 hours on a single full charge. 


How do I charge the battery capsules?
AMPSound comes with a portable power pack with built-in 3000mAh which can provide at least 21 cycles of charging 2 battery capsules.


How long is the battery life for music and handsfree?
The music playback is up to 5 hours and the talk time is up to 6 hours.

story:
Parkinson's and Mitochondrial Diseases Foundation (PMDF) is a unique organization, which is enabling development of new drug therapies to treat cardiac, neurologic and pancreatic diseases of childhood and of the elderly, which can transform the practice of medicine.  Rather than just provide symptomatic treatments, which do not prevent complications or progression of disease these next generation pharmaceuticals will maintain normal lifespan and quality of life for patients suffering from diseases such as Parkinson's, Alzheimer's, Diabetes, stroke, heart failure, deafness and eye diseases such as glaucoma and macular degeneration. 

PMDF is facilitating the development of a technology protects against DNA damage in mitochondria, which are powerhouses providing most of the energy required for all the work processes the body's cells perform.  This represents a new therapeutic class of drug with profound impact on the cause of disease and capacity to heal patients.  PMDF will become the a global leader in promoting the treatment of these common diseases. 

The diseases of aging for which we are developing treatments will be the primary social / political / financial agenda in healthcare during the years ahead.  This is the first patented technology to develop treatments for diseases associated with mitochondrial DNA damage.   A simple reminder of the significance of this life extending technology is to consider that mitochondrial function probably accounts for upwards of one quarter of the longevity of mankind. Thus mitochondrial medicines can make an enormous improvement in the quality of healthcare. 

This groundbreaking technology, is based upon mimicking the body’s own defense system, utilizing analogs of substances present in the human body.  For example the drug substances provide a means of preventing dopamine loss in Parkinson's disease and preventing islet cell death in diabetic pancreas. 

We have accumulated extensive safety data on the compounds, which because are derivatives of naturally based compounds are apparently quite safe for prolonged use in humans.   On completion of safety studies we will perform human clinical trials to obtain approval to market the drug.

Your individual talent and vitality and the enthusiasm of a winning crowd are the moving parts of a foundation whose impact is to enhance the health of nations and thus the joy of people.  Your activity inspires like minded enthusiasts to expand our cause.

Tel. No. (760) 436 -6895

Email vmmcmm@yahoo.com

story:
My Mother Suzanne:

Two years ago my mother was diagnosed with breat cancer. She eventaullay had to undergo a degrading, horrible, and painful double mastectomy. At that point we thought her cancer was gone or in remission.

 

A month ago she fainted and lost control of her bowels and bladder. I had her rushed to the hospital. They found her blood levels to be low. She underwent a bone marrow biposy. Another painful thing for her. Well, they found cancer cells in her bone marrow. Which means it metastisized. She saw her oncologist a few days later and more tests were performed. The results of which were that they found the cancer metastisized to her bone marrow, her bones, her liver, her stomach, her chest cavity, and her brain.

 

They gave her two weeks to live.

 

This was three weeks ago.

 

She has declined so rapidly we had to move her to a hospice, because her oncologist said the cancer drugs were no longer working and that she lost the battle.

Her hemotocrit was 18 two weeks ago. It is now 10. She was told any breath could be her last.

 

 

My mother has has a horrible life. In 1984 her husband committed suicide and she found the body, after a shotgun to the head. In 1991 our house burned completely to the ground and I barely escaped alive. In 2008 her dear son Daniel committed suicide. Now she is going to die with only two weeks notice. Her only dying wish is for her daughter to be taken care of, which I will do,She has no living will and no money for inheratince.  but I do not have the resources RIGHT NOW. That's why I need help desperately. Please don't send recommendations to contact civic groups that might help financially because I have looked into EVERYTHING. I have even contacted the media and they could care less. I absolutely HATE asking for money as we have always supported ourselves. But we are a family in desperate need. Please help in any way you can. We (and her) could care less about flowers now and at the funeral, so in lieu of those, please donate. Please pass this on to anyone and everyone. We were supported by my mother and so were her grandchildren. We dont know what to do.

This poor woman has had a terrible life, I just want to her die with dignity, happiness, and to be proud. She is the most wonderful person I have ever known and she will be dearly dealy missed. Please help in any way. If you cannot help, maybe recommend this to someone who can. People donate to charities hand over fist for lesser causes and if anyone deserves help, it's her and our family. 3/5 of our family will now be gone.

Contributions are 501k Tax Deductible (If contributed through paypal) Cedit card payments are not tex deducatble.

Please help in any way you can and also pass this along to as many people as humanly possible.

story:
One Life Foundation

No one should experience a sad, painful event at the end of their life  but a peaceful journey surrounded by love.

40% of people who pass away do not have hospice support. 20% of hospice patients are in an inpatient home. Here in Horry county 600 people have hospice services but there is not a hospice home easily accessible to them. One Life Foundation will provide compassionate quality care for terminally ill patients who need general inpatient or respite care in a hospice home.

I had a personal experience at age 17 watching my Mother being taken away from our home to die in a hospital. She was crying hysterically, not wanting to go. She passed away tied to a hospital bed in a stark cold room with three other patients and surrounded by uncaring staff. 

I am determined to help others never experience this.

One Life Foundation needs to raise money to start our project and dream.

All money donated can be written off on taxes as a charitable donation since One Life Foundation is a 501(c)3 nonprofit organization.

One Life to Love, to Cherish, to Honor.

If you personally cannot donate, please forward this information to other individuals or corporations that may be able to help.

Thank you for your support.

Carol Motter, RN, BSN

Chief Executive Officer

One Life Foundation

story:
What it's about

Longboards are awesome between point A and point B, but once it is at a stopping point and picked up, it is often a clumsy distraction for both skaters and people nearby. As MIT engineers and longboarders, we want to change that by making a storable compacting longboard, but we need help to fund our project.

 

Being President of the Skate and Longboarding Club at MIT, skating is a large part of my life. I take my board everywhere I go: class, flights, on-campus meetings, etc. However it often gets in the way once I arrive to my destination. I cannot lock it away like a bike, nor can I keep it near me without it being an awkward inconvenience or tripping hazard for others around me. Five other MIT engineers and instructors have also recognized this problem and have proposed to find a solution using student labs and machine shops. The goal is to create a longboard that can be stored easily and neatly out of the way, to be as well designed for storage as it is for motion.

 

The Impact

More convenient transportation is an actual issue, and as the popularity of long boarding continues to grow, this issue will affect more and more people. 

If the prototypes prove the endeavor financially promising, the idea may be carried to market independently, or used to gain industry sponsorship and take the project even further.

 

What We'll Do

Firstly, your donation wil only be accepted if we reach our minimum goal of $500. Nevertheles, all acquired funds will be put directly towards purchasing raw materials necessary to create proper prototypes. Machining costs will be generously donated by the multiple machine shops and laboratories at MIT. All of us dedicated would like to tackle it with all we can, and with the help of MIT mentors and generous machining and woodshops we will do just that.

Additionally, if we are unable to raise enough funds to reach our posted goal of $500, we will use whatever funds we do collect to begin creating proofs of concept and use those to further attract funds from other sources.

 

Our Tokens of Appreciation

We are not doing this without saying thank you though. We will show our appreciation for your support with: 

  • Homemade vinyl stickers
  • Skateboard-shaped keychains
  • Custom laser-cut grip tape

*See the "perks" boxes for more details

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate monetarily, we understand, but we would still appreciate:

  • sharing your experiences with this problem
  • simple words of encouragement
  • cookies for late nights, and
  • reposting to help us connect to even more people who could help.

 

Any support, reposting, tweeting, etc are all very appreciated. From students with a vision.

I cannot lock it away like a bike, nor can I keep it near me without it being an awkward inconvenience or tripping hazard for others around me. Five other MIT engineers and instructors have also recognized this problem and have proposed to find a solution using student labs and machine shops. The goal is to create a longboard that can be stored easily and neatly out of the way, to be as well designed for storage as it is for motion.
 
The Impact
More convenient transportation is an actual issue, and as the popularity of long boarding continues to grow, this issue will affect more and more people. 
If the prototypes prove the endeavor financially promising, the idea may be carried to market independently, or used to gain industry sponsorship and take the project even further.
 
What We'll Do
Firstly, your donation wil only be accepted if we reach our minimum goal of $500. Nevertheles, all acquired funds will be put directly towards purchasing raw materials necessary to create proper prototypes. Machining costs will be generously donated by the multiple machine shops and laboratories at MIT. All of us dedicated would like to tackle it with all we can, and with the help of MIT mentors and generous machining and woodshops we will do just that.
Additionally, if we are unable to raise enough funds to reach our posted goal of $500, we will use whatever funds we do collect to begin creating proofs of concept and use those to further attract funds from other sources.
 
Our Tokens of Appreciation
We are not doing this without saying thank you though. We will show our appreciation for your support with: 

Homemade vinyl stickers

Skateboard-shaped keychains

Custom laser-cut grip tape
*See the "perks" boxes for more details
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate monetarily, we understand, but we would still appreciate:

sharing your experiences with this problem
simple words of encouragement
cookies for late nights, and
reposting to help us connect to even more people who could help.
 
Any support, reposting, tweeting, etc are all very appreciated. From students with a vision.

story:
Namaste 

☮

My name is Emery and I am a crazy hippie buddhist witch activist youtuber dreamer and lover!

I am campaigning here to fund the bulk recycled glass bottles and 100% natural oils that will get my little business to a new level of passion and sharing. A small percentage will go to sticker paper for personal labeling!

The magnitude of what contributors will help me achieve is massive. This means that I can actually get this dream into action! It gives me a chance to connect with even more friends.  


  • I think this project is unique in that I will be talking to people on a more personal level than any other fragrance brand or anything like that. This isn't a brand, it's a tiny home run shop in the forest of Szada, Hungary. 

  • The total cost of these goods are as follows:
    - 60 natural organic assorted steam distilled essential oils = 450usd
    - 1 gallon (128 fl oz) 100% organic jojoba oil = 150usd
    - 100 of the 10ml glass bottles - 50usd
    - 100 of the 20ml glass bottles - 200usd
    - Labelling paper - 30usd
    - Indiegogo will take about 80usd if I reach my goal

  • If I don't reach the aspired total, all funds will go to as much of these goods I can obtain with whatever I am so generously given :) 



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Spread the word! Make some noise for a homey!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
I have had a YouTube video up and running for over 2 years now and I have been getting on average of 20000 hits per month.
(550.000+ Hits Total as of  Jan 7, 2012)
What this tell me is that there is so many people suffering from being Follically Challenged (Baldness).

       CLICK ON THIS LINK TO SEE THE FULL CABOKI VIDEO IN YOUTUBE
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yYxPJgt1GXg

Now a little about me. I am 57 years old and I have been suffering from Crohn's Disease for about 15 years and I have undergone 9 open abdominal surgeries and have been on every drug treatment known to man to no avail plus most of these drugs have a side effect of hair loss.

 At this point in my life there is nothing more the Doctors can do other then a Permanent Feeding Tube and a Irreversible Colostomy Bag. Given these choices I have elected NOT to undergo this life changing surgery because although it might give me "Quantity" of life, I know it would not improve  the "Quality" of my life.

Your now asking WHAT DOES A HAIR TRANSPLANT have to do with with all of the above? Well, I know that there is nothing I or the Doctors can do for the INSIDE, I am only looking to do something for the OUTSIDE. I believe that if I do get some hair restoration it will restore my self esteem and allow me to start feeling good about myself again. I do not know who said this but I AM SICK AND TIRED OF BEING SICK AND TIRED. not only that but LOOKING SICK AND TIRED.

I am only looking to my 20000+ Follically Challenged viewers per mon th on YouTube and you the Indiegogo Community that know how it feels to be bald and that are looking to somehow capture there youth again. I am not asking for much maybe a Buck or Two so I may find someone that can do a good Hair Restoration for me.

Some may say this is Vanity or Midlife Crisis. You may be right. If you feel that it is? then I Encourage you to find a local Crohn's Disease Foundation and donate that same dollar or two that that worthy cause.

Please remember that if you are not interested in my humble cause I would ask if you know of someone that is Follically Challenged Please let them know.

Thanks In Advance
Mike

story:
The official message from The Director of PCGHD: Dr. Mohammed Brighieth,  regarding what's going in Gaza: Dear friends wherever you are, The people of Gaza are suffering from  a Human catastrophe.  So we need all to come together to end this tragedy.  So I kindly apply to you to support us to help Gaza people, mainly Children. Finally we on both sides need to live in a peaceful atmosphere.

EMERGENCY
At preset due to the crisis we have URGENT need  for the following above and beyond our normal budgetary needs:
we need 10 generators, every generator cost $16,000 , every generator will cover the average electrical pull of 10 caravan, therefore  10  costs 160,000$. Also we need for each caravan electricity connection $60 which means $60$*100=6,000 $ = $166,000 USD

Right , now as we speak and type Gaza is still getting pounded and thus suffering at the hands. the Israelis and their  IDF which as a result is extending and intensifying the need for our services and programs, there. Trauma amongst people especially, women and children is deepening and it is important that we treat these scars as soon as possible.

please note the bellow information for your attention:

Urgent needs for Gaza people now:
1-Urgent medical support  first Aid Equipment , First aid materials such as iodine and medication packs etc. $12,000 USD
2-Urgent psycho-social support for families and children and psycho-trauma intervention to minimize the high level of negative emotions because of lose crises  $25,000  (one month)
3-Food supplies as basic as rice, flour, sugar and biscuits for children and some canned foods ) one package for each family) 250 packages, each package cost 170 NIS = 42,500 NIS / $10,625 USD
4-Offering urgent caravans for the families with demolished homes and they are living now in open areas of Gaza Under fire .. total caravans 100 , each caravan cost $2,750 USD= $275,000 USD
5-Offering clothes for children displaced by the demolition of  their houses-
  for $250 per family-- around $12,000  USD costs in clothing
$166,000
$275,000
$12,000
$25,000
$10,625
$12,000

_______________


GRAND TOTAL OF EMERGENCY NEEDS= $500,625USD  anything above will be warmly welcome and utilized, as well.

Urgent needs for Gaza people now:
1-urgent medical support equipment for first Aid, First aid materials such as iodine and medication packs etcز
2-Urgent psycho social support for families and children and psycho-trauma intervention to minimize the high level of negative emotions because of lose crises
3-Food supplies as basic as rice, flour, sugar and biscuits for children and some canned foods ) one package for each family) 250 packages, each package cost 150 NIS
4-Offering urgent caravans for the families with demolished homes and they are living now in open areas of GAza Under fire .. total caravans 100 , each caravan coast 2500 US dollar
5-Offering clothes for children displaced by the demolition of  their houses-
  for 250 Child--- around 10000 $ coasts the clothes

our team in Gaza:
Mr. Shaban Mortaja- leader of the team
Mr. Sofian El Sammak: psycjologist
Mr. Mohammed Yousef- social worker
Mr. Adel Zagout-Social worker
Mrs: Firyal Hellis- social worker
Mr. Yahya Shamali- Social worker
Dr. Abdel Aziz Thabet-Psychiatrist
Dr.Nasir Abu Al Atta- community activist

Hussein Haniyeah- Director We Are Gaza ( On the ground team )  00972592512537

John Dabis - Co Director of PCGHD  ( On the ground Gaza) 00972599682578

Dominga Luna - Founder " We are Gaza"  & PCGHD Member (810) 299-2747 USA.



note please: these needs above are so urgent and they mentioned by our team leader from Gaza...they need them as an urgent relief
the more Affected areas are : Khan Younis, Rafah, Al SHajaeyah, Al Zaitoun and Jabalya Camp and Al Shateea Camp .


Your support right now will make a difference. This ancient conflict between peoples of different faiths continues to be deadly, especially to the children who are our future. We must work together to save our children from this ancient cycle of hatred and destruction.

Thank you for all your support

PCGHD

We Are Gaza

Hand In Hand for Palestine
